An awesome game, and one I can definitely understand why it's called a modern classic!  Catan is a simple game to pick up, but has a great layer of strategy in terms of where to build to help you acquire resources, where to move the robber, and when to buy and play development cards.  You really can't stay out of each other's way in this game; if you want to win, you have to do some blocking and backstabbing, which makes the game a lot of fun.  My two slight knocks against the game are that the game is only for 3-4 players and requires hacks or expansions to do 2 or more than 4 players, and a blunder early on is typically so significant that, unless your opponents make a similar one, you will never recover and are just on a slow march to an inevitable loss.
Great to play - sometimes it is more luck on who will get diced their numbers more, so this gets winning point

One of the classics that often introduce new players to a style of board game outside of the traditional American "Milton Bradley" games.  The type and feel of each game is very much dominated by the board set up and the personalities of the players.  Dice can dramatically swing the outcome of the game, so using the deck of cards instead of the dice can even out the distribution and help eliminate the "bad luck" component.  Personally, I feel that luck is a part of the game and figuring your way out of a crappy situation is part of the fun.  Great game to play again and again; and a great way to bring new players into Euro-style board games.
Much fun for the whole family! The attention span is a better fit for age 10 and up.

Gioco che ha fatto conoscere gli autori tedeschi in tutto il mondo. Semplice e affascinante, piace sia agli incalliti che ai neofiti. Tra le geniali idee che ne hanno decretato il successo planetario: le trattative per gli scambi di carte tra giocatori, la mappa componibile e sempre diversa, l’assenza di tempi morti in attesa del proprio turno. A lungo andare, può pesare la componente fortuna legata ai dadi, ma resta perfetto per i tornei: veloce e mai banale.

Ed. Devir. Es el primer juego - moderno - que elegimos para integrar nuestra ludoteca. Ideal para iniciar gente. Nunca falla a la hora de presentarlo.  Recomiendo enfundar las cartas y comprar bolsitas para los componentes.

I can not count how many times I have played this game at this point. Well over a hundred I'm sure counting the times I've played with the seafarers and cities and knights expansions. Not to mention star trek catan as well. Some people grow tired of this game after a while and others like myself just don't. Either way, most people will end up playing this game many times because it holds a very high replay value. It's strategic enough to offer a challenge for more seasoned gamers but easy enough to teach the base game in just a few minutes. The expansions also hold great additional content if you find yourself looking for more variation. And the cities and knights expansion makes the game far more intricate. This will always be a game that I have in my collection.

The gaming industry has changed and grown since the mid-1990s, but Catan will always hold a special place in my heart.  I still enjoy playing it a few times/year, and it won't be leaving my collection any time soon.

You have to plan your towns very well or you'll be losing from the first turn. Add Catan to your collection, you won't regret it.

I really enjoy the trading part of the game that gives a lot of interaction even without direct conflict. Multiple ways of scoring.   This was my go to game for introducing players to board gaming. They never really understood how to win the first game but almost everyone wanted to play again.  Now maybe ticket to ride would be better but that is a bit to easy\limited for me.   It doesn't get very much play anymore but when we do I always enjoy it.   Cons If you are tied down early it can be a boring stretch until finished.   House rule? If you roll a seven You move the robber. Makes it a lot more fun and do not double punish you for the roll. (Note that we had two different ways of handling the robber in the rules so this might be the original way of using him. If not make it so :)
Love this game board.  It's something the whole family can play. The randomness that can happen is something that can be bothersome for advanced players but some of the expansions clean that up.

Juego familiar y muy rejugable, apto para todos aquellos que no se frustren con los dados, aunque el juego es mucho más que eso, debemos tener en cuenta los lugares de edificación, ser buenos haciendo tratos y estrategias, para llegar a desarrollar de la manera más exitosa nuestras ciudades, muy recomendable.

Overall great game. As many have said before great gateway game because the rules aren't difficult but there is enough depth to keep more experienced gamers engaged. Many expansions expand and continue to add to the game, but the base game is a staple in gaming. Personally enjoy most with 4-6 if you have the 5-6 player extension even though some players can get surrounded pretty easily
A simple and fun game to get introduced to board gaming.
Come on. Everyone loves Catan. It's a perfect Euro-Game. Brilliant mix of strategy and luck. It's hard for me to say anything against Catan, I love it.
A ingenious way of dice rolling without feeling that victory is a question of luck. For me, one of the essencials.
A bit too much luck and not enough strategic depth keep this one from being a 10 for me, but this is always fun to play and a real classic.

A classic for a reason. Seems like most people who aren't serious board gamers enjoy it for the same reason I do: the trading and negotiation, while more serious gamers often dislike the randomness of the dice, and/or the human element of the dealmaking. Great replacement for Monopoly
Great game for playing with friends. Not too long a playing time. Feel like it gets a bad rap on here.
First euro game in my shelf. I start to learn more about another euro games with this board game. Catan expansions are better.
Responsible for me getting back into board games. Many people hate on it now because it is popular. Still will play it as often as friends want.
One of my favourite games, best with Seafarers expansion.

I struggled with this rating.  If you'd asked me in 2003, I'd have given this in 10.  I grew up playing classic American games (Monopoly, Stratego, Risk, etc.) and this was the first "eurogame" I played.  I played this game exclusively for a couple of years and then though "if I have so much fun playing this, maybe there are other, even better games out there!"  Then I got Puerto Rico and the rest was history.  I played this again a few months ago for the first time in years and kind of hated it.  Just so random.  But if you're just getting into the hobby this is a great place to start.
This game is very easy to understand, and enjoyable for most people.
Me encanta. Nos divertimos mucho con amigos y familia. Excelente para iniciar a personas que no juegan juegos de mesa.
Es un gran clásico para introducir a los jugadores no tan experimentados, es muy dinámico, y entretenido, con las expansiones se le puede agregar más vida y diversidad al juego.
Everyone called this Settlers, why did they decide the Catan part was the key word?
Probably my favorite group game for casual play.

Really simple and yet enjoyable game. Everyone starts with placing two villages on the board. These villages share borders with tiles of grain, wool and other raw materials. To get something from these tiles, you have to throw the numbers on these tiles with two dices. A little bit of luck is required. However, some numbers are more commonly thrown with two dices (6, 7, 8) then others (2 or 12), so the locations of your starting villages are important. You can use the raw materials to expand your two starting villages into a large network of villages and cities (which get you even more raw materials). Main goal is to first get to ten points (villages are 1 point, cities are worth 2).

Good game. I don't really like strategy because I don't like heavy thinking. So I basically lose every game.  But the group I play with have a lot of fun. It's more intense and perhaps fun with the expansion (Traders and Barbarians) and we hardly play it without the expansions, unless we are teaching a new person.
My gateway game. It involves equal amounts of bartering, luck, strategy and politics. Been playing this for years and I'm still willing to play it all the time.
Never gets old. Classic game, got our group hooked to boardgames so it has a special place on my shelf.
Great, classic game. One of our safe go-to games every game night. Four player game is particularly tense as the island gets really crowded.
Продавам/заменям за 240 лв. Цената включва и допълнението за 5-6 играча, както и разширенията Мореплаватели, Градове и рицари и Съкровища, Дракони и Откриватели.
The game that, like a lot of other people, got me in to more complex board games. Many hours were spent playing this my freshman year of college. It'll always be a favorite!

First time I played the game it blows my mind with the amount of possibilities. I left wanting to play more and thinking how can we make it greater. The expansions did that job for us. The core game it's great to.
My first euro/designer game. I still love this game but haven't gone too far down the euro path yet so maybe that will change.

I don't think there's anything I could say about Catan that hasn't already be said - one of my favorite games! I have to rate it a 9, however, due to the quality of the boards - they warp far too much in even mildly humid climates. Still, it's hard to beat a good game of Catan among (soon-to-be-ex-) friends!
Great game that requires strategy and can teach the basics of economics. I would highly recommend this game to those who are looking for a fun and competitive game to pass the time with some friends.
This is just a classic all-time great game.  Hall-of-Fame worthy! Great in 1995, great in 2017.
Fantastic game.  When I teach it to people who don't play many games, they almost universally enjoy it and want to play again.
This is my favourite of mid complex games
Tons of fun, replayability and great asthetics. Clear rules and simple to, get into.
Needs no explanation, it's Catan. It's great.
I bought a custom wooden set of tiles to go with it for durability and quality. The supplied cardboard pieces were frustrating at times.

One of my all-time favorites, but gameplay time can be a big restricting factor. I feel that a 3 person game moves very nicely, but going up to 5-6 players (with the 5-6 player expansion) makes the game really drag out as everyone makes their decisions.   That said, I love playing this game, and find it very versatile for making up / playing new variations with just the base. My 9-year-old twin daughters grasp the game just fine and have even figured out good strategies on their own which have lead to wins
My dad calls this game "Settlers for Satan" because thats pretty much how the players turn into while playing this. lol. I love this game.
Letterlijk al honderden keren gespeeld, en we vinden het nog steeds leuk. Ook de kinderen spelen dit al mee sinds ze 6 en 8 waren.
Play it less these days but had MANY hours of fun out of it over the years.
Fun, Strategic, Not too long, annoying that it requires at least 3 players
Very fun! I can see, now, why it's such a popular, well-known board game among geeks. Mark is the Clay King and I am Queen of Wheat.
Fantastic gateway game that I am always happy to play with newcomers to the hobby. One of the best at converting Non-Gamers into Gamers!
Makes an appearance every family game night!
The perfect party game. My own personal favorite of all time. The only drawback is that it can be played by a maximum of 4 players.
One of the greatest and simplest resource managment competitive games I have played. Great for families and simple to pickup and teach to a friend.
Simple and challenging. The more people that play, the better the game.
As far as I'm concerned, this is MUST-OWN. Not much that I can add that hasn't already been said.
Hits the table all the time with 2 expansions
Perfect for a game night with family and friends.  Wonderfully interactive and strategic.  Love it!
With is what started my love of board games and while dice roll relent will always hold a special place in my memory.
One of my favorite games. Not perfect but almost always fun.

Muy bueno. Persona que lo ha probado, persona a la que le ha encantado. Mucha interacción entre jugadores e ideal para grupos diversos con un rango de edad variable. Fácil de sacar a mesa y, de momento, muy rejugable.
Great if you enjoy arguing and negotiating with your friends.

All time favorite game.  Replay-ability was HUGE.  The family played it at least once per day for the first 30 days of owning the game, and at least once a week for the first year.  Expansions added so much, especially Fishermen of Catan.
This game ruined a family dinner. I love seeing players so engaged in a game that civility is no longer an option. Well done!
[A] A classic game that is easy to learn and play.  Best with 3 people.  Easy to set up.  Needs an official 2 player set-up.  All of the variants for 2 players have been lack-luster.

One of the most played games in the modern age of board games, Settlers of Catan (or simply Catan) is a building and bartering game that has you trading with your opponents and collecting resources to build the roads, cities, and settlements to try to win the game. A modern day classic to many who have played it and a game that helped me get back into the world of board games, Catan is a board game I play at least once a year and is so popular that it's even sold at big name retailers like Walmart.  If you have yet to play or want to get someone back into the joy of playing board games, sit down and play Catan, you won't regret it.
Excellent game!  Good dynamic, family friendly, strategic, easy fun. Forget what pretenders say about popular games.
A fun way to lose friends, second only to monopoly.
2015 Edition by Catan Studio 1998 Edition by Mayfair ( used to play overseas) well know as "Settlers of Catan"

Phenomenal game that almost single handedly moved a lot of people from the Monopoly/Sorry/Battleship world into much more interesting gaming.  I still enjoy playing it, and there are expansions to keep it interesting after many plays.
Fun game with multiple strategies to win.  Can play with my kids ages 10 - 15 and wife.  Good family fun
Easy to explain easy to play and very fun.

I've rated Catan quite highly, because despite newer, flashier, more challenging games, it remains a classic in my collection. It's the perfect gateway game to introduce new gamers to the exciting world of modern boardgames.
A modern day classic that I enjoy playing with my family and friends.

Have only played this with kids 7-12 and its fun enough with them and probably with adults also.  Even though it's "competitive," you are so focusing on building your town, it also seems more like you're "competing with yourself." Also the trading part seems cooperative.  One of the few games my wife likes (along with Memoir 44).

I've heard lots of hate, and lots of love for this game.  I grew up playing it, and although I now prefer less political and more strategic games, this will always be a great game to me.  It's my favorite trading game I've ever played by far.   One negative: I always played with my parents' copy, which was quite old.  Once it was thoroughly worn out, we had to update.  I have to say, the artwork in the new version is tacky and cartoonish.  Not good at all.  I really miss the old cards and tiles.
It's a gateway game.  Be ready to take the plunge.  But if you are on this website, you probably already did that.  :)

Catan seems to get a lot of bad press, but I can't for the life of me figure out why, I think it's great.  It's got such good player interaction - its not just the quantity but also the type: all of the trading, blocking, and the robber  aspects of it create this "screw you" kind of atmosphere that always seems to create really good banter around the table.  It's a good game to play with a range of levels of experience of gamer. The randomness of the dice rolls takes away a lot of the potential for a more experienced player to just crush weaker players, and means that even when you're losing you feel like "maybe in the next few turns several people will roll a 2, and my fortunes will change!"

Probably the game that started off the whole "nerdy game" phenomenon.  :)  Still my second favorite game of all time. (after Stone Age)  In my opinion, expansions just "muddy the waters" of this great game.  Although the aspect of being able to create sailing ships across water using a wood and a sheep is interesting in the Seafarers edition.
This game is a classic. You will always have fun!
Great game for the whole family! Best simple building and trading game that money can buy. You can't go wrong with the Catan base game.
One of my all time favorites. A bit based on luck which can be annoying but great mechanics and really easy to explain for newbies
Un juego increíble para iniciarse en los juegos de tablero avanzados

Bel gioco, ottima interazione. si costruiscono strade,colonie che poi diventeranno città, e forniranno ai loro padroni, materiali in base al terreno dove si erigono. questi materiali si scambiano per costruire o per ottenere carte sviluppo, ogni costruzione fornisce punti,le carte sviluppo producono sia punti che benefit. Il ladro blocca la produzione e ruba materiali. Il mio secondo gioco, non disdegno mai una partita... ottimo per neofiti per via delle facili regole, ma gioco molto strategico.  1)  Tensione di gioco:             10 2)  Profondità:                    10 3)  Durata:                        10 4)  Facilità di gioco:             10 5)  Controllo sul gioco:           8 6)  Grafica ed illustrazioni:      6 7)  Tema & tematica Integrazione:  6 8)  Materiali:                     8 9)  Interazione:                   10 10) Rigiocabilità:                 10
The game for my gaming group for a while, which lead to another app addiction.  Easy to learn, but hard to master.
Wonderful game. Probably the one that started the new age of board gaming
A simple game that is different every time you play due to the random board and the people you are playing with.
Great economic game with nice components.

Great family game. Never gets old. A staple for any collection. Catan is the perfect introduction to more complex board games. Fun mix of strategy and chance - great for a group of competitive friends (with beers haha.) Nice looking game. Different every time.
Perfect for all ages and yet such clever design.  Enjoy it every time.
Ideal para enganchar a no jugones.
Joe and Coralie bought this for my 58th birthday

This is the game that started it all for me and my friends. Our first expansion outside the world of Monopoly and Risk. Have logged thousands of plays between digital and in person games going all the way back to the early 00's.
A personal favorite. I’d like to try the two player version sometime.
Nice Eurogame, starting very long and boring sometimes...plays good within the family and friends
You need to be with the right group with the right mindset to really enjoy it
This game is cool. It is the game that got me into board games making it more special for me. I am also a world champion at it, and it has a very good system setup.
classic. began my adult journey into geekdom...
is a very fun game to play with friends and family, very easy to learn.

The game that got me into board gaming, and is still a favorite. Even though there is a significant luck factor to this game (which will likely turn off hardcore gamers), Catan should be in every board game collection.  The Epic Win ... Why I still love Catan: Nothing quite compares to being pathetically down-and-out ... written off as the player who has no chance ... wanting to blame the dice, but knowing you made some poor choices ... but then ... though a series of unpredictable events ... combined with reluctant alliances ... followed by a few key placements ... coupled with the correct physiological warfare pitting opponents against each other ... having the stars align just right .... like a flash in the night, you manage to pull 180 with a point shifting victory that nobody saw coming ... and all they can do is sit there - jaw dropped - wondering what just happened. That excited/nervous/poker-faced feeling for 15 rounds or so when you see how you might possibly win ... but know you probably won't ... and then somehow pulling it off ... priceless.  [b]Expansions[/b]: [url=https://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/325/catan-seafarers]Seafarers[/url] & [url=https://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/2807/catan-5-6-player-extension]5-6 player[/url], [url=https://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/86669/catan-scenarios-helpers-catan]Helpers of Catan[/url]
Love this game and havent got any tired of playing it as each turn it feels like a new game when you set up the board randomly
My gateway to this hobby. Great game
landmark game... enjoyed the online version years ago

Love a game of Catan whenever I can get it. Great for killing an hour or so and very easy to learn. Heavy with the possibility of strategy but also very capable of being a light play. Would highly recommend Catan to all fans of strategy games. Civilization fans will particularly enjoy it.
The game that got me playing Board Games, For anyone who's just getting into games, this is for you!

We finally found our own copy of Settlers of Catan after first playing it in WI years ago (circa 2004).  We used to have our own copy, but my sibling "borrowed" the game and never returned it.  You know the type, they keep games they borrow from you long enough that they believe they are actually "their" games.  Anyway, we found a bargain copy in the USED games section at Black & Read and we were lucky enough to discover it had the 5&6 player expansion in it.  Having local game stores that take in used games for store credit, and that sell bargain priced used games is amazing to have in our local community.    Introduced our 7 & 9 year old to it and they really liked it.  At one point our older son needed a resource and our youngest traded him 1:1 for what he needed.  We asked why he did it, "he's my brother and I love him," was the answer.  A turn or so later the older boy returned the favor by using the Robber on his generous little brother.  The little guy said, "but I traded with you."  When the older boy insisted he was going to rob him anyway...the little guy said, "No snuggles for you tonight!"  The boys both love this game and play with different strategies.  Our youngest likes to try to win with just two settlements, a port, and development cards and longest road and biggest army.  Mom loves building cities early.  Dad thinks he can trade his way to victory.  The oldest boy tries a different strategy every play, and is aways there a turn away from winning.   A family favorite for a reason.
My family gateway game. Hooked and on the journey for more complex stuff coming.
I have made so many Catan new fans, I took it to many friends parties and now they love it, it changed their life jejejej. Sometimes I even get tired of it, but they dont.
i know it really only deserves half it's praise, but i would totally play this overrated classic whenever asked to.
Lots of fun and equally balanced. Great game to teach new gamers to get them interested in gaming.
A classic of its time. Sometimes there is nothing to do but bargain though, which can get dull depending on the group.
This is a fantastic game.  It gets even better with some of the expansion packs!
The game that got us hooked on modern board games.  Great modular design.  Expansions add variety.  Still enjoyable to play due to its relative simplicity
Toujours excellent même après tant d'années et la diversité ludique qui a explosée, une partie de Catane, ça ne se refuse pas !
Fantástico para no jugones y para jugones. Sale muchísimo a pena. Qué decir que no se haya dicho ya de este grandísimo juego.
Excellent introductory board game that is easy to understand but I would say difficult to master. I play this frequently with friends and family.

This is the one that initially got me into board games!  + Infinite number of ways the tiles can be placed (even better with expansion pack) + Requires some strategy and trading with other players +Easy to learn  The only downside is that you can't really play with just 2 players for this game.

A really fun economy and set collection game.  Catan can really bring out the competitiveness out of people.  Only flaw is if you get stuck with a bad board or trapped the game can have a lot of wasted turns.  Plus, someone almost always hoards a resource and gets the ire of the rest of the players.  Then again, that's also part of the fun.
A must have, excellent combination of mechanisms.
Oldie but goodie, pretty much everyone should own this game.
Will play this pretty much anytime. Great, classic strategy game!
Always a great classic. Had tucked away for a while, then recently played it again and as usual it was really enjoyable.
This is a family favorite.  This is a regular staple in our family's Game Nights.

Wow, this game hits the table every time I meet my boardgame buddies. This can be a pro or a con, but this is the best gateway boardgame I own definitely. It sucks new players in like a black hole. A pure classic.
Still unique game in terms of trading and group dynamics which gives it endless replay ability.
Great family game. For some reason - it's a game we just keep playing with my family again and again. Easy to comprehend theme, simple rules, nice graphics and not too long of a game-play.
A true classic - always up for the game!
Played Catan for years and it remains fun as I enjoy switching up the board and easily add on different extensions.
Huge fan of this game.  Love to play it with friends and family.  Always gets competitive.  haha
Fun, simple to learn, with a pretty high skill ceiling and enough luck to keep things interesting.
Genial, un clasico entre los clasicos
I think this game is super fun! It is a short game which is very easy to play! We enjoyed playing this game very much!
Love to play this with the Seafarers expansion. Disappointed that my expansions came with a different set of graphics.
Love playing this game, but a bit too much luck can shift everything.
The game is good as always, but I really don't like the plastic village and towns (and roads), as the details of the models are hard to see because of the monolithic color : they need to be painted.
Un jugazo, me ha encantado!!! , Tiene una rejugabilidad que no lo dá ningún otro juego
Very nice and cozy game to play with family & friends during long evenings and winter nights. Though sometimes it's annoying if 6 or 8 never appears on the dices.
Casual board game that doesn't get boring. Luck is involved, but still it's worth playing.
This game is always pulled out on board game nights at my friend's homes. It was the game that got me into the board game scene.
It's Catan! What more is there to say? Probably the best gateway game for board game Muggles to get them interested in the hobby.

There's a reason it's a classic!  Stale?...I think not!  However, I do agree that the opening set-up can be a little too powerful in some games.  But if you find yourself in a less than ideal game setup then it's time to go for the upset of the century.  Also, don't forget to trade.  This game is about trading.  If you refuse to trade because you don't want to help anyone then it's not really within the spirit of the game, IMO.  If you play that way, I could see why that game (and many games) would not be desirable for you.  The good part about Settlers is the excitement associated with each role of the dice....everyone is interested in the outcome.  Half will yell:  "yeah!!!"  and half will yell:  "Noooo!!!"     It's just fun.

A trading game that is very fun to play, the robber can be a bit dull, but after reading online a good variant may be to not take a card from someone else when rolling a 7, but perhaps get to take a card that you would like from the bank.  That rule alone takes out exactly what is problematic with the game and the back-stabby nature of that rule. Otherwise, the game is fun, not too long, but also it is something that can be played with anyone as it's easy to explain.

My other favourite game, especially the msn version with the music.  Update: 9.8 => 8.9 After playing a lot more games this doesn't get played as much now but I still reeally like it, also there is more luck here than in most other good games
NICELY THOUGHT KLAUSE! my break into eurogames! a great game to intorduce euro games to others! simply great.

takes so long to set up, and then you can get in a bad spot ... but still I like it. There is enough luck that I don't feel too bad when I loose, but I get to do lots of planing, and that planing often plays off. (Seafarers expansion is an improvement.)
This is a very good game.  It is simple to learn, but difficult to master.  The variable resource production is a good aspect, but it is controlled by dice, which is a bad aspect.
My gateway game, still one of my favorites too. It is still early for me in the hobby though, maybe that will change.

One of the most enjoyable 4P game. Although dice is used but it is not totally luck based. Try it if you love Trading + Road building + Resource management. Furthermore, everyone is involved even when others roll the dice
The original “Euro-Game”, a great little game about trading with your friends so that you can screw them over. Perfect balance of luck and strategy.
Muy bueno, comercio, azar, interacción, engancha muchísimo y cambia con las extensiones, pero el original es una gran opción.
This was my introduction to german boardgames,now I'm hooked.Played it soooo much,I'd dream about it .Now, I spend too much buying other games(or so my wife tells me).
A great game for welcoming non-gamers to games. Simple, elegant game with excellent replayability, especially when you're incorporating the modularity of the Seafarers expansions.
Una buena partida a 4 jugadores no tiene precio

What else can be said about this game that has not been said already?  No wonder why it was game of the year in 1995. You collect resources (wool, lumber, brick,ore, and wheat) to trade them in to build things, namely roads, settlements or cities.  You get points for the builings, first to 10 wins.  I'm looking forward to acquiring seafears and knights and cities. It's become one of our groups favorites.
A classic. Best to introduce new people to the hobby.
I don't care how many heavier games I play, or how many better games I play, or how many people berate this gem. I don't think I will ever tire of it. This was my gateway.
The Original. This is what gets most people into Euro games. Classic game of resource management, colony-building, and trading.

One of those must-own gateway games (e.g. Ticket To Ride)for anyone wanting to play a game with people who rarely play board games. I have hooked many of my friends/family on this game. But, only plays well with 3 or more players.

Catan is a classic. I don't even need to review this game because everyone has played this game and if you haven't, you actually have and just don't remember that it was called Catan. There are a handful of go-to games out there for me that are easy setup, light-medium weight for chill nights or straight gateway games for new players or people who hate board games because they hate monopoly. This game is very rewarding each time the dice rolls that one resource you have been waiting for the whole game but also extremely punishing if you did not position yourself for success. There is definitely possibility and even probability for a runaway player who just absolutely dominates the round. Also, players positioned poorly will be punished relentlessly for about an hour and have to watch other players accomplish everything they need and more.

One of the very first board games I got, and still love. Even though this is a dice rolling game I find strategy always trumps luck over the course of the game. I love the game mechanisms and find they encourage the table to talk and everyone always seems to have fun playing. I also really like that 95% of the score is visible based on what you've built on the board, this allows people to stop the leader from running away with the game by ganging up on them, but there's always another threat looming so there's almost a social deception element as you need to bluff about your strength sometimes to encourage the table to gang up on someone else while you push forward with your plans. Can't recommend Catan, The Seafarers expansion, and 5-6 versions of each highly enough.
I was right in assuming this game would be fun, even without an actual army! I'd suggest having enough dice handy for everyone to have a pair... makes the game go faster.

If you have this game you really need to break out of the box and design your own islands.  Geography can be such a great variable in this game, making it not only more challenging but more playable.  If you have trouble, ask me how.
I almost NEVER choose it, because I'd rather learn something new, but this is a GREAT game.

Fun game... by far my most popular. I enjoy many other titles more... but couldn't ever turn down a game of this(not that there's many I would turn down, lol). With an estimated 300+ plays, it's definitely my best investment in my collection, and, as time goes by, I'm coming to appreciate shorter versions of games.
Best game to introduce non-gamers to hobby gaming.
This is the gateway game into gaming for our family. NEVER met anyone who has not liked this game.
A very well done and well rounded game. Many expansions keep it interesting, definitely a classic.

Real fun game when played with the right people AND when you're not crunched on time. Game can go fast, but I've also had games go well over two hours due to randomized tile placement. The length isn't a bother for me, but I can see how it'd be a turn off for some. In regards to gameplay, it's an excellent game that utilizes dice rolling probability, hand management, resource gathering, and network building all very well. Difficulty is low and will forever be an enjoyable classic strategy game for any experience level. Recommended Players: 4.

Fabulous game that probably cemented my interest in Eurogames.  Probably more luck than you think, but a really nice game.    "We shall not cease from exploration, and the end of all our exploring will be to arrive where we started and know the place for the first time". T S. Eliot.  This quote reminds me of Settlers.  You buy it as a gateway game, go mad buying so many other games that you take it a bit for granted, but when you come back to Settlers after a break, you are reminded again that is it simply a brilliant piece of boardgaming (18/12/08 - Rating 9). UPDATE: Push to ten in that it is the cornerstone game for me (5/4/10 - Rating 10). UPDATE: This is still a very enjoyable game (and still a 10) (24/11/12). UPDATE: My new rating system is to 3 decimal places, so that when I eventually rate every game, I can do a top 100.  This is still a brilliant game, which for me is still an enjoyable experience.  So, the 3 decimal places, I rate is a 9.728 (Dec 2015). UPDATE: Maybe familiarity does breed contempt for my views now on Catan?  I still really like the game / series, but there are now for me better board gaming experiences I would rather go to.  Still rightly a classic, but I think I have reach a point where nothing is left to surprise or further delight me with this game (Rating 8.741, Feb 17).

[2010/01/01] +400 plays before recording  Wow... what can i say, one day in college i went to my friends house and had my first "go" at this game... and it opened the door to everything else. catan is the gateway game to be certain  so i learned this game "in person" the way it was meant to be played... it is soooooo much better that way, but it does take a while to set up... i think that this game is the perfect game to intoduce your friends who arn't board gamers into the genre  the reason "in person" is better is that skill level is leveled out through trading... if 2 novices play with an expert, the novices will team up to give themselves a chance...  as you may be able to tell I've also played online. one day my 2 catan buddies and i were playing catan, and we decided to see if there was and "online" version... WAS THERE EVER... it was cool because we just used the internet version to facilitate our gameplay... everything else stayed the same, but we were able to instantly have a new map and new scenarios... somthing that would take 10+ minutes in person (also there was realtime scoring)  in addition to that, the internet community had the cities and knights expansion built in (1st time seeing that)...which i enjoy FAR more...  so after "discovering" catan online, we all became closet catan players... i would literally play catan for 12 hours straight always playing "just one more game" the difference about playing online is that trading is so less personal, and that it become just another function.... games go extreemly fast, and everyone you play against has a great understanding for the tactics... I developed extreemly good tactics this way, but eventually I overdosed.    I can still play catan, but now that i understand it so well, it's not as fun for me to play... everything seems too "random"  I highly recomend this game for anyone that hasn't OD'd on it... please play it in person a few time first though, The internet community is BRUTAL for people who are "slow" or inexperienced
This game is so popular there's a pizza version.  How bizarre is that?
The Fishermen of Catan The Great River

Playing this game was somewhat of a revelation for me. I was immediately taken with how this game combined competitive play in an area control game WITHOUT any direct confrontation or combat. I enjoyed the trading mechanic and "friendly" negotiation along with resource management, city/civ building, and occasional take that interaction. This was my favorite game for a long time when teamed up with the Cities & Knights expansion, but over time faster playing games of eclipsed this classic.
Really fun game. Even better with the 5-6 players expantion!

One of my favorite 4 player games.  A fine mix of luck and strategy.  You feel like you have quite a few options each turn and trading is awesome.  Great replay value.  Once you get comfortable with the game, I would recommend the cities and knights expansion.

Family Rating Breakdown:  A.J.: 9 Zachary: 8 Isaac: 9  Great game--it's a good thing packaging doesn't count in our game ratings, though.  Rules Modifications: None, but I'll note that the first few times we played the game, we made the mistake of thinking the harbors allowed you to exchange two (or three) or any good for the one specified at the harbor (instead of the other way around).
Classic 3 player Eurogame. Mid game can be a little slow, and island can bog with 4 players. Therefore, we use a "fast Catan" starting build-up.
Best introductory game ever,and a great game with the Cities&knights expansion

Update (Feb.'09):Very cool game, of course.  Don't like how the game length seems to vary a bunch though.  It has been appreciated by students in my study hall and h.s. boardgaming club.  Just bought travel size to shorten set up time.
Fun, replayable, and newbies can play it.  It's what got me started into gaming.

Players: 3-4 Time: 60-90 min.  Players place settlements on the island of Catan and attempt to build cities, roads and armies to be the first to 10 points. Players acquire goods to build these through lucky dice rolls and trading with other players. In addition, a robber roams the island and steals resources. Losing players can use the robber to catch up to the current points leader.

I admit it,its a game with dices so luck plays a major part in the outcome BUT since its the first "development" game I have ever played and since dices love when its about Catan I always want to play it and have great time! One extra good think is that can be played with anybody
Últimamente me he aficionado a la edición para Android
best game for beginners and also for non gamers have played it over hundred times not my type of game, but it is acceptable in some cases
Went in with very low expectations and came out loving it. Great game.
What I would pay to play a game: $7

Quick to learn simple game.  Not much going on with it and just the right amount of luck to have things turn around or give someone who isn't as good a chance.  My biggest complaint would be the opening setup is far more important than the rest of the game.  Could use some balance making later decisions mean a little more so a bad start doesn't need to rely to much on luck to claw your way back.  Games go quick enough though when that does happen to fix your mistakes in the next game.  Overall a great game that most people will enjoy.
One of the best game I've ever played
Great mechanics. has the ability to pull in non-gamers. PLay gets slightly old after 500 times of playing.
Great game, always different.  Most people beat up on the leader, but many times falling to last place means you might as well read a book.

The first "german" game I played. For the longest time, I thought it was without equal but I have since learned otherwise. The random elements can detract from the game at times, as once you are behind you tend to stay behind. This can lead to profuse muttering of curses. Still the standard by which I measure any new game. I have probably spent more time playing this (live or on the net) then any other game.
Great fast paced expand and muck you buddies up game. Ranon tiles make map... Bartering for commodies. FUN FUN.
A game I can play with my family, with my son and daughters. It is simple. Replayability for adults is not as high. Some kingmaker problems.
I have not played this for a long time. I very much enjoyed when we we first got it.

The German gamer's equivalent of a night at the craps table. "C'mon 8! Daddy needs a new pair of sheep!" The different strategies are nice, and the trading is a blast, but aren't we all really just hooked on the agony and the ecstacy of the dice?
I know people think that it has flaws but I think that it is wonderful.
Glorified bingo? You bet. This game contains a generous dose of luck. It is an addictive civilisation-type game.

A very, very fun game.  I have both the travel and regular edition.  The regular game is so much fun, always random and new, and, no matter how likely your starting spots should gather resources, they don't have to.  We played a long game of 4 people in which a 6 was only rolled twice.  Twelve popped up 6 times, 2 at least 3.  Cest la vie!

Instant classic.  Non gamers will like if they are analytical, very replayable.  Also very much fun with the expansions (particularly Seafarers, which allows for campaigning and variables such as "mystery" regions).
I usually play Cities and Knights now, but this one still gets my vote for being the original and the one I played for the last 7 years or so...
Streamlined and simple gameplay. More than a gateway game, it´s addictive and opened to some very interesting variants. One of the best games produced in the XX cent.
Great game. This was the first german game i've played. I like it better with the Seafarer expansion.

Took this one on my spring chorus tour. This ate up hours of bus travel time and never got dull. Can't thank Mayfair enough for this edition of Settlers. Only downside--The desert always stars in the middle.

This game was a little hard to get a handle on the first time we played: how do you know where to place your settlements and roads?  But it seems promising, so I bought it to introduce to friends and relatives.
Brilliant classic game.  Can be good intro game.  I must play it more and get over some personal hesitation I have about pulling it out and enjoying it.
A little too much luck for my taste, but a great game to get people interested in board games--easy enough to learn, exciting enough to want to play again.
The classic accessible German style game enjoyed by wargamers and non-wargamers alike.
Very very good.  The really old edition had much nicer tiles than the more recent ones.  Can keep on playing and playing.
Together with Carcassonne *the* game that got me into the hobby. Also one of the best games to get non-gamers interested (found the correct term: gateway game ;)
Some like it, some don't.  I do.

i'll still rate this game with a 8 but i'm well past the settlers burnout point, i've played well over 100 games of this game. my games club in college practically lived settlers, it was a religion. of course until i brought this copy in, it was die siedler we were playing. and we still use the terminology when playing or talking about the game.

Super-elegant. Game-play flows beautifully!  One gripe: the luck of the dice and the importance of initial placements can cause one player to have a dismal game.  My other gripe with this game is how hard it becomes to convince people to play anything else!
I have yet to meet anyone who has NOT liked this game!
It is one of those games where it is the best game in the world for a year and then after a while it starts to get old.
A great game. Gets better every time you play it. Its the kind of game you can teach anyone and they will like it. Simple yet glorious!
the classic - very tight and competitive in standard 4 player version, with a nice definite ending
Perfect gateway game. Has some strategy - mainly your starting position. Luck can be a problem, but can add spice to the game too, and help some newbies. Always fun to play.

One of the staples I came to later in my gaming initiation. The variable board and trading aspects make this game very interesting. Have introduced many new gamers with this game, and lured them to the "dark side".
just got this and think my rating will rise....

An old favorite, and a classic! Lots of randomness with the initial setup and, of course, all the dice. But the forward/reverse starting setup rule, and the wheeling and dealing of the trades more than make up for it. I still think it's a great game, but I just don't play it very often any more -- hence the slight drop in rating.  I wouldn't introduce euros to a total newbie with Settlers, without a lot of hand-holding: they'd get slaughtered if they didn't understand the importance of the starting set up, and trades later on as people get within striking range of the magic 10. But it's a classic for a reason! These days, though, I prefer it's descendants (e.g., Cities and Knights, America, etc.).
Many more plays before I registered to BGG!

The game that got me started with German games. I have the German version that Mayfair sold when they ran out of the first English print during its introduction at Gencon. My first game was on the large 3D table top set they take to con's.
I have played one of the varients on this game once and want to play it again.  This is a great game
The game that got me addicted to board games.  Before this I never knew that board games could be more fun than video games. Nuff said.
One of my all time favorites.

The game I played most during my college years, Settlers appealed to a lot of people and I always had fun playing it.  I've noticed that people who don't game very much like how you get stuff when it isn't even your turn.  It may not see the table as much anymore, but I would still play it any time.
Great game! First game I bought of this newly discovered genre. It keeps everyone entertained and into the game, which can be hard for family's who have game kings/queens that clean house.
Really fantastic game.  Trading, strategy... but you really need luck.  It is normal it is a classic.
This game got me back into playing board game consistently.  Its a good game but it can get old after a while.
My oldest kids and I love this game, and I went ahead and bought the computer game too (less goodness, but alright for solo).  Love the variability of the setup!
Like with so many others, this is the reason of me getting into boardgames again. A true classic in our family.

There is not much to be said about this amazing game. It plays quick, people may talk a lot while playing (I really like the "social" part of eurogames), and it is easy to teach for people who don't usually play boardgames at all.

Very good game.  Surprisingly complex given the fairly simple rules.  Weaknesses include a tendency to drag on a bit when there' s a general resource scarcity, and the fact that starting placement is so determinative of the outcome of a game.  Borders on a 9.
My gateway game. I'm still up for a game of Catan most of the time

Great game for hooking people that come over to your place.I have more people to play with now thanks to this game. This base version is the simplest and quickest to play of the catan series that I own ...yet to be proven to be as good 30 years from now
Good ole Settlers, I use it to introduce newbies, otherwise theres other euros Id rather play. ie Puerto Rico, El Grande, Modern Art, A '10' for introducing noobs to gaming though.

I own the french version of Settlers of Catan and the 5-6 player expansion.   Settlers of Catan is an excellent family game. Settlers of Catan gets played once in a while. My mother even plays Settlers of Catan sometimes which is great. It's her favorite.  Whenever she plays, in most cases I go to my brother's place to play so I get time to spend time with him at the same time. In a lot ogcases she enjoys putting a house on the 2 and the 12, go figure.  *UPDATE*  My brother got his copy of this game, so I don`t have to bring my own. Gave a copy of the 5-6 player expansion. Lately, when we meet, we always play a game. It has become a ritual.
Great game, but people tend to get burnt out. We play almost exclusively with the Seafarers expansions. I can't remember when we last played plain Settlers.
If we didn't own Cities and Knights, this would get a higher score.  >10 plays

A high longevity game by two factors: the modular hex map and the system dice sufficiently balanced. It's always a fun to play... until you get no resource by damned dices! ;) A must walkthrough for all boardgame players! After discovering more non-dice based game you will put it aside until newbies have to be entered in the dark side of euro boardgaming. ;)
Gateway game that got me into boardgaming beyond Monopoly and Risk.  Started here and haven't looked back.

If you have found yourself into gaming you owe it to yourself to get a copy of this. Play it for a while then expand with Seafarers (assuming you like it).  It's a great 'classic' Euro - our introduction to these games. We still enjoy despite having more 'sophisticated' games to play. The draw back with newbies is that we are so much better at playing than they are. Though that is now only the case after years and years of play.   Well worth the money then.
played it too much when it was new. Cities & Knights makes it even better.
The original settlers game. Once you really starts playing it gets very addictive ["Just one more game, so I can get my revenge"].
Classic gateway game. Perfect to introduce to designer boardgame newbies. A bit luck dependant with the dice though.

Good theme, good ressource management game. Simple rules with a good mix of strategy, tactics, luck and interaction.  Modular game that make every game differents. Appeal for the families and experienced gamers.
True classic, one of the best entry games.

Fantastic design...10 in that! But the games are loooong. And very competitive. If thats what you go for, it might be a 10 for you. I do have to tip my hat to the outstanding concept behind this game. I just wish there was a 1 hour version.
I have played this game more than any other I know of. Although I don't get it to the table much anymore, it still has a very dear place in my heart. Wonderful.

This is the game that got me hooked into euro style games.  Though you can get screwed by the dice rolls, you have a lot of control by trading and prioritizing builds.  The trading also keeps you involved, even when it's not your turn.  If you play often enough and for long enough, the luck tends to even out, and its a matter making good decisions.  I like that between the longest road, the robber baron, and special development cards, the lead can go back and forth, and someone can come from out of nowhere for the win.
First game of the european kind I played, and I still love it.
Still not bored playing this one (basic version). Excelent mix of strategy, tactics, luck and interaction.
I suppose this is the game that really got us into "modern gaming", since we were introduced to it by a friend.  We still play it quite a bit - an old favourite!  ****Keeper!

Wonderful game that has it all. Lots of conflict between the players who has to try to get some resources from other playing when they are not producing them. It is easy to learn, quick to play and makes us shouts at each other (for fun, of course).
Fantastic game.  4-player is very fun. Tons of expansion options. Another great "Gateway" game.  I recommend the border holders and a card sorter to make the game a little more organized.

Settlers is an odd game for me to rate.  It seems like it should be too shallow but somehow I always enjoy playing it.  I'd probably give it a 7.5 on its own account but it gets an extra point because of how consistently it clicks with people who have never played a Euro game before.

I really like the negotiations, and player interaction.  It's one fault in my opinion is how it heavily rewards those who are ahead.  Thus if you get several bad rolls in the beginning, you may just be patiently waiting for someone to win the game so you can start another one.  It is a lot of fun though, and very few games have even come close to being as addictive as this.
The more I play it the more I think chance affects the outcome - but I still love it!

I guess the thing I like the most, and what initially attracted me to the Euros in general, is the fact that in many of these games there aren't really any "turns".  You're involved during practically the entire game.
I continue to be impressed with this one.  Great to give dice-opoly people a feel of what a game can really be. [4]3-4

Very easy to learn, lot of fun (especially thanks to the trading). The only drawback is that a bad luck can make you just watch the game of others. It's not a game I would now suggest to play, but I will never refuse to play. A classic - still enjoyable even after hundreds of games

Gran juego. Muy sencillo y rapido de aprender a jugar. Muy recomendable para iniciarse en los juegos de mesa. Quizas, la unica pega que tiene es su elevado factor de azar, que aunque en las primeras partidas casi ni lo aprecias, cuando juegas mucho puede resultar desesperante.
A classic, Love to play this, one of the most played of all my games. thats all I can say that hasn't been said about Catan
This game is becoming a true classic.
THE Gateway game. Simple, with some luck, lots of interaction, accessible theme.
It is a good game - maybe picking initial placements is too hard for beginners and the dice will determine the eventual winner - but I'd never play it with the deck....

It's funny, I've played well over 150 euro and strategy games before I ever played Settlers and I wasnt expecting to enjoy it as much as I did. I'm generally not a big fan of dice (read:luck) however, this game is short and sweet so that's not a big issue for me. It's very exciting to me that there are so many expansions and ways to keep enjoying it. I dont currently see it wearing out its welcome.
1st real "geeky" (i.e. one no one had heard of) game my family played.

settlers is both brilliantly designed and potentially very frustrating, as failure to produce resources basically shuts you out of the game.  i use the event cards to minimize this problem.  i also tend to prefer playing with the fishermen expansion, which makes the coasts more valuable and increases your ability to do a range of things.  settlers is deservedly a classic game and i imagine i'll be playing it as long as i'm around.
It's always a classic with my friends. When in doubt, play Settlers.

Very good strategy board game, not that difficult to learn, yet more challenging and interesting than Monopoly, and with multiple ways of trying to win.  Great player involvement even when it's not your turn.  "[url=http://www.boardgamegeek.com/thread/150443]Welfare variant[/url]" (= Foodstamps) [[filepage=22173]PDF[/filepage]] is a must to minimize the frustration of randomness and too much dependence on luck, plus speed up the game and prevent runaway leaders (closely related is the [thread=1184279]Poverty is No Shame variant[/thread], which feels more like regular Settlers but just gives players some control over what numbers are rolled - see my thoughts on both [url=http://www.boardgamegeek.com/article/15951421#15951421]here[/url]).  Another option is to [thread=134095]roll three dice[/thread] and pick two.  Game play can also be improved and made more even with the Event cards.  I also suggest using a [url=http://boardgamegeek.com/article/15950941#15950941]score track[/url].    Here's a website that creates `balanced maps' for starting resources, and is even used in some tournaments: [url=http://bettersettlers.com/]bettersettlers.com[/url].  Also owned:  [gameid=2807] - Base game add-on for playing with five to six players.  As much fun as the base game with three to four players. [gameid=20038] - Potential to improve Settlers by eliminating some randomness and adding some strategy and events.  The Earthquake event can be a bit harsh early in the game though, so we've ignored that.  Overall, it seems to improve the game and make it more balanced.  This along with the Foodstamp variant are must-plays for Settlers of Catan.
It is indeed the classic that everyone says it is, and it ropes in the non-gamers like nobody's business; whether it acts as a gateway or a cul-de-sac, everyone loves it.  Wood for sheep, baby!

This is a game that strikes a nice balance of strategy and luck, and its pleasures and nuances become greater with every play. The luck factor needs to be absorbed since a long run of bad rolls can beat you down and create some very cranky players, but most bad luck balances out over several plays. I think this game deserves every accolade it has received and even writing about it now makes me want to play. This is a great game.  Update: After a couple of years of playing this seminal game, I stand by my original assessment. There are other games that have come after which I would often prefer to play now, but the fact is it remains the most requested and often-played game in my family. It also remains the most contentious, as the luck factor seems to make everyone rather edgy at least once during any given game. Still, it is often the go-to game on a night when everyone just wants to sit down and play something quickly.

A very very good game that I can't see myself tiring of. Simple yet deep, hard decisions. Only downside is the luck element that can really hamper someone's game. Also a very hard game to drag yourself up from last place in!
Either you know this game or you shouldn't be on boardgamegeek.
My first Euro game. It is still fun but doesn't hit the table much.

A great game that I often use as a gateway to get my friends involved in playing boardgames. Most people who are used to playing things like Monopoly and Scrabble are a little intimidated at first with the "large" amount of rules, but learn it pretty quickly and quite enjoy it after a round. The hardest thing to grasp is the fact that initial placement can have a lot to do with the outcome of the overall game.

German 10th years aniversary Gold edition.  I just ordered the Mayfair edition because I couln't find expansions for the new geman edition. OMG it's soo cheaply made compared to the german edition and UGLY too.  Best with 3 players. Very good with 4 players.  :kiss:Wife's favorite:kiss:
[b]Likes[/b] Easy to pickup, learn and play Just the right amount of luck and skill involved Top gateway game  [b]Dislikes[/b] Ganging up on the experienced player Bad rolls hurt alot
An easy gateway game. It comes out when my mother-in-law wants to play a game. Tough to get out these days with the regular gamers though.
Great trading game. Always play with Seafarers.

I'll always enjoy this - most recently played on a giant, 3d hand-made landscaped board at a Birmingham games convention.  Dismissed by many players as trivial, but I do like games with a bit of negotiation (here, the trading especially).
Number one family game non core for me.  Solid gameplay, for casual gamers.  Concept great.

A great game with a nice different approach to a board and the manipulation of pieces.  It reminds me a lot of the computer game Mule without the auction stage, just the development stage.  4 player games are fun, but I think that the 5-6 player expansion may just make it a bit too large and cumbersome, but it is the only way to get bigger groups to play.
Great fun for family and friends.
It's a classic. What else can I say?
oldie but goodie. Classic entry level game into European board games. simple strategy for your family to enjoy
Fun, interactive, and easy to learn.

Great game still. Play with my family all the time.  Even the 6-year old wins at times.  Classic that still gets played a lot.  Enjoyed it more with the fish expansion ($3 item). The cards are now getting a bit worn as are the hexes.

Had to open this one early on Xmas eve so my family could play three games late into the night. Great game. Enough strategy to keep me and my father  interested, but not enough to bore my sister and mother to death. Fun for the whole family.
Really enjoy this game. Has a bit of a runaway leader problem. Easy to teach. I can see why this is the gateway game of choice for many people. Quite the game. I have the third edition.

Gran juego. Por algo esta donde esta tras annos. Creo que el mas indicado para jugar con "no jugones". Su sencillez, su fluidez, y su interaccion entre jugadores en la negociacion lo hace muy entretenido y siempre gusta. Una contra, su factor suerte con los dados para quien le guste tener cotrolado todo, para mi es uno de sus pros.
Though I definitely always liked playing games, this got me to this site and opened me up to all kinds of games (especially euros). My gateway game.

I'm still trying to come to grips with the randomness in this game.  While I've only played a handful of games, after each game there's been almost zero  understanding among the players as to why one person won the game and others didn't fare as well - other than something like "those 5's were coming up a LOT!", or "you were getting robbed all game" (admittedly avoidable).  I'll keep trying.
e3ipno,me ligaki tixi,megalo replayability,polla expansion,omorfa components,poli pareistiko.an i monopoli synarpazei afto to paixnidi me8aei

Game in a Nutshell: Players compete to settle and secure the best spots on a modular island. Roll dice to collect goods, trade with other players and spend to expand.  Played as: 3,4 player  Played with: Seafarers, Cities and Knights, 5-6 Player Expansion, and Plain  Pros: Good mix of luck, area control, player interaction and replayability make for an excellent, addictive game. Serves as an excellent gateway because of enough familiar mechanics combined with some fresh innovative ideas.   Cons: It can be luck driven for players of equal experience. It's not unusual to see a person who benefits from some lucky roles early on have a sizable advantage as the game progresses.  Other: If you're reading this and haven't yet played it yourself, do yourself a favor and change that. It got me hooked to euros and more then a few people have gone out and bought it after just one game of me introducing it to them. However, having played this so much, I'd almost prefer playing any other game over this one given the choice. That still doesn't stop me from giving it big props for what this game has meant to the gaming community at large.  Best Use: One of the first gateway games people should be thinking of introducing the 'is it like monopoly?' crowd to.
Like everyone else, this is how I got interested.  Also my wife likes it so this is one she is open to playing every now and then.

My rating has fluctuated. I was initially turned off by the huge luck component and the "screw the leader" problem, but the truth is, although those complaints are completely valid, I always have great fun playing it, so I can't honestly rate it less than this.
Great for getting new players to enjoy board gaming.
I enjoy this game every time I play it. I don't care too much for the Cities and Knights expansion. http://www.boardgamegeek.com/article/478124#478124
Great game. It's the staple of our game nights.
Was my first introduction into the European board game market.. now I don't look elsewhere.
Good game, I don't get to play very often my friend that hosts our usual game night is not fond of it for some reason.
Don't...Don't put the thief beside my village.

This is a bit beyond my six year old daughter so we play cooperatively. The trading aspect is great as is the fact that everyone can get something on every turn. A beautiful board and a good combination of luck and strategy. Currently my favourite game.
Gateway game for so many of us.  Theres a reason for that.
Ranks just slightly behind Carcasonne in my book. Maybe haven't had enough plays yet, but the kidos also seem to like Carc better so it gets played more.
I like this game alot but with all the newer games out there it's hard to get this one on the table.

An absolute classic that must be experienced by anyone remotely interested in board games. The variable board setup and multiple paths to victory make every session unique. Unfortunately the luck factor is high, and when the dice just refuse to give you any joy, the game can become very frustrating.
Yeah, you can all nose look, but it's a great game with tons of negotiation and trash talk. And very skilled.
THE classic Eurogame.  If you haven't played this, go buy it.
The game that started it all for me.  It will always have a fond place in my heart, even if it doesn't make it to the table as much as it used to.  A classic.

This game reached the status of classic.  One of its originality is the hex-tiled board that gets shuffled and put together so that at each game there is a new board. Awesome for replayability.  But it is somewhat strict on the number of players: 3 or 4 only. (more with expansions)
This is the original US set.  I also picked up a set of black pieces and a partial set of purple pieces.  I like this set because it has crisp, sharp contrast in the artwork.

So far our most popular game.  Lawrence requests this one even though he hasn't won 1 game out of our 15+ games played.  He has come fairly close, but either me or Phillip end up edging ahead.  He may not be able to strategize with flexibility like we can.  His goals for winning seem to be one-track and he gives up if he can't accomplish his set goals.

Archetypal euro-game with more decision-making/strategy than the other pillar of the industry, Carcassonne.  A tad of randomness keeps it interesting, although wiley traders will bubble to the top.  I've rated it so high because of it's veratility in audience:  this would be a hit with a quartet of game newbies or seasoned strategists.  As long as the skill levels of the players are similar, the game will always be competitive.
Great game, and a good gateway for people unwilling to try "hardcore" boardgames.
Played this game a few times. I like that it hasn't got old yet. Every time it gets better.
My gateway game, and still one of the best 4 player games ever. Suffers a little due to the number of high quality games which have come out since on the back of it's success.
A great quick and simple game. We love it and no-one in the group objects when someone suggests we play. It is a superb intro game for newbies, yet holds interest for experinced players.
A family favorite for many years - our most played 6-player game.
The game that especially got my wife into gaming, and is starting to get her family into games.  Takes a little long for me at times.  Almost made a 9, but I can't say I always feel like playing it.
+ Catan: Navegantes + Catan: Ciudades y Caballeros + Catan: Mercaderes y Bárbaros
I've got wood for your sheep. What?

Ha pasado mucho tiempo desde que, siguiendo una corazonada, se lo regalé a uno de mis sobrinos. El juego triunfó absolutamente y consiguió, una vez más, que obsequiador y obsequiado duplicaran su interés por los juegos de mesa. El gran mérito de este juego es que ha sido el ariete del hobby y el hobby le debe mucho.

Its hard not to look back fondly on this game. Although I rarely ever play it now there was a time when it was about all I played. Very good game but I think board games have come a long way since its release and so it gets over shadowed and forgotten.

While not the great Grail it once was, I still rate this a 9. With knowledgeable players this can be completed in under an hour. It can drag a bit with new or slow players. Still, I enjoy the building and trading aspect this game has to offer. Keeps things social with trading, yet competition for space keeps things tense.  Still a 9, even with it's limitations.

Now that I've tried Cities & Knights, I am less in love with the base game. But it is a classic with good reason. There is a lot of race tension, can go really quick, and more interaction than most other games we play. Yeah, it seems light compared to lots of other games, but to me, it really has a great balance of *fun* and competition. The only real problem gamers have with this game is that it's been overplayed. And so many gamers are allergic to dice.   Still, I continue to be amazed at how much non-gamers love this and are willing to play this above any other Euro. Simple as this game may ultimately be, it sure captures the essence of gaming in a non-threatening way.

This game has a little bit of everything.  A little luck, a little strategy, a little co-operation, a little "screw your opponent" with the thief.  The thief's presence blocking a good resource tile has turned out to be the far greater threat than the card he steals.  The only trouble is that it's a bit finicky with 2 players, so we don't get to play it that often.  And there are so many exciting games to play when we have enough people, this one doesn't get the attention it deserves.

The very definition of a solid game. Reliable, dependable, you know what you're getting every time you open the box. You do need to take extended breaks from it every so often, but in general it is very playable.

CLASSIC!! Simple rule but with many variations. Strategy. Fast play. Recommend 3er for normal set. One of my favourite game in BSW. Difference between experienced players and newbie may not too far. Need to focus on every moment, initial setup, your development plan, trading port, not to exposure too much unless you will be target

This game is the ultimate "gateway drug".  If I'm thinking about getting someone into gaming, I always show them Settlers, and they ALWAYS love it! Some friends complain that it's too random, but I still get a good strategic feel out of it.  You do need the dice to work in your favor though.  I'm a big craps fan, so the dice give me a cheap thrill.

Enough has already been said on this game.  I was late to it, but it is as good as all the praise it has received. (Had this game as a 10, but moved it down to 8.5 as I now have much more experience with board games, and can recognize its limitations.  8.5 is still a great game though!)
Even my parents like this one. Haven't grown sick of it yet!
I have no complaints about the base game of Catan. But I will say that Cities & Knights is even better.

I don't care what everyone here says, this is an incredible game to me. Sure, dice luck is a factor, and there's been games where I'm sitting on numbers 5,6,8,and 9 and I'm only able to build just one road by the end of the game, but I enjoy it. The interaction is fun, and is both light enough to attract casuals, and heavy enough to keep others interested. As my collection grows, I still don't mind breaking this out every now and then.
Great game to introduce your friends and family to the world of trading and building board games. A must have for the any board gamers.
Endless replay value. Although I only like to play with two opponents, anymore and you can easily get stuck with no way to expand and get VPs. A good game overall. Small learning curve.

Introduction to gamer's games. Low complexity. Easy difficulty. Medium luck. A classic.  Place and build settlements to gain access to resources and harbors.  Fun and easy to learn, yet still enjoyable for serious gamers.
Every game playing household should have a copy.
A classic and always fun. This, Carcassonne, and Ticket to Ride are the triumvirate of perfect gateway games.

I understand why some people mark it down after playing more sophisticated games but I think its balance of new ideas (when it came out), relatively short play time, accessibility (my 80 something parents can cope with it) and replayability (often obsessively on the internet in my case) make it an all-time classic.

A classic and my entry into modern board gaming. I still play it at least yearly with a large group of friends and while the gameplay may have been supplanted by others, I can't think of anything that will replace it as a sentimental pick.
Now a classic, having the most games played due to its mainstream, co-ed appeal.  Few games have the kind of "wheeling 'n dealing" that Catan offers.
Tailored-made version but much better than the commercial version!  Some new tiles have be added.
Number diversity is always better than goods diversity.   The Fisherman Expansion is fun, but Cities and Knights takes this to another level.
Classic, Simple, and hard to master. Easy to learn, and can work as a great family game, or a game to bridge inexperienced gamers into the world of Board Games.
the third game we show to newcomers of our bi-weekly gaming day.
First "Euro" board game I played, pretty much started Catan fever in my family for months.  Still my favorite game so far.

Catan won too many compliments. Now I just talk about the cons. First, the number of players are strict, only 3-4. Second, as a gateway game, it takes too long for non-gamers to focus on it. Half a hour should be better. So I guess that's why Catan is gathering dust on the shelf. It's definitely a great game but still I feel sorry for it.

I gave this as a gift and it sat unplayed for about eight years. After that I read the rules and vowed to play. About a month after that, I found my own copy at Goodwill and actually played and could kick myself for not playing sooner.  What this game really did for me was become a gateway game for my wife and another couple. When I was with the three of them, we usually just played cards or dominoes.  This truly opened up the horizon for them and since then, I have introduced many more games that went over really well. I now have two "groups" of players which means games come out that much more frequently.

El nuevo clásico entre los clásicos, y sin duda el juego de mesa más exitoso de las últimas décadas, que ha servido de puerta de entrada a la afición para muchos jugadores. Lo cierto es que se trata de un diseño brillante, que logra aunar mecánicas de construcción, desarrollo, comercio y azar con unas reglas asequibles para todos los públicos.
its a game thats easy to play, but still fun after many plays
The game that brings me into the gaming world :)

The production values are average and the gameplay isn't terribly diverse, but the randomly assigned board makes each game exciting and different. Players need to plan for VP growth as well as expansion in order to get to the better resources before their rivals or so as not to get webbed into a corner. Haggling with friends (or frenemies) in order to get resources to flip a wasted turn into something productive is always fun.
Gioco ben fatto e appassionante.Bella la grafica
Very fun game. I'm always disappointed when someone wins, not only because I always lose :D, but also because you work a long time building your 'settlement' and suddenly it was all in vain ^_^
Nice game that suffers from stalling that can occur with poor dice rolls.
Classic gateway that I still enjoy. Many unrecorded plays.
This is my "gateway" game that started me playing  board games.  Everyone can play it and understand it right away.
Le jeu qui a révolutionné le jeu (de l'ère Milton Bradley).  Le classique des classiques. Plusieurs s'en sont inspirés et l'ont dépassé... mais il faut lui rendre honneur !
synonym for the second gaming spring!

Great game to play with everybody!  Build towns, get resources and be the first to get 10 points. Each game is different, and you will need a bit of luck to get your resources, but if you play well you can manage to win.  It only has one drawback: If you don't know where to build the first towns you can make a bad decisition and the rest of the game will be boring and frustrating. So it's very important to help new players in this step.
Uno de los juegos indispensables, de administración de recursos, que todos deberían tener en su arsenal básico de juegos.
A classic. Still fun after a hundred play throughs, and definitely an icebreaker into the world of gaming past Risk, and Monopoly.
Fabulous game for the whole family.It`s a perfect one for these who enter the world of boardgames.It gives lots of fun for all the players. A must have game.

This was my gateway game as an adult back into the boardgaming world.  People complain of randomness but I don't mind it at all.  To me it's part of the game. Like in Monopoly if you don't get your rolls you're not going to get Park Place and Boardwalk.  However, there is so much more here in terms of strategy and different paths to victory.  It's a great gateway game and a very fun game which is the most important point above all other criteria when evaluating a game for yourself, whether you're into strictly highly strategic games with no luck or a newbie who loves high change light games.  For me, this is a great family fun game in the Medium to Light category, played in about an hour and we always have fun playing it. There's a bit of player interaction with the robber (you can choose to gang up on the leading player to an extent), and trading cards with others, creating longest road or largest army and stealing the points from the current leader, or blocking opponents paths with your roads.  Haven't had a chance to add the expansions which I think would allow one to tailor the game and make it even better for them and longer.  As you can tell from the way it exploded in North America as a gateway game it appeals to a higher percentage of the population and non-gaming people than most other games.
