Some people just don't want or can't handle too complicated and strategic a game.  They want it medium/light for a reason - to relax and have fun and Catan hits the spot extremely well!  I'll always remember it as the game that got me back in...and Love It!

Preferable due to length of play and easier/more inviting for casual players than some similar games.  I find that eventually it only seems preferred with 4 people, despite it working decent with 3, there are other games I'd rather play with 3.  Settlers is a game I need to be in the mood for, but when the mood strikes, it's always a good choice.
Includes 5-6 Player Expansion and Helpers of Catan
This is one of the 2 ultimate classics along with Monopoly, expect people to ask and want to place this one!
Great game to play with friends.  Always a favorite for a game night.

Solid trading game.  The dice are a double edged sword; On the one hand, the randomness and the flow of the game puts more focus on the actual trading and less on just having a full proof strategy, but it can also put you in a position you can never recover from.  This is a great game, but I can see it being frustrating to play if you over play it and find yourself the victim of poor dice rolls and the robber.

Pros: - The board and tactile feel of pieces - Strategy in trading system - Every player can be constantly engaged  Cons: - Would prefer more variety - Not as easy for beginners to pick up as other games

Was bought this as a present shortly after I got back into board gaming, and have played it too many times to count since.  I know it's got it's detractors, but I LOVE it! AND it's gotten toooooons of my NGFs into gaming, so more people to play with. YAY!!!
A friend's copy of this was the first modern boardgame I had played. I really enjoy playing this even after all these years. It is a classic.
New favourite with the wife.  Great game with loads of replayability
First "designer" game I purchased. Opened the gate to all the other games I have now. Nice combination of strategy and luck involved.

This is probably the game I've played the most. Perfect gateway game. The rating reflects the game design, not my willingness to play it (in which case I'd rate it a 7). Just remember to help new players with their starting positions, since they are crucial.
Juego regalado (Alberto y Esperanza)  Nº jugadores: 3-4    Ideal: 4 Duración: 90 - 120 min

Enjoyable and beautiful game, although I have to admit I was only introduced to this game via the xbox 360.. and I havent actually played the actual board game of it that many times after buying it - thats because we always plump for Ingenious instead!!
I trully enjoyed this game when i first played it but I cant say it was as enjoyable on the following sessions. Still, I wouldn't mind playing this game if invited to a session.
It's a classic for a reason. Still a game that balances luck, negotiation skills and strategic decisions extremely well. Works best with 4 players.

A classic that got me into the hobby.  Luck of the dice doesn't bother me, someone getting cut off early is the worst part of this game (usually in a 4-player game).  If that happens, the game might not be fun and that person who's out of contention can be a kingmaker.  But still fun and one that my family often asks to play.
It's Settlers -- it brings people together!
A Great Game. Hands down a house favorite.

Like many others out there, this was the main game that hooked me, my children (my wife still won't play it) and their cousins into these new "Euro" games. I am always up for a game of Settlers any time, anywhere.
Have played this many times that aren't logged.
Оля выиграла в турнире по "Игре престолов"
One of the oldest in my collection, I'll still play this enthusiastically. It's a best-seller for a reason.

26th Birthday from Sarah & Matt  We first played this game at our friend Rich's house as 3 couples. We were all new players although had heard of it because of the TV show The Big Bang Theory "I need wood".  As a party game with lots of people fighting for resources and to build as quickly as possible we had great fun and raved about it to other friends.  So quite unexpectedly on my my birthday the friends I had raved about it too had bought it for me. We've played this many more times than I have recorded and still love haw tactical you have to be to scoop a win from under your opponents noses many times it has come down to the final roll.  I've just purchased the first add on for this game seafarers so I'm looking forward to adding an extra dimension to the game.

This is the game that got me into boardgaming. Been playing consistently for over 5 years-literally hundreds of plays. Still my family's favorite game. Having played Cities and Knights, Traders and Barbarians and Seafarers, I think it plays best with the Seafarers expansion.

Soild fun game. Great game for freeing people enslaved by brainless mainstream bored-game fodder. We will always come back to this, but we do try to quickly graduate new Settlers players to Catan: Cities and Knights.
Seems whenever Settlers comes out we end up playing multiple times in a row. One of the better balanced games for our family, seems any of us can win.
The gran dandy of boardgames, so no complains here, solid game.

It's a classic.  After over 100 games (not an exaggeration; I played online) it's not one I'm dying to play anymore, but I can't deny that it is a very good game.  I disapprove of the name being shortened, but I suppose you gotta do what you gotta do to sell board games to Americans who won't buy a game with more than 2 words in the title.
One of my first boardgames after the classic ones we play as kids. Still love it, pretty challenging and easy to learn, ideal to introduce your friends to boardgames.

An all time classic, which never loses it's charm. Every now and then this finds the way on our table but always delivers on a fun, fast gaming experience. Trading, lucky dice rolls, crossing someones plans and negotiations on an casual player level. This game is nerver wrong to get if you are looking to start or expand an board game collection or just searching for a game to play with your family.
Excellent game that has stood the test of time. Still fun after all these years. :)
The best game for introduction to boardgames.  Still very competitive, but too much luck...

This is a great game system and an essential for any collection.  20 years after its release, it is still a fantastic gateway game, and I often have friends that don't play board games asking to play.  There is a reason why this game has been able to break in to the American market when so many others have failed; it implements mechanics that most haven't seen in games (resource management, trading, engine building) in an extremely elegant and simple way.  The game is perhaps too simple and luck-reliant to have longevity for a lot of hobby gamers (the expansions do help with this problem), but it is worthy of the popularity that it has.
With Cities & knights and Seafarers. Very basic with a bit too much randomness.
Great game! Very easy to explain and to catch new players. Very very funny and entertained. You will find better games but this its still great.

Random resource generation? Eh, not really. You take control of nodes as a gambled investment on gaining resources. You always know the odds something will be rolled, so it's a very economic bidding game in this way.   That's why it's balanced - it's for repeated plays. Play this with the same group and it won't matter if you go 2 games in a row not getting many resources, because the next 2 games may play out much different. And the routes to victory (especially in expansions) becomes so fleshed out that maximum resource generation isn't as required.   ---   Has so many mechanics within. Games that have better mechanics also sacrifice elements that Catan weaves together. A strong game. You can play it if you're in the mood for trading, building things from resources, area control, and so on. Not many games can give you that.  The variety of gameplay in settlers makes it a game most gaming groups won't be too worried to play, because whatever gaming mood they are in, it's likely Catan will give them what they want. And if their gaming mood changes next week, Catan may still have what they want. At least a little bit of it.   That makes this game continually hit the table. It's one we usually are cool with playing no matter what mood we're in, because it has a little bit of something for every mood. Not many games can do that.
Casual but fun. I play the hell out of this game on my phone.
Super fun game.  Great introduction to eurogames.

Played more times than I care to mention, and have used most of the expansions. A great game of expansion and resource management, with player interaction built in through resource trading.  A good quality product, easy to pick up, and has plenty of longevity. Laden with potential innuendo - the call of I got wood for sheep echoes around the gaming table every time this is played, which says more about our mental maturity than the game itself!
Very entertaining gateway game. A lot of fun played with 3 or 4 people.
A true original. It's become fashionable to deride it, but this is still one of the best negotiation games around.
Oldie, but goodie. Will not trade.

Un juego de introducción altamente competitivo y con estrategia, para el jugador novato puede parecer tener muchas reglas pero atrapa en su temática rapidamente(mi primer juego de este tipo) y sus expansiones modifican mucho su tipo de juego o enfoque de estrategias que lo mantienen fresco

Not your usual board game (Sorry, Clue, Monopoly) in that you don't have a token that you move around a board the number of spaces rolled on the dice. The "board" in this game is made up of hexagon tiles of 5 different resources that are randomly placed in a honeycomb and randomly assigned a number between 2 and 12. The ability to change the layout of the board allows for countless replay-ability. A great game for people looking to branch out from the standard board games, but I imagine it would be a little overwhelming to grasp the rules by simply reading the rule book included, it would be best to find someone with experience to teach you the game.
This is the game that got me into boardgames as a teen. It is still enjoyed by my entire family.
A classic fun and easy game to teach.
I will update the score next time we play. I think it's a great game but we can't get it on the table much because of the 3 player minimum. We found 2 player rules but just haven't taken the plunge.
Well this game is awesome for all kind of players both hardcore players and light players, has alot of luck and strategy.
Can't argue with this one. As with so many others this was one of my gateway games and I still enjoy playing it. The trading aspect really makes the game shine. I expect to keep this one forever.
Extremely fun game, many strategies to win. This was my gateway board game to the awesome world of board games.
The best thing about the game is that it's different each time. Trading with other players and expanding your settlement... Great game!
This is the game that started me into gaming, and I still love playing this game.

One of the best games ever and the best gateway game IMHO. This is the game that I usually introduce people to the hobby. And evergreen game and one that I still gladly play even after 4 years and more than 100+ plays. (Though I am not able to record them all.)

It's Catan. You are on Boardgame Geek. I gave it a 7, I think it's mostly overrated. Carcassonne is a better choice for an entry into the hobby.  Update 7/13/15: Played with the kids. They *love* it. Increased the score, as it remains a classic with some long legs.
The game "boardgamers" turn their nose up at but shouldn't.

Para mí Catan es un juego que toda persona debería jugar en algún momento, como que quiebra lo que todos pensarían de un juego de mesa, tiene demasiada interacción con las personas que lo están jugando, lo cual lo hace muy divertido. Es fácil de jugar para divertirse, pero es muy complejo para poder jugarlo de mejor manera, existen muchos tipos de estrategia y uno puede darle muchas vueltas al juego pensando cuál será la mejor colocación para cada uno de los mapas que se puede formar.  Este juego cuenta con campeonatos nacionales en Chile, por lo que se puede jugar de manera competitiva, entregando una motivación extra a la hora de jugarlo.
游戏重度一般，游戏整体都是不错的，推荐一定要试试。
The Family staple and ultimate gateway for house visitors and the uninitiated. the Perfect Gateway!

Still a classic and always enjoyable to hit the table despite a hundred plays at least over the last 15 years. This is the game that introduced me to the hobby beyond mass market American board games and for that I will always be grateful plus it is a really solid game.
A true classic.  Should be a part of every gamers library.  Was a big part of making gaming more popular and for good reason.

The game that introduced me to this wonderful hobby, it remains a firm favourite. At the time I thought it was the best game ever and while that is almost certainly not the case, we always have a great time whenever it hits the table and would probably play it a lot more if it played at 2 players (thank you Catan Rivals!). My only reservation is that more often than not, especially at 4 players, there is at least one player who finds themselves cut off quite early on and being that player can be a bit of a grind - its not always the quickest game! When the dice aren't going your way it can be incredibly frustrating but the reverse is also true. I would subscribe to the view that better games involve less luck but, for me, there will always be a space in my collection for this fantastic game.
Only recently bought this and started playing.  A lot of fun.  Another one the whole family can get into (they still prefer Lords of Waterdeep though...as do I).

This game revolutionized modern board gaming and though many may feel this game has been surpassed (in my opinion) this game will always be the standard for board games. That said the game can get better. If you combine the base game with the Seafarers expansion and the Cities and Knights expansion it becomes the PERFECT game!

My first "non-traditional" board game. This one showed me what board games could be capable of. An excellent blend of strategy, social interactions, and infuriating dice based luck. This is a family game night favorite and a favorite when we have friends over. A perfect introduction to anyone wanting to break away from your typical board games.

Always a favorite, but can get a little stale after a few rounds. I always leave the table satisfied, but rarely wanting more afterward. I find the expansions to be mostly not as fun as the base game, though that opinion appears unpopular.
This is the game that showed me that board games are not just monopoly or risk like games.
This game will always be "Settlers" to me. I really don't like the name change.
Probably the first real boardgame I've played, and I still enjoy it every time!! Classic game, but it hasn't lost its essence.  A must for every board gamer.
I love the game but it takes a lot of patience
This classic stands the test of time.  Great gameplay, and very satisfying even in losing.

Destined to be remembered as the classic that launched the table top renaissance in the midst of the digital age. I know that sounds sappy, but this game is legend for a reason. The shine only dulls due to comparison to the new awesomeness being developed these days. Still worth taking it off the shelf at least a few times a year just to argue over what constitutes a reasonable exchange rate of wool to ore.

A great Euro style game. A game that got me into the board gaming hobby. If you love strategy, dice rolling, card management, risk taking, and trading with your opponents then this is your game.  A modern classic that is highly recommended!
The Gamers Classic. I love to go back and play this game from time to time with loved ones.
Simplest Euro game to get people used to board games. Love how both fun and serious it can become, especially with the expansions.
Great game to bring new players to strategy games.

A top-notch game of building and development.  Of the 20(ish) people I’ve introduced this to, every single one has enjoyed it, and many have become real fans.  I’d suggest playing with resources face up when teaching people, since that will reduce the frustration of learning exactly what you need to build what.  The game is simple, yet it manages to have realistic production, trade, and building.  The ending is usually either very close, or such a blowout that it ends very quickly.
4th Edition (Nov. 2007). NM+/M Condition. Acquired As Gift Dec. 2008.
Have the 5-6p. I've actually never played my copy, but felt I needed to have it!
Gameplay = 7 Replay ability = 8 Length = 9 Components = 8 Fun Factor = 10

Ah Catan, the gateway game.  Solid game for family gaming and initial entry into board games.  Start with two towns and roads with limited resources, expand your roads, build more towns and upgrade to cities to accrue more resources on each random resource roll.  Interact with other players to trade resources.  For me, this game was best with the knights and cities upgrade.
I will pretty much never turn down a game. The dopamine rush when you get like 5 resources from one dice roll is too much to deny.
The randomness can be loved or hated. It works against me most of the time, but I still love it anyway!

The game that introduced me to a new world of board games.  I could not stop until I had all the Mayfair expansions, which all add to the game.  I will always want to play this, although now that I have played this so much (before logging games began) and have newer games, the rating has dropped from the original 10, but only because we don't play it so often anymore.  It is still a fantastic game.
The game that opened the flood gates for us.  After Guillotine got us interested, this one put us over the edge.
after lots of plays, moves have become too obvious.
First we played it a lot, but with the time you can get a little overplayed and then there is no more fun in the game, especilly if the dices are against you ;)
It's the Settlers of Catan, come on! Just go get it already.

A classic game for most occasions, can go slowly on occassion, although with the 5-6 player addition you get to build at the end of each players turn.  This speeds the game up, and the addition of the Events Cards keeps all players in as the probabilities are fixed - although that can lead to depressed players, when the 12 comes up and then no chance again until the deck is shuffled.
[u]family / Wife Likes[/u] I played this so much, but still like it. For me too the game that started it all.
The first will be always the first

Really fun game. Usually can't turn it down, but strategy is limited. Playing against advance and super competitive players and in tournaments is the best. Everyone knows the basic stratgies, so it's all about implementing and the die rolls.

This one of those games you can come back to time and time again! Simple game-play mechanics means it caters to gamers and non-gamers alike - but it still has enough depth of play to keep it interesting. Great player interaction as you jostle for space and resources. The open barter system for resources (where players can openly exchange resources) and quick turns means there is little down time and you're are consistently engaged through-out the game. Definitely worth getting the Seafarers expansion to add a bit more complexity!
Plays totaal: 18  Catan: 6 K&B: 5 Zee: 5 S&R: 1 Europa: 1
A great game to play with four players. A strategic worker placement game with a nice amount of luck and a very strong bargaining component.

Fun medium game for both experienced and beginner board gamer. Experienced gamers will probably calculate their chances and monopolize resources early, so beginners beware!  I prefer the bare bones...   (medium)
Great entry in the board game world.
A great gateway game that has lost a bit of luster but is still very solid and enjoyable to play.

One of the best non-cooperative games out there in terms of player interaction. Each player almost always is doing something, even if it's not his turn. There are those who cite the rolling of the dice every turn as a sign that Settlers is light on strategy, but it is a rare game of Catan where luck outweighs strategy. Decisions on road, settlement and city placement are never easy.
Good game.  The classic German style game.  It's been on most top 10 game lists now for 10+ years!
This is a great game.  Easy to learn, just the right amount of strategy - not too much that non-gamers won't be able to play, not too little to bore the average gamer.  Highly Recommended!
Have a lot more plays of this from before I started logging.  Rarely play without Seafarers anymore.  Still a great game though.
This game is a classic. Simple and fun!! I know theres lots of luck included. Who cares...this is just plain fun.
Juegazo para enganchar al que es poco aficionado. Mejor con muchos jugadores
An interesting game that's always worth a play, but you will come to despise the dice, as they'll generally dictate victory and defeat far more often then your choices and skill will.
Classic.  I still enjoy this one every time I play.
Smart, active and fluent board game!!!
This has become one of our family's "go to" games in our gaming sessions.  We really have fun playing it.
For me, the gateway game that started my whole collection.
Never gets too old to play.

We have the Dutch version, "The Kolonisten van Catan" from 999 games.  This is a much played game with us and friends.  Usually, we like to play it with the seafarer expansion set the most.  The first few times that I played this, I found it really boring!!!  After playing it with other beginners, I began to "get it" more and really started to enjoy it.  Now, I love it.  Since we originally purchased it, we have bought just about every expansion set out there... official and unofficial.  It is such an addictive, fun game.  One thing that we changed though, was we bought 12 sided dice, which evens out the chances of numbers being played.  I enjoy playing this game much more with expansions than the stand alone game.
A good game. Another hit with my family. It was over played and now sits on my shelf awaiting some new blood.
This game was my gateway to Modern Boardgames and still have fun since after few years.  Excellent.
Got 3rd edition in 2007, played a few times (Greenleaf Gamers, Bio grad students, etc). Traded in math trade in 2012 for 4th edition.
The card trading in this game makes this one of my favorite games out there.  The randomness of the dice is balanced nicely by the choices of where to build cities.

[b]Settlers of Catan[/b] - Slovenian Edition (3rd 2007)  2-4 players (5-6 with expansion)  Has seen countless plays. Great game. I suppose my opinion might not last forever, its sheen may dull, but when? If one plays too often? It has been fun on a consistent basis, and am almost always willing to play it, which I cannot say for all games.  [b]The Pros[/b] -lots of player interaction due to negotiation/diplomacy/trading  -usually little down time (use a timer when playing with slow players!) -opponents' plans can be disrupted in various ways -multiple paths to victory -multiple game variants (expansions) -modular board =every game will be different -very easy to learn -not an overlong game, allowing 2 or more games to be played in one game night evening  [b]The Cons[/b] Some might complain about the usage of dice. If dice are not your thing, you could use a [url=https://www.boardgamegeek.com/boardgameexpansion/20038/catan-event-cards]dice deck[/url] to replace them. It is included within the event cards in [thing=27760][/thing].  However, I think luck usually doesn't play a major role. The "randomness" of the dice roll doesn't automatically mean luck rules this particular game.  For one, the usage of two dice lessens the randomness, making some number totals more statistically probable than other totals (ex. totals of six are much more probable than totals of two, because there are more possible combinations of the dice rolls. Whereas 3 and 3, 1 and 5, 4 and 2 all equal 6, only 1 and 1 equal 2). See: http://wizardofodds.com/gambling/dice/  As you gain experience, you learn to avoid building on those provinces, which will statistically provide less resources. A frequent mistake committed by novices. And if the best provinces have already been taken during the initial setup, an experienced player knows how to use the sea ports to his advantage (exchanging resources 2:1 or 3:1).  Even if one player does indeed have more luck with the dice, and beats the statistic probability overwhelmingly, this usually tends to balance itself out: 1) with the other players creating alliances against him, 2) with the brilliant Robber mechanism, which steals from those too rich with resources, 3) the clever usage of sea ports, and 4) trading with your allies as much as possible. The key is to make those trades, which benefit you more than your opponent.  A degree of randomness challenges one's ability in adapting to changing circumstances. Real life is all about this. But for those who do not like it, there are always the dice cards mentioned above.  Whereas strategy is the overall plan, tactics are the actual means used to gain an objective. This game has both. But of course this is not one of the heavy, deep or complex games, which I do like as well.  Interesting thoughts on board game design: http://www.boardgamegeek.com/thread/822865/means-production-and-how-games-innovate  For Catan fans: http://www.wsj.com/articles/the-packers-of-catan-green-bays-board-game-obsession-1421346102 https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ag1V5XkwfUc  [IMG]https://cf.geekdo-static.com/mbs/mb_23954_0.png[/IMG] On the benefits of trade -  Matt Ridley Ted Talk explaining David Ricardo https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iLuAk-F158A
Interesting game. ( lost it in a trip.. ) Current edition has wrong gameboard. I'm waiting something.
Classic. Every gamer should own this game that was instrumental in creating the gaming revolution.

Very fun game to play and easy to learn for many ages. The game says it's an hour long but our first couple plays have gone over 1 1/2 but that may be due to lack of knowledge of the rules. (Updated the rating from 9 to 8.2 due to game length not really changing. Tends to drag on at times though still a enjoyable game overall. Really like to play it, but not a game I would play on a weekly basis 6/9/2014)
For a game as old as it is there aren't too many games like it in regards to trading and bartering. That's what gives this game it's staying power however it has suffered a little fatigue as of late

A must have for any gamer, it's easy to teach, and a great lot of fun. but can get a little annoying at times when you're rolling 7s and having loot taken, or you get roaded into a corner and resources aren't going your way! either way, awesome game! and you can't win them all!
The game that got me back into boardgaming. So simple, but so much replayability.
Looks like a game your geography teacher would make you play as a learning tool, except it's lots of fun. "Got wood for sheep?" Man I can never get enough of that.
First game I bought, still enjoy it but the trade aspect is something i less enjoy.
I play alot with family, would like catan WAY more if i didn't have so much stress as banker and people telling me what way is the "right" way to play.

So I really love Catan, but over the last few plays my rating for it has went down significantly. Because I realize the luck involved (and that luck going against me so many times) is too dependent.   "I can't believe this 8 is being rolled every time and not that 6 I need."  Update: At least the last 5 games I've played, I get screwed the same way. Dice I need are never rolled and, can't get resources. People keep blocking me in. Grateful for this game being an intro to better games for me, but my estimation of Catan only keeps going down unfortunately.

Catan was my 'first ever' Euro style boardgame, and it started me down this path... so I might be a *little* bias towards it.   And as you can see, I liked it enough to buy *several* of the spinoffs, and all of the expansions to date. (other than das buch, and all of the other german ones...)
Playability & Rules: 1.9 Replayability: 1.7 Depth of Theme: 1.5 Art & Component Quality: 1.4 The Puzzle: 1.7

This game grabbed me in the '90's. And the series is among my favorites. This games makes you manage the luck factor by playing strategically (by deciding where to build, where to expand, which resources to trade). The trading aspect of resouces makes it a very social game as well.  To preserve it well, I also have a luxury wooden case which also contains Seafares en Cities & Knights of Catan.
Excellent game, best not to use the suggested startup in the travel version as white has a horrible time.
Wife's favorite game.  Little bit of luck, decent amount of strategy.  Fun game to play.
A classic.  Your collection should have a copy.  Great for non-gamer types.
Played this game once in the late '90's, and not again until I got my own copy.  Won my own copy in a contest at 2D6.org!
Decent game, except for luck-driven (dice) element
Great game! I would play this with anybody at anytime!
This game started it all for many people including myself.
Will trade my mint condition Siedler von Catan first German edition (the one with the nice wooden pieces, not the plastic ones!) for some sheep. Please! Anybody? One sheep at least? Come on!

Fun to play and a wonderful introduction for new gamers who have never played a Euro game before. Mechanics are a bit more complex than what most people are used to which adds to the mechanics and dynamics of the gameplay.
Such a good game. I don't get tired of it.
This would rate higher if I had never played Cities and Knights of Catan. Excellent short and sweet game.
Generates great fun and hooks players on their first game. Trying to make it last is a little bit harder.
Excellent game to introduce new people to German board games.
Great 4-player game.  Problem is if you have a bad initial set-up, it can be very slow.
A modern classic. Absolute optimum with 4 players.
A classic with the nicest of mechanisms. Keeps all players active to the end. The final run for victory could be better, though. Optimal for non-gamers and family play.
Its a Must-Have for every collection.
I just discovered this most excellent game very recently and I have to admit that it is very good indeed.
Have only played with 3 people and had a great time.  Would like to try with more... just need the time!
I do find it interesting that the "landmark" eurogame has more luck than most.  Still a classic, though I prefer playing with the Seafarers expansion.
We always play with a dice-deck of cards to smooth the luck somewhat.
Simple but fun game.  Can get frustrating if you don't have a good start, but there's just enough variation in strategy to keep things interesting.
Plays fine with two using the variant with two fake players who accept trades.
Great game with a lot of options. However, if you start to get behind and aren't getting resources, it can drag on and on.
Only an 8 because it's not as good as Cities and Knights.

The only reason I don't give it a higher rating is for the "luck" factor. Now don't get me wrong, ALL games need some randomness in it, but I've played quite a few games of this, where I was playing a calculated and winning strategy, only to loose to someone who has never even played before.. It's still a great game, mostly because of the completly random board but it's not perfect.

The base of all Catan games. It is a very good game by itself and it has plenty of very good expansions, which are my favourite games. The only flaws are the lack of storage racks (use a toolbox to keep your peices neat) and the underuse of the development cards.
Fun game, though easy to burn out on.

This is the game that defines the whole German-gaming experience. Lots of player interaction due to the trading element. Luck does heavily influence the game, but good play usually wins out. A must-have for any gamer's collection.
This is a very good game! I recommend it to anybody!

This game introduced our family to this new genre of gaming. I wish I had know about it 5 years ago! Everyone in the family likes this game, but to differing degrees. After a few game sessions my youngest son (currently 15 years old) became extremely frustrated with several series of extremely bad rolls of the dice.  We had read about the variation of using a deck of dice instead, so we tried that.  He has now declared that in the future he will only play Settlers with a deck of dice, thus insuring a uniform probability distribution.

I have played this several times both online and with the real thing and have enjoyed each time. I should also note that this was my first "german" game. I found it very easy to pickup and have fun with but very challenging to master. Deep strategy. Recommended.
Almost always play with the Seafarers expansion.
Excellent game trading and building game, easy and quick, exciting and amusing. Luck is quite present, too.

The old standby.  Gets just a little crowded with four players.  We always play with our hands exposed so trading takes less time and we can yell at each other.  (Trade me some wood! you don't need all that damn Wood!)
A great game that even beginners can understand.  I like the random tile and number layout as each game is different, but this leads to overpowering city spots (and others that are just ignored).
Simple, elegant, GREAT even for non-geeks. It's a pity that the basic game cannot be played by less than 3 or more than 4 players.

Good negotiation game.  Luck based, but doesn't seem to matter much, except for longest game ever (2+ hours).  Can get draggy sometimes, but is nice and good.  Novice game, not beginner.  You have to have some interest in gaming before you start.  Classic and highly recommended.

The game that started an empire.  Although I actually enjoy both Starfarers and Settlers of the Stone Age more, I have to give extra credit to this one for starting the madness as well as being playable in a lunch hour (which neither of the other two are).
It's a very good game but I can only give it an 8 because the Seafarers addition adds so much to it bringing it to a 10!

Invokes a tension on each die roll. A relaxed convivial family game only because of the limited interaction between players. Excellent for getting non-playing-yet-willing-to-indulge-you-friends into having a good time.
Definately one of my favorites. Anyone I taught to play loved it.

Settlers is an unique game, and is worthy a spot in every home as one of the best games ever made. I personally recomend it together with Cities & Knights. Some prefer Seafarers. Its a matter of simplicity vs depth where C&K have the Depth and Seafarers keep the simplicity of the original. The 5-6 player expansions is a "must have" if you have enough friends.

Very good game - dice adds a good random element, yet strategy more often than not wins in this game.  Random board is a cool feature.  Sometimes it can drag on a little long, and that's why I will have to limit it to an 8.  Unlike some games, I am glad this one is over when I'm done because near the end it is kind of predictable.  Maybe also because I've played it so much, it's gotten kind of old.
The game that started it all. Even if it is too luck-driven for my tastes, I still enjoy it a lot.

Actually I really love this game in spite of the luck factor (that is why only the 8 - would have given it a 9 or 10). There are so many variants for this game out there. I think it's the new "Monopoly"-game for the family - easy to learn and fun to play (over and over again). The other thing which is cool about the game is the trading. When you trade with a player you help yourself but also that player.
Still a great game after all these years, but options have become too simple to my tastes. I would probably never turn down a game, but I moved on since this one came out.
The game that started it all for me.  One of the all time great German games that is great to start people on who are not familiar with these style of games.
One of the best out there.
A modern classic. Haven't played it in awhile, though.  Would like to play it again! It's fun,  and one of the standard German games used to introduce non-gamers to the hobby.
Sometimes the layout of the board makes it too difficult to get a resource.  We usually even out the board to avoid hideously long games.
Even though I loathe playing 'basic' settlers now, I must acknowledge the title that got me and many of my friends interested in non-American boardgames.  Besides, expansions exist...

Very good game even for non-gamers.  My wife likes to play along with everyone I've ever introduced the game to.  One of the few games that other friends/family have played and then gone out and bought their own copy.
Sometimes annoying because some people won't try any other boardgames.
A fantastic game. I have played this more than any other game I own. A great blend of strategy, luck and negotiating. Breaks down a little with more than four but with three or four it’s a blast.
This game is a lot of fun, but has a leader run away problem. Still fun though.
Développement d'une colonie insulaire aux ressources limitées.
Very nice game, but only when played with 'Cities & Knights'.

Okay - so it's a little dependent on luck ... hard to stop a leading player ... blah blah blah. It's a damn fun game ! Accept it !! GIVE IN TO SETTLERS !  This game got me into board-gaming. 'Nuff said.
The best way to introduce non-gamers into the wider world of games.  While I don't play it that much since I'm not fond of the luck factor, it deserves a place in everyone's collection.
Great board setup idea. Wish it had a rule set for 2 players.
Good for kids. I like playing with my family, but i don't think its great fun with hard-core competitors.
Something I will play with everyone, even though I may get screwed with the die rolls.
I really like this game, though it can be a bit simplistic and luck does factor quite heavily sometimes. But the trading with other players is neat and it doesn't take to long.

One of the games that sparked the Renaissance of board gaming. Friends would come to the table to play Catan. A nice, easy game to learn with a simple elegance to it. But players can go long stretches earning few resources due to unlucky die rolls. And all my friends know that I am always unlucky at dice.
While I like Starfarers better, this one gets the most play when friends and family come around. It's nearly a classic and rightfully so. Just a great game.
Great intro to gaming. This one got me (and countless others) back into board gaming and away from those crazy CCGs!
Great game, but I got burned out on it in the end.

This is the game that got me into board games. I owe a mountain of fun to Catan. I've played it at least 100 times. I'd give it a rating of 10 except that I have internalized the game. So, I can play it pretty much on autopilot now. If you add the Cities and Knights expansion though, I'm back in the action. If you havenÂ’t played this one yet, donÂ’t walk, run to the nearest gaming store. YouÂ’ll thank me later.
Still not tired of Settlers after many games of it.
Good game for introducing no-gamers to gaming.
This is a good solid game.  It can be very luck based, but that can be fun too.  This one might be a classic someday.

There was a time when this game would have garnered a 10, because it deserves recognition as one of the very best.  But, after our group played this thing for months on end, every Friday night, we found it getting pretty stale.  It still gets an 8 for being the game that inspired us to meet weekly for gaming.  A great game for all (even my parents like it and play it occassionally).  A bit pricey (but then so are all of these German games).
Settlers is  a well-balanced game offering strategic interest without being too serious for non-gamers.
Fifty million Elvis fans can't be wrong.  This game is definitely fun.
This was a generous gift from a co-worker, and we've enjoyed it.  Even my 6 year old son is able to play adequately.  We are probably unusual in that we played the card game first.
The whole family will play it and that is a good thing.
My eight year old twins love it.  Enough said.
thisgame triggered the whole gaming-hype in the netherlands. It is eternal.
Good strategy game.  Requires cooperation with other players, since you trade.

My only complaint is that it's all in the set up.  Once the dice start rolling, the game is over, but you just don't know it yet.  This is a good gateway game.  In fact, it helped revitalize my own love of board games.  Now that I have so many other games, I rarely come back to this.  Sad.
Buy this NOW. If you love games (you found this site so you must do...) this will not disapoint!!!!  And yes get the expansions as well worth every penny.
A great game, though a little predictable after several playings.  The many expansions do add some variety.
Settlers was my introduction to "real" boardgames, as I suspect is the case for many. I still enjoy vanilla Settlers, though Cities and Knights is my favorite.
Already a classic.  Still one of the best introductory German games.
Norwegian edition. After playing Settlers more than 600 times I prefer to play other games... The game deserves a rating of 8 though, even if I'm not to eager to play it anymore.
Our gaming group just loves this game. I gotta say that this game should definately be in every household
4 players: no more and no less.
This game is better with more people.
Excellent for four people, though with the 5-6 player expansion and buying between turns the game becomes a different beast.
A solid game that's easy to learn but difficult to master.  Good for kids and non-gamers, and it has expansions that can increase the depth of the decision-making.
Like euphrat & tigris, puerto rico and carcassonne a good one, but as the others just a little dry
This is a very good game of resource management.

This is a legendary game and I wish I wouldn't have played this one so much (my first game) because I have had an overdose of this :) I was about to give it a 6 but it really deserves 2 legendary points :)
Still one of the best, and with great expansions that give it depth to remain viable for ten years.
Very varied and balanced gameplay. Excellent quality! The requirement for exactly four players can be changed with one of the many expansions.
The large amount of interaction during the trading phase is the element that makes this game unique and enjoyable.
An instant classic that has spawned a billion spinoffs and variants. Not much fun with less than four, though
Settlers is a little too random for me. That, and I like themed games. And I like games which 2 people can play. Otherwise, it's one of the best games ever made.
Can be lots of fun, but I'm not crazy about the fighting over the road space portion of the game.

Excellent game of luck and strategy, resource management and nice bits. Map changing every game, big selling point with me. My first "Eurospiel". Haven't gone hog wild into the genre, rather, picking and choosing my games carefully.
A classic, very playable and fun game for all ages. Only for 4 players and perhaps a bit too simple in the long term without any expansions.
I'll confess I've finally grown tired of it, so it's not my first choice now.  But I can't deny I got a LOT of mileage out of this game at the beginning.  It was well worth my money and time.
The fortune in this game is present, but it is not a defect. This is a perfect game to play with everybody.
Pretty fun, it's been some time since I played so I can't recall much about it, except that I liked it.
Very nice and amusing game. Maybe a strategy game which is also appreciated by young or not so experienced gamers.
The classic gateway game.  Plenty of trade, development and moaning about the dice.
Really good game, although most people I know are sick of it.
Generally a good game.  Seems to be over-hyped, though, which tends to turn me off to otherwise good games.
Not my first german game...but certainly has the most longevity.
A good game, but somewhat too luck dependent to be a real hit.

The definitive German-style game, with good reason. While it is never going to be the deepest or most satisfying thing available, it is still a great title with much to say for it, and deserving of a place in any games collection.
One of the first non-abstract "serious" game I played.  I like it because it is light but not completely luck driven.
Very good game that is quickly becoming a classic.

A wonderful, wonderful game.  It's a fun game to bring out when introducing people to eurogames.  It's not the first game I bring out, rather I like to bring it out once they have a few others under their belt.  It may be a gateway game, but it should not be the "initial" gateway game.

Game design is very good. Fair amount of luck, with plenty of skill for the quick learner. The variable board design ensures replayability. A modern, superior version of monopoly, which I consider a rather poor game.
I like this game, but could survive without it.  My high rating reflects the fact that it is the first non-mainstream game that my family really digs.  ie: gateway drug

The classic which revived the gaming genre from the depression of the 80s. Deserved for more recognition in the mainstream, and should be the game replacing Monopoly on the shelves of toy stores worldwide. Must-try for everyone.
Enjoyable trading game that lives up to its reputation for attracting non-gamer-types. Certainly fun at first, though I do find myself tiring of it.
Great game that appeals to all. Works best with 4 players. Easy to score and different every game.
This game single-handedly revived my interest in playing games. It's so simple yet so complex at the same time. It reminds me of diplomacy in this manner.
Good game I love to play it on the net. A bit of luck, abit of strategi.
Has lost its luster after all these years.
Still greatafter many plays and it is often requested at our gaming table. A sure buy-before-you-try.
Fun game.  Gets better as you learn new strategies.  I have not tried out the expansions yet.
Very enjoyable. 2 player is a fast (20 mins) game, but completely different to the multi-player. Really extremely good.
This is too random and tedious for me to play without the Knights and Cities expansion.
Cool game that has a high replay value.  Its simplicity makes it a good game to play with non-gamers.
We played this game every week for almost a year. obviously very replayable. The cities and knights expansion is a great addition
What's to say, the ultimate "Euro Game" - simple rules, fast play time and complex strategy make this a classisic of the genre.

Settlers is fun, I can see why its a "classic".  The deal making is fun, but I think the game can become almost "mindless" sometimes with just rolling and collecting, etc.  But with the right group of people it can be a blast
Not as GREAT as one would believe- it's really rather mechanical and easy. It's a good game. A basic board game that appeals to the D&D crowd that usually hates board games.

LOVE This One!!! Easy Play and VERY engaging. Even the wife (Who Rated Candyland a "10") Likes it. My Six year old LOVES it. But she takes the Soldier thing a little far "Daddy, I want my soldiers to take all of Momma's stuff" Very Good Game...  Thanks for the Recommendation Ya'll...

Still one of the best introduction to gaming for new players. Luck to give everyone a chance, little in the way of direct confrontation, trading, strategy, tactics, players involved at every turn. Addictive like gambling.  A little TOO much in the luck department, perhaps, and a not quite possible to win if you fall TOO far behind. Can be a bit boring after the 1000th play with experienced players.
Greek Version by Kaissagames.com -  Best game I have ever played! That's until I discovered Puerto Rico and others...

Settlers is a great game but only shines when played with all its expansion sets (certainly Cities and Knights). The basic version just lacks in possibilities making it just a bit too luck dependant and unbalanced.
My first "German style" game and I love it.  Would love to play more, but need at least three people.
I still like to play this game, after 50 plays or so.  Maybe the high cost for the game is justified...
Nothing else to say. A classic.

I had to play this game ~40 times before it began to lose some of its luster.  Very fun.  Pretty much all of the ~2 dozen people I taught this to were enamored with it.  A very good gift for a kid who watches too much TV (any of those out there?)

The first real Eurogame I ever learned and absolutely LOVED!  I've played others since that are better but this game brings back serious gaming memories playing with family and at Origins.  Rated high for personal nostalgia.
Whew.  I sure have a lot of Settlers items.
Still a great game.  It is simple and at times too random, but it is short enough that if you get bagged, you can make up for it in the next game.
Really like the game, though my winning record is poor!
Use a 'Deck of Dice' to even out the game play.
A classic.  Is the reason I play board games today.  Getting a bit stale (due to overplay), but still very fun.
Great game. alot of luck, We usually play with the 5-6 player expansion. Great gateway game.

Hands down the best game for introducing new players to German games.  Jaded collectors with hundreds of games on their shelves may turn their noses up at this one now, but this is the one that got many of us started.  I still enjoy it, although I rarely play it anymore.    Update: Ticket to Ride has replaced this game as my favorite introductory game.  Still a lot of fun, though.

I really believe this is one of the greatest board games of all time.  Having had some time with German board games, I've learned that it's certainly not one of the best, but it will always have a special place in my gamer's heart.  One of the things I love about this game (for which it gets too little credit, I think) is the reaction of people who have never played German style games, but then play this.  It's like a whole new world is opened up.  Very special.
Fun, but too random at times.  A bit of exponential growth/runaway leader syndrome.
I doubt there is anything I can say that hasn't already been said. A classic game enjoyed by gamers and non-gamers.

Settlers is a very good intro game for newbies (myself included).  The game rates high for it's trading and building aspects.  The biggest flaw I find is the randomness of the game, which doesn't become evident until the end of the game.  I haven't played it enough to isolate when it happens but after settlements have been upgraded to cities, the player with the best rolls (and positions) clearly pulls ahead.  The other players can only hope for 7's to activate the robber.  Overall, a highly enjoyable game. It clearly deserves its popularity.
Just drawn to it and can't stay away from a game
After playing many times, there is too much luck in this game.
Its the game that attracts me to euro boardgaming. Just wish I can play more of this.

Is hard for me to express a omogenic judgement of this game. As player I liked it immediatly because it's really easy to play but it's not a trivial simplicity. I have to say that after several matches I has been a little tired. However is impossible to deny that it is an exemplar game for all. Don't  leave out chance of trade phases, I think it is essential . Don't abuse it
The other game that got me into this nasty spending habit. I'll rarely turn it down, even with the luck component.
Very entertaining. Can sometimes be slow if the tiles don't come up right, but the player interaction is great, and it's a fun lesson in basic economics. Had a good time when I've played.
This started an explosion in gaming that is still going on today. A great game for anyone to play.
Very fun game -- but bad luck early can leave players out of the running.
ask me how to make this less die-influenced
Of course my gateway game.  We still play it but now always with the food stamp variant
The game that got me into gaming.  It's a great game, and always a good game to introduce people to the world of gaming.
A great game. Although I don't enjoy it as much as samurai
A great introduction to the hobby
Didn't get me into the hobby like so many (that would be Carc.), but it's always a good time.
A good light game that can be used to get people interested in euro games.

Very fun, a lot of interaction. Great negotiation game. Only one flaw, the winner is decided in the setting - Muy divertido, mucha interacción. Buen juego de negociación. Solo un problema, el ganador se decide al principio, lo restante es tirar dados.
Unique mechanics. Good lead-in game but strategic as well.
Not too into trading games because it often causes unbalances when playing with friends.

The start of my (as of many players around here) boardgaming hobby! Played this one (in combination with C&K, which makes the game far better) a little to much. Thereefore only an 8, instead of the 10 I would have given it 8/9 years ago...

Ah, how many Thanksgiving weekends have I spent playing game after game of Settlers? There are certain people with whom I am always willing to play this game. I think I prefer to play with three players; with three, it's easy to win with only the simple strategy of making sure your starting locations cover all five resources. It becomes more challenging with more players--however, the potential for getting "locked in" to one corner of the board also increases.
Wonderful game.  My introduction to non wargaming and its expansion packs greatly enhance the base game.
after a long pauze (few years) playing this game, i discovered that this is a classic topper. Also good for introduce new gamers.
My first Eurogame! Always a pleasure to play this one. Having this probably marks you as a genuine (if not overly serious) gamer.
Probably would have rated this higher a couple years ago, but there are so many other good games out there...

We own both the boardgame (now neatly piled in the "Seafarers" box) and the Travel Edition.  An excellent starter game  for those who think that the only games out there are Monopoly and Risk.  Seafarers gets most of the Catan play nowadays, with the variable board setups and victory conditions, but we still enjoy games with the Travel Edition on long car trips to visit the relatives.  A must have!

This is a great game for all those people out there who think Risk and Monopoly are good games. It will show them the error of their ways and open their eyes to the beauty of the non-department store games. Settlers is colorful, easy to learn, and most importantly; random. The pieces are layed down in random fashion, then the number tiles and ports are randomly applied. Players then choose their starting positions and begin rolling the dice. The game has some minor balance issues, but the only great fault I have found, is that if a player has a run of bad luck early in the game it can leave them hopelessly behind, and trod upon by their fellow gamers. Less mature gamers often want to give up part way through when it is clear they are not going to win. The Seafarers expansion was weak, but the Cities and Knights expansion, while a bit complex, is a nice addition once the original has lost some luster. Not my favorite game, but it will have a place near the top of my game stack for many years to come.

I have some reservations about my "8" rating, which stems, primarily (the reservations, not the rating) from my lack of personal success with the game. I just am not very good at it. But as I began to play it more and more, familiarizing myself with its particular idiosyncracies, I was able, at least to make some progress toward victory, albeit without really attaining one. I suspect, therefore, that my personal bias would lend itself to a lower rating, while my recognition of its simple mechanics, delicious decisions and the opinions of "respected" others elevates it to the "8" I gave it.

To me, this will always be the poster child for the eurogaming hobby.  It's completely different from anything that most people have played while still remaining very simple and accessible.  I used to play it constantly when I first heard of it, but it sees a lot less play these days.  Nevertheless, a wonderful game destined to be a classic!
Great game, but it gets much better with the addition of Cities and Knights

Rating this game is like rating your first girlfriend.  At the time, she was a 10.  Because you never knew it could be so good.  But all good things come to an end.  And then with the benefit of time you realize that there are other bigger, better fish in the sea.  Still, as a gateway drug, there is probably none better for a casual gamer to get sucked into Euros...
While some of the excitement has worn off, it's still a great game, and a sentimental favorite.
The great introduction game.  Worked for us, luck, strategy, trading all rolled into a game where you're always involved.

I think this was the first 'German-style' game that we played; always a heap of fun, and usually quite a close game too - it's rare for someone to be completely shut out of a game. Rating dropped from 9 to 8 as we've got more & more games - it's probably only a 7 really, but it has that sentimental value of being my personal Gateway Game.
My gateway game. It will always hold a special spot for me for that!
Not at the top of my list as often (2005), but still one of the most played ever.
I haven't played this enough to burn out on it.
Very good game - my favorite for a long time.
Over 100 plays, and this game still remains fun, both with experienced opponents and novices. Deservedly a classic benchmark of modern gaming.

This is the game that got me hooked on playing German games. This game and its expansions are definitely the game that I have played the most. At this point, I would usually prefer something newer, but this game is still enjoyable. One drawback is that the trading can slow things down at times.

Has become a hit (not a big surprise after having read so many positive reviews) in our gaming group that consists mainly of those who like relatively light games. Though I've been playing "proper" board games for a while, Catan was on my buying list as late as last christmas, which is what someone could call a surprise.
The game that got my wife and parents into "my kind of gaming"...

There was a four or five year span between when I first read about this game (in InQuest) and when I finally bought it. My first "major" board game, and still an old favorite. My group has always had a problem with brick shortages, to the point of a new colloquialism for us ("effed for brick," only without the "effed," yeah?).
Pretty good game.  One of game night's favorites
Not bad...addictive in its permutations.  A good beer and pretzels
Tried it online and was unimpressed. Recently played it FTF and enjoyed it quite a bit. A lot of luck in the game, and that keeps me from rating it higher.
The definite game to start new people playing board games

First introduced to me by my uncle, I had the fortune of winning a six player game after a thanksgiving feast my first time out.  I enjoy it as it satisfies that "civilazation build it" part of my personality, and it is simple enough that my friends like to play me at it.
Wonderful game.  Gamers and soon-to-be-gamers both enjoy it.  A regular favorite in my groups.

Probably the best family game. Nice resource mechanism and some tactics. The only expansion needed is the 5-6 players expansion. All other expansions do not change the nature of the game (it only gets more complex).
I have the Finnish version "Catanin Uudisasukkaat".
A modern classic. Luck is an element, but can be handled by trading and robbery. The game that made me be an adult gamer.

This game is a classic one. I regularily and succesfully use it introduce people into boardgames. They all get addicted. With the right group of players I don't mind if the dice roll against me (at least I pretend).
The game that opened our eyes to this world known as board-gaming.  Gateway game galore.
Although it is not the greatest game ever, it has the great advantage of being easy to teach and very enjoyable to play. That makes it ideal for introducing non-gamers to board games.
Good Game. Most of you have this game.
"When you steal from the shepard... you still only have sheep."
I think the layout changes everything for this game.  I've had my share of great to horrible games.

this game is a classic. Great great game! Takes a little time to set up but no where as bad as PR. It is very luck based so if you don't like the dice, not a game for you. But i like dice games once in a while so for me it's a good game with balanced luck and strategy.
A classic.  I like this game best because my wife will even play it!  Also, it's the best game to take to a get together and play.
"A test of wills that will lay bare the greed and duplicity of the human soul."  With sheep!  Ah, Settlers.  If not for you, this would be a much much shorter list.
The game that elevated board gaming from a mere pastime to a hobby for me. After massive amounts of play, it's not as exciting. But still, an amazing game.
This is a fun game that we play every so often.  It's a classic that always provides an enjoyable gaming session.

Finally got this game and really like it. Just enough randomness mixed in with the strategy and I love the trading aspect. I have a feeling this will be replacing Ticket to Ride as our "go to" strategy game due to the much higher level of player interaction. Can definitely see why this game has so much hype.
This was my gateway to "german games," as it was for so many others.  This is simply an excellent game.  Just the right mix of strategy, interaction, and luck, and it plays in an hour or so.
Easy to learn rules, lots of interaction, and changing strategy depending on board layout.  Wonderful!
The game that got me back into boardgaming (like alot of other people). Maybe more fun with three players than with four. It can get very crowded with four, but still lots of fun.
come people I have wood for your sheep.
Classic gateway game. A bit of negociation, a bit of backstabbing, a bit of ressource management, a bit of area control. A bit of everything! A bit too much luck sometimes too
Brilliant. Words fail me. But I prefer other games out of choice. Excellent first starter, as it was for me, taking me away from wargames a little into Eurogames.

This is the game that hooked me into board gaming.  It is great fun and always manages to keep me interested and full of hope till the very end.  It's a shame that I can't get more veteran gamers to play this more often... ----- This is the pre-2008 version without the puzzle border. I also own the English First edition 5-6 Player Expansion to go with it.

A good intro german game with plenty of strategy, but also plenty of luck.  Not like that's a bad thing, it just makes the occasional game really difficult when none of your numbers get rolled for a long time.
An excellent game, one of my favorites!  Works well with the 5-6 player expansion too!
Great game. Easy to play. Difficult to master. Does anyone have any clay?
Great as a 4-player game. A good game to introduce to non-gamers.
Great game. Absolute favorite of mine.
Great game but not for me.  I don't want to beg the other player for a log or some wool.

12/04 (This is my initial review, which differs greatly from my new review below.  Just goes to show how group morale plays in a gaming experience)  Eh? That was it...how boring.  I thought this game was going to be AMAZING. Maybe it's the fact that the 4 players wanted to keep turning their head to America's Funniest Home Videos playing in the background.  Regardless: roll the dice (hope it's yours), collect resource, trade, build.  Repeate ad nauseaum.  This was not my first "German" game, but I have to say the lack of conflict (long time Magic:TG player) bored me.  I hated the 2-player Settlers card game as well.  Perhaps I would appreciate Teuber's Lowenherz/Domaine more.  I'm going to keep this I guess just to have, but I will probably sell the 2 expansions I bought for it.  I know the Cities & Knights expansion adds more conflict, but why bother when there are so many other games that do it without expansion. ===================================================== 12/7/06 (this is an updated review of the game, my previous experience with Settlers was dreadful.  I  knew my first try didn't fairly give the game a chance and requested to play it again 2 years later)  Finally got a chance to play a real game of Settlers and I enjoyed it.  There are multiple strategies to win (do you keep getting Production cards getting random VPs or perhaps the largest army having control over the robber and shutting down your opponents supply, or try to have the largest civilization netting you more supply, maybe picking up the longest road along the way).  We had a fun time with trade too, but if you're in short supply of a particular resource and people see you're winning, expect to have a trade embargo put on you (unless they're just that desparate).  That was my only negative experience in the game, because I had a boring 3 rounds where no one would help me and I had to do some inefficient trades with my port and watch them all catch up, and suddenly they were all against each other since I wasn't king of the hill anymore.  As the board fills up, lessening available real estate, trade becomes increasingly dominant as people compete for resources to upgrade settlements to cities.  Have you positioned yourself to control that supply?  Or did you choose another path to victory, silently waiting to reveal your Production Cards for VPs?  Are you shutting down that supply with your soldiers?  Is someone trying to steal "Longest Road" from you, racing you or trying to cut yours off?  This kind of nail-biting tension occurs at the end.  When I was finished playing, I was still thinking about the game and what I could have done better.
The classic.  I think everyone owns this game.  Still a great experience and the definition of a "gateway" game.

My friend introduced me to this game, and it made me realize how neat boardgames can be! No longer that great of a game, but I will always remember it as the first game that set off a new way of thinking about games.
The more I play this game, the more I like it.
Fun to play with non players
Almost want to give it a sentimental 10.  My new favorite thing about this classic is that it can nicely fit in at the end of a gaming night when people are on autopilot.  Best with 3.

So what if you luck out with bad dice rolls? If you settled a village next to wheat and then became a victim of drought would you complain about the lack of “luck”? No other German game has such a strong theme. Gosh, it’s almost a simulation. If you don’t like the dice factor there’s about 1000 or more diceless German games to choose from.
This is probably the first German style board game I played, and what a great game it is!
Haven't playde for years. The game that got me into playin boardgames.
My re-entry into gaming. I like playing with the "no shame in poverty" rule. All the expansions are frills.
Very good game.  After a while the 3 player maps can lose their balance, but that takes quite a lot of playing :)
Just got this and looking forward to trying to ease my family into geekdom.
Awesome game, can really get the blood boiling.
First German game and still my favorite of the genre.  Great gateway game.  It's caused more people to go out and buy their own copy (after playing my copy) than any other game I know.
Still a classic. I tend to forget how fun this game can be. Luck and all.  Last played : Feb 2014
Approaching classic status very quickly, this is a fun game thats easy to involve noobies in due to its simple mechanic but fun gameplay.
A classic, however starts to get old if you don't use expansions like Seafarers and especially Cities and Knights
Good, classic game.  I personally prefer less conflict with 3 players.
Can be played over and over again without getting boring. Slightly too much luck to be perfect.
As I'm sure is true for many others, Settlers was the game that started me into boardgame geekdom. Excellent oveall game.
My introduction to German/Euro games.  Now I'm obsessed!
Once the game that got me back to playing boardgames again. Now it doesn't come out of the cupboard that often anymore. With seafarers or city and knights still a good game for a nice evening.
The luck, the negotiation, the trading - all this makes for one great game.

This is probably one of the "classics" of the modern days. The new Monopoly/Risk/Chess for the comming century. It combines a couple of nice gaming ideas, is simple and even is liked by people who don't like boardgames normally. I've had not much persons not liking this game.
This is a classic great game that defines what makes German games great.  Unfortunately it has dice and becomes boring after only a couple hunderd replays.
Classic. What got me into board games

The game by which all others are judged. Although it suffers from a lot of hype, it is still a fantastic game. There are so many strategies that can be employed and different opponents often require different counterstrategies. This one really got me into the hobby.
Excellent doorway game, and a good game in its own right.

Every now and then, I convince myself that I like Reservoir Dogs better than Pulp Fiction. Then I watch Pulp Fiction and remember how much better it is. It's the same way with Settlers. I think other games are better until I play Settlers again.
I really like this game.  I call it "Civilization in an hour".  I'm waiting to get some more plays in before I can justify picking up the expansions.
Awesome game...once i was introduced to the game i was instantly addicted...played 'til 3 am several nights in a row...then i bought it. Instructions are simple and very clear, which is always nice.
A lot of fun and a lot of player interaction.
This is the game that got me back into gaming.  I have played probably only 20 face to face games, and maybe 100 times that many on the internet.  My favorite variant is coastal.

Great game. A nice hand management game with strategy as a major component. Very easy to learn and teach. Secure resource tiles by placing settlement or cities via roads and use those resources to build more cities and settlements, can also buy economic cards to in crease resources or even an army. Enough depth to keep comming back to this game for hardcore gamers and not to complicated for the new or casual gamer.
It doesn't come out that often any more, but it will keep coming out for the rest of my life.
Nice game, the luck factor is what keeps the game interesting.  Good trading and economic system.  My only complaint is that I wish there were more paths to victory, and it can drag towards the end.
What can I say about this game that hasn't already been said a classic.
My favourite game for a long time, and also my friends fav. Been playing it online when I can't get friends to play it. Highly recommended. Icelandic version.
Awesome.  Great game for multiplayer sessions.
As with many people, this got me into board gaming.  I still enjoy a game of it most any time.
very fun game but relies a little too much on luck.
This is the game that started it all. The very first game that I purchased and I was hooked. The all time favorite trading game with lots of interaction.   3-4 Players

I still rate Settlers of Catan highly even though some of it's novelty has worn off after many plays.  Sure the roll of the dice can screw you for resources occasionally but it's still a vey polished and fun game to play.

Still great.  The flaws become more apparent with each passing year, but that's not the point.  The central principles can be grasped quickly, and there are a lot of subtle ways of rebalancing the luck factor to prevent bad experiences.

A near perfect mix of luck and choices.  Both the building and trading offer more direct interaction than more recent Euros.  It sure is tough when you get stuck in this game. Try to give plenty of advice to new players or they may never return.

Not much to say about this game that hasn't been said already -- everyone who I've gotten to play the game has enjoyed it immensely.  If only we could more often find a 3d and 4th player, as it's usually just me and my wife and the 2-player variants aren't nearly as much fun.
Excellent game!  Doesn't take long to learn but takes a while to master.  Perfect!
My first german boardgame. Only played it around 10 times so I have not burned out. I play it a couple of times a year. One of the steady games in my collection.

After my brother bought this and I played it for the first time I was hooked and knew that I had to buy it for myself. A very good game that I have introduced to many of my non-gaming friends with good results.
I'd lower the rating, as I've grown tired of this game - but I don't think that's a fair assessment of the game. Simple to learn, fun to play (even for people who aren't into boardgames).
Awesome game. A standard that my gamer and non-gamer friends like to play.

Though I LOVE this game and think it is the BEST game I have ever played, my friends who don't game much had trouble with it.  Still it was very playable and nobody was totally frustrated, just a little confused at times and continually referring to directions.

A classic.  Great every time I play.  Good balance of strategy, planning and luck.  Changing board makes this game a 10.   Edit: I've played this game more times than any other in my collection. I've reduced it to an 8 simply because I don't want to play it much. It's still a great game, but not my first choice.  It hits the table a lot though because everyone else, including my wife, loves it.

I was introduced to the game a few years ago by a very good friend of mine. The original German edition was used and I was immediately hooked, despite having to ask from time to time what was written on the dev cards. Luck plays a big role in the game, but a good mix of strategy/tactics and trading skills can make a difference. Some games turn out to be pretty tense and I've seen a few harsh quarrels arise, but everything is forgotten eventually (at least until the next game).

Yeah, its fun, less random that most games my friends have ever played, so alot of non-boardgame players like it.  Plus its a eurogame, so shorter.  I will never tire (read . . . cannot ever see myself tiring) of this game.  An added plus: my family likes it.   An added minus: one of them is a sore loser ;o)

I would originally have rated this as a 9 but I'm bored with it now even with the numerous scenarios around. If the game lasts under an hour it's fine but you get the occassional one that just drags. However, I still think it's the perfect gateway game and will always select it when introducing newbies. I always preferred the Seafarers version but am quite happy with just the base game now. Cities & Knights tries to make the game something that it's not. Das Buch has some interesting scenarios though.
Lot's of tension and interaction. Some serious competition as well. Every game is fun for me.
A nice game to play, it is a great game to also get friends intrested in board games.  After a few games though, it can get quite dull.  The expansions are a great help.
The classic, help me bring a lot of people to boardgaming.
This has become a classic game that will hopefully stand the test of time (if not overplayed too much).
The game responsible for getting me back into board gaming. Unique and challenging.
My personal gateway game - the one that got me hooked on boardgames. It's a classic, but there are better games out there.
Easy but long game. Lots of strategy. Very good game. One of easier "civ-like" games.

Instant classic in my collection. My first true "Euro" game and an excellent family game. The modular board adds a great degree of replayability. I can't fault this game on much, besides the value of sheep which is corrected in the expansions.

My (and everyone elses') introduction to German games. I was amazed by the simplicity and complexity all rolled into 25 tiles and some bits. We don't play it much now, having moved on to other styles of game.
A bit of an acquired taste. I didn't like it at first, since the small amount of interaction other than trading meant that it was very frustrating when you fell behind, but it's grown on me a lot.
A classic.  Better with 4 then with 3, since with 3 players a lot more seems to depend on the die rolls.
Is there a gamer who doesn't have this game?
The first "euro" game that I bought, many years back. It's great, but I just can't get my friends to buy into it.

Really great game.  Our family all enjoy playing it.  We've had it for along time: had to make lego card holders for this kids, because they were too little to hold the cards without dropping them a lot!  The only negative comment would be that the card stock is not as good quality as I would like.

A classic game of trading and building. My opinion of Catan has gone up and down throughout the years, but I can't help it: it really is an exceptional game. A keeper in my collection (I'm currently on my third copy of the game).  Suggest.
No more to add. Belongs in every household. (German New Edition)
This was my introduction to Euro games. A truly amazing game. Lost some of it's shine with repeated plays, but still one of the best.
excellent game. Easy to learn, very interactive. Try borko's variant if you only have 2 players (just make sure you ignore the part about not being able to trade with others)
Better than it seems due to it's relative simplicity. A lot of options to go for.
Great game.  We just tried the Seafarers expansion and it's a great addition.
Best non-serious-gamer Euro game.  Gateway to other, more serious Euro games.
The classic that started it all for me.
Nothing beats this game for bringing people into the german-style board game genre.  Prefer to play cities & knights expansion if there is time.

It's like a mature version of Monopoly. People have complained about the die rolling, but I have no problem with it. Getting screwed by a die roll only really affects you if you only play the game once, or once in a long while. When you like a game and play it frequently, then it's no big deal if you lose 1 game to a bad die roll.   Quite frankly, it should take more than just a couple bad die rolls to lose a winning game... people who say they lost to bad rolls probably weren't going to win anyway.  11/12/07: It's been quite some time now since I fully agreed with the above statement. After playing a lot more eurogames, I have gotten way too sick of the frustration associated with being on the 5, 6, 8, and 9 and still not getting resources all game.
