Not a perfect game but essential one due to its incredible accessibility that will wet the appetite of non-gamers to explore the greater depths of board games.

My copy was missing pieces but Mayfair sent me them.  I've only had a chance to play this once, but it is a very fun game.  It might seem complicated at first, but if you can play it with the right people this can be one of the most fun games to play.  With a random map and dice-rolling, every game can be different.
The gateway title to euro games. I credit Catan for sparking my interest in board games after a long hiatus. This title is very popular with my friends and always comes out on game night.
A classic that's still one of my favorites.  Gather resources, block people off, make trades, it has it all.  Best with 4 players.  Played about 40x as of 2/4/2011.
Who hasn't played a ton of Catan?? It's a solid game, but I like Cities and Knights better.  Play listings are only for Dec 2010 and on.
Latest Norwegian edition is the one up for trade. NOT the 15th anniversary editon!
Great game. There's a lot of player interaction.
It's the game that got me into boardgames, and the game I use to try to get others into boardgames.

One of my first board games that I ever played.  When it first came out, its mechanics were creative and it really paved the way for a lot of games that followed it.    It rarely comes off my shelf these days because there is so many more interesting games.  The theme doesnt do much for me, and often luck of the die results in the winner (though not always).

The game that started it all for me, and still one of my favorites.  I love the player interaction, i love the mechanics.  If you are not a fan of games that have luck in them, then yes go look somewhere else, but this game is just simply a lot of fun!  Not a huge fan of the expansions that add more players, or that make the game more complicated, but the Traders and Barbarians expansion adds little variants that keep the game fresh.

It may not be the best game out there, but I have to rate it 10 for value, if no other reason.  I bought Settlers on the advice of friends and have never regretted it.  My family were not big boardgamers before, but now at least a few games of Settlers are a guaranteed part of any family get together.  We've developed "house" rules and learned to include/exclude expansions to regulate the length of the game.  A fantastic game deserving of its fine reputation.
A classic game that will always be in my library.
Classic! Must play for all who call themselves gamer.
I may not enjoy it as much as other games, but Catan is always fun.  It would be even more fun if I could get my "board" to lay flat.
Great game.  Takes too long for me since I got used to online Puerto Rico.
Still no official response about inferior wood on a BGG thread?  Update - clarification received, pleased to have collected a copy.
Just plain, easy, great fun for every person interested. I highly recomend this game for anyone who wants to introduce a friend or loved one into board gaming. A great addition to any collection!
Unlike many people, this was NOT the game that got me into gaming! I can see why it is so popular however! I love it and it will always be in my rotation of games that actually hit the table.
Love it.  I finaly see what the hype is about.
The game that got me into board-gaming.
Sencillo de enseñar, pero no tan facil de dominar.
The Settlers of Catan:15th Anniversary Edition

This game is charming. Great family game. The robber bugs me, but the rest of it is a perfectly reasonable Euro. Can't imagine playing it with my gaming group, because there are so many other choices, but with family or non-gamers? A solid choice.

Of course we have played this game many times already, but before joining BGG. Nowadays there are so many good games, and playing Settlers takes quite some time, that we usually prefer other games. (adi)
With Cities & Knights, Seafarers all with 5-6
Extremely accessible game for introducing new gamers to the world of great board games. This is an instant classic and fairly ubiquitous. I'm never sad to end up playing Settlers on board game night.
I'm probably one of the few players who hasn't played this one enough.

Jedna z moich pierwszych gier. Mało grana, bo przeważnie gram we dwie osoby. I dlatego uważam, że lepsza jest wersja karciana. -- One of my first games. Not played often, because I play mostly in 2 player games. That's why I think Catan Card game is better.

As for many people, this was the game that got me into gaming. Still love to play it - though after so many plays, I will say the luster has worn off just a little bit. However, this game is always the closing game played with my group and now I am introducing it to my wife and oldest daughter - who both like it a lot.
Great game!  Totally worth the money I paid for it!

Our current favourite game playing it to death though it always leaves me feeling like I need a little something more from it. The dice can screw you but it's about being creative with what your dealt... er, I think :)
Fun the first couple of times, lost it's edge pretty quick for us.
As I've gotten to play Catan more and more, it only gets better.

The game that started my travels into serious boardgaming, introduced to me by my cousin's husband years ago. Since then my obsession has grown, and I'm even trying to recruit more followers. Haven't pulled this out in a while, but have fond memories of holiday gaming days with my parents and siblings with this one.

Finally decided to break down and get this game after many purchases for passing it up. Never looked back since. This game sees at least one play every gaming session, if not more.  Beginners, experts, and long time enthusiasts. we all come together at the table for this one.
Very addictive play, and highly recommended to anyone
This is the game that started it all for me. My friends and I have countless plays on this game along with the expansions. I played this for years before moving onto a new euro-game
We run with all expansions except seafarers. My wife cannot get enough of this game. One of our group's favorites that keeps getting pulled out of the game closet.

This game will always be a classic to me. Hard to go back to "roll your dice, move your mice" after this. It may not be the height of board game design, but it was my gateway. I always enjoy playing a game of this.
The game that got me into German-style board games, I have sort of gotten bored with it.  But if it's all people will play, I'll happily play it.
Easy game to teach people, even non-gamers. I think of this as one of the best gateways into the boardgaming hobby.
One of my favorite games so far.  I know that many gamers deride the lack of "control" in catan, but I embrace it.

well i still like it and im happy to play. works best if the other players are prepared to trade. consept sometimes lost on the younger ones. not played with the seafarers expansion, but just ordered it so will soon.
Can't go past it with the combination of easy to learn, strategy and fun.
Got me into euro gaming and I haven't looked back!

I like the social interaction aspect of this game: not all game have so much social interaction.  Negotiation skills do pay off.  Also, determining what you need, what your strengths/weaknesses are, and what your opponent might provide you with and what they need is quite interesting.
Rating's fallen over the years, so it's not "10 material" anymore, but still a very good game.

Classic.  Yeah it may suffer from over exposure and way too many expansions but this one isn't going anywhere for me.  We like playing 4-players on the 5-6 player board.  More spacious and not as confrontational.  Solid game in my opinion and the hands-down "Go to" for converting newbies.  Gotta give some love to "Settlers" (not giving in to the mass-market re-branding hype.)

Settlers of Catan is a game with little down time and high player interaction. The random tile placement, dice rolling and multiple paths to victory ensure that no two games are alike.  Settlers and Carcassonne played a large role in my induction into the world of board games.
My favorite part is negotiating trades!

My gateway game. This little jewel led me to this great hobby back in 1997. I like it a lot but it is much better with the Cities & Knights expansion. There's no other game where trading is as important as in this game. No brainer, get it (and the C&K exp. too)
Was great years ago, but has obviously lost shine when compared to hundreds of other, newer games that do things better. Still, new gamers always seem to want to play this.
Really fun with 6 players. The base game with 4 players is less fun.

Always play this "gold coins" now.  You get one if you don't get any resources.   I really want to like this game more as is, but when you just sit there and wait for rolls... nope.   So gold coins fix this a bit.  Something for everyone... so you can at least start planning and something to do if you are in a resource "drought".
Comes with fishing and three-tile expansions. Played 5 times. Box has minor shelf wear.
A classic - never a bad session.

Instant classic. Played it so much that I pretty much overplayed it for now. Make sure you get Cities & Knights though, the basic game shouldn't be allowed to be sold without.  Great game to get your family into some serious gaming (and yes, that includes your old folks).
Great game over all, but the level of randomization in this game always left me wanting.

My 'gateway game' (bought and first played in 2006).  My relationship with Settlers has been off and on for the last couple of years now, but has since sparked up again. Something about the simplicity of the game, along with the expandability of it makes it something that keeps bringing me back. Got the iPhone App.

Nice easy group game with interaction and simple rules that anyone can grasp.  After numerous plays, I want something beefier and loved what C&K did for the game, although many people I know want to play just the base game.  The base game leaves me wanting more now, but that's after 60+ plays, so well worth the $.  I'me just Settler'd out and cringe when someone wants to play it.
Many many unlogged plays before I came across BGG
CLAAAAAAAAASSICO !!! Meu primeiro jogo moderno :DDDDDDDD !!!  Ainda sim gosto muito ;}]]]]]
This is the gateway game. I'm almost always willing to play.
Great familly game - brilliant idea, fast play - of course - played using cards not dices.
Not a big fan of dice games (I couldn't roll a six on a single dice if it had six pips on every side), but I enjoy this one. My kids will play with me, so we play.

Some gamers complain that Catan is too reliant on luck with the dice rolls, and that's a reasonable complaint. It doesn't affect my enjoyment of the game, though. It's fun to strategize around roll statistics and port locations, and the trading mechanic is always fun to me. The robber somewhat successfully keeps one player from running way ahead of everyone else, as does the trading mechanic.

A ground-breaking game that opened my eyes to the new world of board games.  This game has modular boards, resource trading, resources gathered when it is not your turn.  The game does take a little long for what it is, but after many plays, I still love this game.  The base game is very fun.  If you don't own this game you should.
Gateway game to everything beyond Monopoly and Risk. A must have.
A simple classic. Hardly ever gets played any more in my regular group as there are a lot of other shiny temptations which have overtaken it, but would happily play again.
Es un juego muy divertido perfecto para iniciar a no jugones... adictivo al principio aunque luego de muchas partidas te cansas un poco del azar de los dados
Easy and Fun.  What more can you ask for.
With the right people (those willing to trade) it is quite fun.

Well, we played this in my in-laws' place and they really liked it. I felt it left me a bit cold, but then again I had heard all the hype about how brilliant it is. Fun, definitely. Want to play again. --------------- It is interesting, and a lot of fun. Lately I have been playing it on the tablet.
Fun.  But I always play with Seafarers now. Though I do like just a normal Catan game now and then.
lots of fun, wish i played it more
Another one I'd play most of the time. Sure, it isn't deep, but it's a fun game.

I really enjoy this game and the strategy and thinking involved.  Table talk is able to take place when it is not your turn.  We do not get to play very often since at least three players are required.  I would have rated it higher but it takes a long time to play (2 hrs it seems) and adding expansions make it longer.  Maybe if we continue to play it more we can speed up the game but we know when we start a game it is going to get very involved.  Edit: I've increased the rating because as we've played more, the game time has gone down.
The game that started the love for boardgames. And yes the dice are important in this game, but I don't mind at all. It is a pity that a lot of people look down at this game nowadays.
Хорошая, простая и легкая игра. Очень рандомная, но не надоедает. Тянет играть снова и снова.
One of the first games played. Used to be gateway No.1. Classic.
Classic game. Our family loves it. I love how two games are never the same and the game is for all skill levels
One of the first real board games I've ever played.
Good game, not my favorite, but good. For more thoughts go here http://obliquediversions.com/2011/04/the-settlers-of-catan-review/

We play in 2 with a variant of the official rules, and, while the basic game can be underwhelming, the Seafarers expansion really brings it to life, especially the Wonder of Catan.  Throw in a volcano, factory and a castle from Das Buch and a couple of official wrinkles and you have a beast.
Custom- English 5th Edition, but with the sculpted plastic bits from German 2nd Edition.
I enjoy this type of game with tiles !

My gateway game that introduced me to modern board games. I have played this game hundreds of times and it still offers great strategy in a short period of time with simple rules to allow anyone to quickly be able to play.
Con este juego empecé en esto. Este juego te abre una nueva perspectiva jugona. Tiene un componente de azar entre 4 jugadores o más pero super divertido. No debería faltar en ninguna buena ludoteca.

Esse jogo é uma excelente maneira de introduzir novos jogadores brasileiros ao mundo do jogos modernos. Ele é rápido, cada partida dura em média 50 minutos. As regras são fáceis de explicar (10 minutos). A jogabilidade é fantástica pois permite uma série de possibilidades e o peso dos dados (sorte) é pequeno em comparação aos jogos tradicionais do Brasil. Na realidade a sorte no CATAN "é para todos" já que o valor dos dados pode prejudicar ou beneficiar vários jogadores ao mesmo tempo. Outro fator importantíssimo é que todos os jogadores sempre crescem, uns mais que outros, mas sempre crescem. O tabuleiro formado de peças hexagonais, fato novo para o brasileiro, o que gera sempre um jogo diferente do outro devido a disponibilidade e organização dos recursos. Recomendo. ------------- Fiz [url=http://jogafortal.blogspot.com/2011/06/os-colonizadores-de-catan.html]uma resenha[/url] sobre a versão brasileira no blog do JF.
I think this game really "settles" into an 8 for me; it's not perfect.  However if I judged it on the amount of fun I had playing it as well as the number of times, it would have to be a 10.
Needs Cities and Knights expansion to truly shine.

One of the absolute best gateway games there is. You just can't really go wrong with Settlers, I mean Catan... anyhow.  It's not my favorite game, but it's undeniable just how much of an influence this game has been to me as a gamer and to many others. It's a game I will always suggest to others and pull out every now and then.

Absolute classic.  Clearly works.  Creates a lot of fun.  True, most gamers eventually tire of it and move on, but it is still the golden gateway game that introduces more people into "beyond monopoly" gaming than any other game.  Major props.

A classic that I just can't get to the table lately - definitely a sign that my collection is either too big, or I need to host more game parties.   Great trading and building game.  Only trouble I have with it is that the randomness of the base game can cause some really bad games if you have new players, so I wouldn't suggest this as a 'gateway game'.    3rd edition sold to 2nd and Charles after acquiring 5ht edition "Catan".
Instantly loved this game! I enjoy the negotiating/bartering that is involved
Opened the door for a lot of us back in 1995.  What can I say? At this point I'm sick of it, but it was great fun for awhile.
Old classics, was my gateway game into board gaming. Still play it sometimes with family.
I have the IPAD version, totally addictive!  Can't believe I waited this long!
I really like Settlers especially the trading with other players and the way that you can build you structure with settlements, roads and cities.
classic. Played a thousand times, but still deserves its place in anyone's collection.
First Euro boardgame. Thanks to Wolf. IOS

My intro to board gaming.  A great game with easy rules, and all of the mechanics integrate perfectly into a cohesive whole, like a good piece of music.  Just feel like the ore strategy is too strong.
I'm still far from burnt out on Catan however, my copy is too warped to be easy to set up.
I love playing Settlers, but for those of us that do not like dice, there is a luck factor that does impact the game.
Love this game. I actually own the 15th anniversary edition in addition to the original (upgrade!)
I really enjoy this game but have played it to death. My gamimg friends like it, family not so keen.
Lost in the flippin' shed somewhere. Miss this game.   CRC

This is a classic and it's been one of the seeds to the nowadays gaming. My second gateway game after Carcassonne and a game to bring to the table anytime. There's always a player left behind by the dices, and whenever it's you it's a very unpleasant situation ... despite that aspect this is a great game!

Very good game. My family plays either Settlers or Cities and Knights often. It includes a good mix of luck, skill, and negotiation. We have learned that making effective trades is a key to winning the game.
Excelent trading game. Was my first eurogame and guilty of my game addiction. For some, a litte basic if you've played Cities and Knights expansion.
I actually think that the original Catan still holds up very well. My copy/version is rather boring however. I'd like to get a version with more appealing components.
Lot of Luck, but nice game.
Best with 4 people, need to trade to win.
This was a game I initially hated based on the xbox demo. But after giving it another shot with the physical copy, I've grown to like this game. In fact, I play it daily on my phone!
My first real board game, I've played Catan hundreds of times. It's fun and I'm always good for a round. A solid game that depends on luck and negotiation. Always in for that.

Hay quienes dicen que este juego es capaz de romper amistades e incluso romper relaciones de pareja. Consigue recursos, comercia con los otros jugadores para conseguir ser el señor de la isla de Catán.  Observación: Robar con el ladrón una piedra a otro jugador puede ser bastante perjudicial para la salud.
Played a few times with friends in 2005-2006.  I'd like a nice used one someday.
Played this game numerous times and still continue to enjoy it. Its deep enough to offer good reply value but relatively simple enough to teach to newcomers.
The game that got me into games. Always a favorite in my group.

Settlers, or "a boardgame" as my siblings refer to it, as in "Let's play a boardgame(Settlers)", Never get tired of this one, there are other games I like more and provide more depth and entertainment, but I can always fall back to this for a good evening.
Everyone I have played it with loves it. Replayability is good because of random board and expansions.  Have probably played over 100 times.
I don't know why I haven't buy this game. I was the first non-monopolyriskclue board game I played and I still enjoy it.

I like this game, but for some reason it just doesn't click for me. If I want to play a worker placement game I will definitely turn to Stone Age or Agricola over this one. But, the trading aspect is great at drawing other non-gamers into the fold.
one of the first acquisitions in boardgames, not played very often lately, but I like the trading aspect, since I don't have many games in this genre

A gateway game for me into the hobby after Carcassonne.  Best with Cities and Knights expansion.  the game tends to drag with more than 4 players.  Hate how initial placement determines so much.  That and the potential for unlucky dice.

Good game. My first "new generation" board game played (except monopoly, chess, backgamon, ...).  Very nice to begin your BG adventure, but after you discover more and more games you may forget about this one.

I still enjoy Catan, but I've introduced it to a few non-gamers and had it fall flat when they got extremely competitive and upset with each other over the "I'm not trading with you, but will with them" parts.  Playing with competitive and overly analysis-paralysis prone siblings will make the overall experience quite painful.

A bit random, but still a classic that is a must have in any player's collection.  Probably the best gateway game to introduce to modern game play.  I can understand easily why this game was praised so much as it's over 20 years old and still very solid.
This is the game that got me started. Still enjoy on occasion.
The game that was our "door" to European games and has remained a family favourite ever since we first played in 1999.
This is a classic, but I overplayed it a bit. It only comes to the table when nobody wants to play any of our newer board games.

I retain a soft-spot for Catan. It was my gateway game, and I believe it remains a good gateway game. As it has begun to enter mainstream I find that it makes introducing folk to other games easier. It gets played a fair bit on holiday as even my youngest (5) can play.

I do love it, and maybe I've just played it a million times (realistically around 100), but it's getting a little formulaic. The Knights expansion helps. Up until about the 50th time when you figure out the "right" way to play, it still is relatively different. I just feel like I've kind of peaked. Still one of my favorite games of all time, and still eminently replayable
The game that sucked me into this geeky life!
Another gateway game, and added to our family game nights after Ticket to Ride opened the door to new types of games.
I enjoy playing this game, but so many people have it that I'd rather not own it.  S | 3-4  (*)
Super classic board game. It's probably the game that really brought me into boardgaming. So it will always have a special place in my heart.
Our gateway game that got us hooked.  Would like to own it as a fun game and as a gateway game for others.
I love the game but the family is luke warm on it.  It's also the first game where mom & the kids ganged up on me (I call that cheating!).  ARGGHHHH!!!!

Αν και τώρα μου φαίνεται αρκετά απλό για τα δεδομένα μου, δεν μπορώ να πω πως δεν θα διασκεδάσω παίζοντας μια παρτίδα στο νησί. Αν θέλεις να λέγεσαι boardgamer που σέβεται τον εαυτό του δεν γίνεται να μην έχεις παίξει ΚΑΤΆΝ. Είναι το απόλυτο παιχνίδι για να μυήσετε τους nongamers. Αν δεν αρέσει το Κατάν σε κάποιον καινούριο παίχτη τότε μην το προσπαθήσετε καν με άλλο παιχνίδι.

Superb game! A good mix of luck and strategy and easy to learn/teach too. Expand your civilization over the diverse Catan landscape constantly trying to outdo your opponents, building cities, owning the longest road, and building up an army to help secure your points. Some great expansions to the game as well!
Good gateway game that a lot of people like.  I want to get the Seafarer and 6 player expansion.

Minha nota do Catan vai aumentando conforme eu fico sem jogá-lo. Acho que é um jogo que na minha memória, talvez por ter sido o primeiro, parece mais divertido do que realmente é. Aí fatalmente um dia eu jogo e a graça se esvai um pouco. Continuo gostando bastante, mas não deixa de ser uma decepção.  E a edição da Grow, com pecinhas de plástico em vez de madeira, tira muito da graça.

For some reason, I had a strange aversion to learning this game.  I suppose I thought my other, newer games somehow made Settlers obsolete; that the ideas it introduced had become commonplace.  I'm certainly glad I overcame my reluctance, because the open trading mechanic is unique to my collection, and it's quite novel and fun.   I may be 17 years late to the party, but the place is still poppin'.
I like it very much, we were playing every weekend for the past 3 years. It got boring after a while, but going to championships makes it worth
This is the first board game that really opened my eyes to the wider board game world. Lots of replayability, a good amount of strategic depth and easy to learn.

The one that started it all. I have played many many games of Settlers and have had a great deal of fun. I can play this with almost anyone and most everyone will get a kick out of the game. If you wanna get people into board games, this is a great place to start. That said, now that I have somewhere over a 100 games played, I can see where others have fault with it. It can go on long easily, many games feel like they have been rigged against you, and after many plays it can feel like going through the motions. It's still one of my favorite games, and I think it's more strategic than it's given credit for, and even if things turn sour early, you can still have a chance to win. Still a big fan.  Edit: I am not dropping the score even though Catan drives me up a bit of a wall now. If I got 100 plays of Catan, then I think it is at least worth an 8.
This is the game that introduced me to the new style of boardgames. Not as great as many new ones, but still really fun with the right group.
Great intro game for new players and suitable for a younger audience too! A modern classic.

Not a game I seek out, but one I will always play if suggested by other people.  A math professor friend of mine taught me that the key to the game is analyzing the opening board.  You can always get beat by the luck of the dice, but knowing where the place settlements at the start of the game will mitigate random chance to significant margins.  Once you do that, the game itself becomes academic, unless at least two of the other players are similarly capable.  Basically, once you know the secret of Catan, you can only play against other people who also know the secret.  Unless you enjoy beating up on freshmen.
There are a lot of "haters" for Catan, but I have fun EVERY SINGLE TIME I PLAY.  That says a lot.

Me and my wife's first game of this style and we like it a lot.  Its very easy for new people and younger players to learn, we play with our 10 year old boy all the time.  My initial excitement with the game has diminished the more we've played as luck just seems to play too big a part some games. Update: Bumped the rating up to 8 after a very enjoyable 4 player game with my wife and 2 of my kids.  Luck still plays a big part but you can make the luck work for you by choosing the numbers that are rolled most and putting your settlements on as many numbers as possible.

Catan is a great way to introduce people to euro board games. The familiar dice roll to start your turn helps make it a great gateway for people only familiar with mass-market, roll-and-move games. It has a nice balance of simplicity and strategy. There is enough luck and interactive trading to keep things from getting stale. The variable setup plus all the expansions give it longevity and great replay value. The best thing we did was sort our pieces and expansion parts into adjustable tackle box flats and pack it all into a carrying case. It's our "Settlers to go" kit. I must have played between 50-100 games of Settlers before we found BGG, so my stats on this game are very under-reported.
Az örök klasszikus. Mindig van számára hely. (SK)
Modern Classic. My gateway to gaming. Too bad my copy has wine all over :(

Great accessible game, engaging without being complex. It's great fun, and games are done in less than 120 minutes. I just wish it was a better two-player experience, however; there are evenings where I would like to play it alone with my husband, but it's not very good for that.
It's a classic.  I've mostly played the app, but the board game version was very enjoyable, and my wife likes it (so it gets bonus points).

The granddaddy of gateway games was my personal introduction to modern board games. It was my first euro and I was fascinated by the "victory points" and variable board. Before SoC I didn't know anything existed outside of Monopoly, Risk, Scrabble, etc. However, repeat plays have revealed not all is new and perfect here. Although very good with 4 players, I don't find it works with 3 or 2. The dice can be cruel, making your statistically superior strategy worthless. There can still be a runaway leader problem even with the robber and other players reluctance to trade with the leader. Also, if you happen to get boxed in early in the game there is nothing you can do to catch up.    Seafarers, Helpers, Fishermen, and 5-6 player expansions included.

Nothing I can say that hasn't been said by a million others. It's a classic... not perfect by any means, but I couldn't rate it any lower than an 8 for the amount of time I spent playing it back in the day.
It's an oldie but goodie, and I'm still willing to give it a 9 and play it whenever anyone wants.  I only wish the base game handled up to five players rather than only four.
Great Family Game.  My youngest is 8 and he loves this game too.

Settlers of Catan is among my first boardgames along Tikal. It has been a really big hit in its time and I think it's fun today. The excessive dependence from luck in the game could be a problem, but it is a good starting point for people who has never played boardgames before.  We play Catan with our own House Rules concerning the Cities-expansion. We do not use the Knights portion of the expansion, only the cities, because we wanted to create a commerce and development centered gaming experience.   A rarely played game but always has its own place on the table.
A well-designed and well-balanced game, which requires some tough decision making, and lots of player interaction.
Adquirido en el torneo de Catan de la UM

The best gateway game on the market.  From a strategy perspective it's a little too lucky, but I still have a fun time playing it with people that are unwilling to play heavier games.  Cities and Knights is definitely my favorite expansion.
Not much I can say about this, other than it's simply amazing. It's what got me into board gaming.
alway good fun,  much loved by my Mum
with The Settlers of Catan: Victory Point markers
Edición de lujo en madera por el aniversario del juego
Play almost all of the variants for this game
supreme and replayable game with simple rules
Overplayed, but still THE gateway for euros and strategy games.

What can I say that hasn't already been said about this classic? One, the popularity of the TV show Big Bang Theory has gotten many non-gamers interested in playing this game. Two, when trading is involved women tend to join forces to take down their male counterparts. Three, this game can fail as a gateway game, so introduce it with caution.

Brilliant game, it really creates a nice atmosphere, but it also can be cutthroat.   With expansions, you can play this game many different ways.  Normally use Harbormaster and Fishermen modules. (from Traders and Barbarians expansion)  Some people complain about the dice, but this to us is all part of Settlers. Its a classic for a reason, go and buy!
Fun building, trading game where you use the land to plunder resources in order to gain victory points! Great game!

It's quite a shame that it has become "cool to hate" on Catan. Still a highly entertaining game that can be quite cutthroat among experienced players. I personally find it best with 4 and I'm not a fan of the 5-6 player expansions much, and nor is it as good with 3, but still worth periodically revisiting.
A game I always want to play.
Ultimate non-board game geek experience. I've used this game to introduce numerous friends to the world of board games, as it's light, but this has depth. A must have for non-hardcore gamers.
A classic for a reason.  A friend turned me onto a deck of cards that you use instead of rolling the dice each turn and I have to admit, it does make things more enjoyable and a touch more dynamic.

Un jodido clasico que no falla a 4 jugadores. El eurogame por excelencia. Pleitesia al juego que mas ha triunfado en el club y con el que todo el mundo empieza a enviciarse al rollito de tablero. Solo le doy un 8 porque quizas yo lo he explotado demasiado y ya estoy un pelin cansado de el..

DIGITAL PLAY:  iPad Air Digital Game Only This game is a lot of fun. I have played many games. Still a classic, but now there are so many other great games that compete for my table top. I ended up giving my physical game away and happy to just play the digital game. I still play other Catan games.  2.66
Great game for getting people into games other than RISK and Monopoly

Un jodido clasico que no falla a 4 jugadores. El eurogame por excelencia. Pleitesia al juego que mas ha triunfado en el club y con el que todo el mundo empieza a enviciarse al rollito de tablero. Solo le damos un 8 porque quizas lo hemos explotado demasiado y ya estamos un pelin cansados de el..
Most well known of the 'advanced' board games, and should never be dull to play, though there are way better games out there by now.
Still a favorite. It's easy to forget that base Catan has a much more favorable playtime than Catan with expansions, which requires commitment.

OWNED SINCE 2011 My first game into "modern" board games was Tide of Iron, for me, and Catan, for my wife and kids (bought at the same time). This is a simple game, but my family and I like it. My kids 8+ can all understand the rules and play it. I can bring this out and play with non-board gamers and get them to enjoy it, too. We have bought many, many board games since then, and still enjoy Catan. I am glad we have this game in our board game collection.       I do not like the tiles, they are not hard to set up, but impossible to keep in place. We place a huge piece of glass on top of them to keep 'em there.

I have no idea why I gave this a seven? It's probably way better than that. Maybe it's because it's one of the only games in my collection that I've never won once. I mean seriously...I really stink at it.
# of Players 3 − 4  Best with 4 players Recommended with 3, 4 players  Playing Time 90 minutes
The first eurogame I ever played (Self-Customized).

This is one of the classic gateway games. I can't think of a better intro euro game. You've got high player interaction, dice rolling, and resource management. The game is great and is wildly popular for a good reason.   *** Expansion(s): ***  [thing=2807][/thing] [thing=145942][/thing]

My introduction to eurogames. I don't understand the apparent hate toward this game. The base game is fun and simple enough to teach new people quickly. The game also has enough expansions to keep veteran players busy for quite a while. If the luck of dice rolls isn't your thing there are decks of cards (I think in the Traders and Barbarians expansion) to take their place for a more even distribution of resources.

Like everyone else, this is the first Euro style game Ive ever played. It still hits the table, as it has the right mix of skill and luck. With 2 rule modifications (hand limit up to 9, robber controlled by losing player, no matter who rolled the 7) works OK with only 2 players.

I too was brought into this kind of gaming by Settlers of Catan... Sort of. I was introduced to this game and then bought it, and played it for something like 3 years nonstop. I introduced it to many people and spared the word around, but was never really interested in any of the expansions or any other games.   In time I learned how big and incredible the world of gaming is, and I left Catan behind. I rarely ever want to play that anymore. Perhaps because I played it so much, I now tend to avoid it since I really have no more interest in 'figuring this game'.   Nonetheless, I played it so much as if it was the only game in the world.
The legend that everyone loves, but some don't dare to say it. Great with 3 players, a timeless classic if you might say.
A fun game that I can easily get my non-gamer friends to get into as well.
Classic game that I really like. I loved the way that trading gets everyone in a frenzy.
First game to get me back into board games as an adult.
Still one of the best, especially to get new people into boardgames. Lots of fun.

For what it is (the granddaddy of the Euro-games), I still have a place in my heart for this game. It's the one that got me into collecting games in my teens, and is a must for those just starting to get into board games. Good, clean fun.
2-4 a little confusing the first time playing if you've never heard about it, but once you get going it's quite easy and a lot of fun! Who doesn't like wood for sheep? :-)
What's to say? Easy to learn, hard to master, simple to play with an underlying complexity. An elegance in game design that's proven the test of time.
Love this game but I prefer playing it with the Cities and Knights and/or Seafarers Expansion.
The main problem with this game is that only 4 people can play it. Looking into getting some expansions.
Every gamer should have this in their collection.  Easy as a gateway game, fun game if not over-played.  The expansions are nice and add variety, but they become a slippery slope.
Classic game. Always down to play
Always enjoyable. Got new maps from Mayfair at Origins and GenCon that adds some variety. But to get one, you must be a Knight of Catan. GREAT family game.
陣取り＋拡大再生産がテーマの金字塔。ただ、初級者と安易に囲めるゲームではない。

Gave it to a charity - edit: Got it again from a thrift store :)  This was my favorite game for a very long time - before getting to know the wonderful world of non-supermarket board games. A real, true classic.

Ah, the great gateway game.  There's not much to be said that hasn't been said a million times.  Certain board configurations can make the game play out strangely and there are a ton of strategies to try out, but it largely depends on the board distribution.
My copy is signed by Wil Wheaton, Jane Espenson, Neil Grayston, and James Kyson. I won it from Tabletop (Geek and Sundry on Youtube).
Cheap and easy but provides lot of fun. I very like it.
A classic, but can start to drag after a while. You really have to be in the mood for this one.
Enjoy playing this but someone always gets a crappy start position and never gets any resources the rest of the game. Also own the German version with the artwork by Menzel.
Classic. Got my friends and I into the whole thing.
Probably played this over 100 times -- never gets old.  Only few games have easy mechanics that can have a newbie almost win a game

Even though I am pretty burnt out on this game, it is still one that we owe so much to.  The mechanics are simple enough for it to still be a great gateway game with enough new mechanics to keep the veterans interested and the noobs hooked.
In my opinion this is best game to introduce people to boardgames. Love it.
Welfare variable makes the game WAY better. Still enjoy it from time to time.
The game that got me "hooked". Always love breaking this one out or any of the expansions
Be careful who you play with, when sevens start rolling friendships are put to the test

One of the new classic games. Luck plays a role. Might Wanda try the rule below:  The random dice drove me nuts. I'd be sitting on a 6, 8, 5 and 9, and everyone would be rolling 4's and 10's. I later learned of a rule used in Settlers of America: If your number isn't rolled, you gain 1 gold coin. On your turn, you can exchange 2 gold for any 1 resource at. You can do this twice per turn (you can spend a max of 4 gold per turn). If a number is rolled but is blocked by a robber, that player does not receive gold.

The game that brought me into the hobby, perfect gateway game that I still enjoy playing. Never played the game with anyone that dislikes it and the trading + thief element adds lots of fun to the game.

Already a classic, seems only yesterday that this game revolutionized my already existing love for board games. Player interaction and a changing board game, nice expansions, simple and therefor brilliant mechanics create addiction pure.  I am not as much in love with it as I used to be but I cannot give it a low rating simply for the stand it holds in my gaming history.
Great gateway game!!! So many puns
Trading (light) (3j4jj)  + Ampliación 5-6 jugadores (4j5jj6j) + Navegantes + Ciudades y Caballeros + Mercaderes y Bárbaros  @Monopoly
The gateway game to becoming a gamer.
It's a good Euro, but I just didn't like it as much as my friends. There's a few replayability issues too which need to be fixed with expansions.
The gateway game, if you haven't played it I'm surprised you're even on this site.
Best entry level board game out there.
Onde tudo começou... Hoje está meio de lado pela preponderância do fator sorte, mas de vez em quando matamos as saudades dele.

The game that introduced me into designer games. For the majority of my life I thought all that existed for board games was Monopoly and Life. So when my friends pulled Catan out to play one time, I was reluctant. But as soon as the game was done, I wanted to play again! I asked for Catan that Christmas and haven't stopped playing designer boardgames since.
What can I say...I am a sucker for Catan!
Like many others, this was one of my first "real" board games. It's fun, but seems a bit stale to me after playing some other games.  I'd still recommend it to friends, though.
The more I play it the less I like it. Kind of crazy considering it was my gateway game that I played for a whole year before discovering there were better games out there.
Includes Expansion: - 5-6 Player Expansion - Seafarers - Seafarers - 5-6 Player Extension - The Fisherman of Catan - Helpers of Catan (PnP) - Catan Scenarios: Frenemies
nl, 3-6 players, 10+, 90m, board (ook uitbreiding Steden en Ridders en 5-6 spelers)
Scores prior to 3 Nov 2012 are not recorded. Moving forward, will provide scores on games I played on this game.
First introduction to European style boardgames (i.e. not: roll the dice to get to the end of the board). Played with some people at Milford Sound in NZ.
Base game is too simple and a game with many expansions is too complex. I wonder if there's anything in between.
A great game, one of the first games I bought and still a favourite
I've played this game so much but I still can't seem to pick the right starting spots!
First "Gamer's Game" I played, love it to death. Haven't played much recently though.  02/09/17 Edit: Still want to play.  Lowered Rating from 9 to 8
The classic. Always fun to play, although the dice can bring a lot of luck in some games. When a game is balanced dice-wise this game is very good, because it's so simple.
The first Euro-game I ever had the pleasure of owning. Still one of my favorites, although it gets harder and harder to get other people to play it since they get sick of things easier than I do.
The game i have played the most with the friends. I own the portuguese version, by Devir.
Another classic, again my mother liked playing that, great gateway game
The game that started hobby gaming for oh, so many. It still holds up.

For the level of simplicity of its mechanics, this game is pretty much perfect, apart from the theme being excessively dry and bland. However, it could be more ambitious and have more direct interaction in it somehow. I also feel the rounds pass too slowly because of the die roll and resource collecting at the start of each turn: this could perhaps be sped up somehow such as by each player taking their resource for the round simultaneously, for example, or something along those lines.
Classic game. Doesn't get played much, but this is one of the games that introduced me into hobbyist board gaming so it will always be one of my favorites.

This edition has the great advantage of ocean hexes as opposed to newer versions with the stupid ocean puzzle pieces which are hard to fit. I have rated it fairly low, this is mostly due to burnout as I have played hundreds of games. Far more than any other game in my collection.

If nothing else, this game was instrumental in introducing me to a more interesting variety of board games. There is nothing quite like sitting down with my old friends from that era of my life and knocking down an intense round of Settlers.
A classic. Should be part of every gamers collection. Unfortunately my tastes have now moved past the game.

wasn't planning to buy it, since we already had 3 copies in my gaming group... When I was on Germany for a trip, found it in Kaufhof for 15 Euro... just had to buy it  Even though plastic pieces make the game feel cheaper, I love the new art and those little roads!
Seems a tad too long, but the trading and blocking really help make it an interactive and sociable game.

I really enjoy the interaction in this game.  Gets a bit long with new, or more than 4, players.  A few in my group don't care for it for this reason.  I would personally give it an 8, but will lower the rating for this reason.

I was not impressed with this game the first time I played it.  I think this is because the person who taught it to me didn't do a very good job.  Playing a second time, however, definitely changed my opinion of this game.  I think Carcassonne is better and am not sure if this should be called the "next monopoly" but this game is definitely fun.

Here it is, the game that got me into real board games. For that alone it deserves a high rating. The most unique board that is random every time with many classic game elements including trade, building, dice rolling, and victory points. The artwork and pieces are all high quality, though I'm still a little torn at whether I like the newer version or not.  As for pure gameplay, the dice do matter a fair amount but at least its based on probabilities.  Still, those games where it seems like 4s and 10s are rolled more than an 8 or 6 can be annoying.  I like playing this every so often, it really doesnt get old.
The randomness of the game is somewhat overstated, and Settlers is more of a social manipulation through trading game anyway.
The gateway to cardboard crack of the board game variety.
What can I say?  It was the gateway drug.  And it should be rated higher than this - I'm just burned out on it after probably more than a hundred plays back in the day.

This has become an old stand by.  It really works well as a gateway game, but my tastes have moved on.  I'll never get rid of mine, but it won't see the table often if I'm playing with my family of experienced gamers.

A hour long game that can come down the to turning of a single card to finish it. The winning conditions are awkward leading to 'oh, I have won - that was a surprise.' type reaction. Also, players can get left behind in the whole development process.  Edit: Oh but it does have it moments and it survives repeated plays without getting old quickly.
No one ever trades me their stone. ;)
Good intro game. loses it's luster after a while though.
One of our favorite family games.

This is our usual go-to family game.  I don't think I've ever won though.  I keep trying different strategies and still haven't found one that works for me, but also beats the other players.  I've tried keeping my starting towns close, separating my towns, keep my towns towards the inside of the island, both on the outside near ports, and a combination of all of those.  Don't know... I do enjoy it though.
I never play it anymore, but it's a great classic that serves as a stepping stone for any newbies. Also, it got a LOT of mileage when I first got it.
Very good, light game. Highly luck based and has a big bash-the-leader problem, but it's satisfying and fun. Expansions feel tacked on and unnecessary.
This is an easy game to explain to people so you can quickly get new players into your gaming group.  This is a great "spring-board" game into the deeper board games for newer players.
hard to play with few people.
My first board game. Classic Euro gaming.
BGE Jan 2018 - got when Amazon had sale but supplied fake
First hobby game I ever bought. I'll play anytime.
Il gioco che ha rivoluzionato tutto, uno dei più importanti di sempre secondo me, ed è uno dei pochi che possono giocare anche i refrattari

Very good game concept but quality of workmanship is low. Pieces warp quickly even when bagged and played in a low-moisture environment. This makes assembly of the board challenging and frustrating - moreso the more often it is played. Aside from that, Catan uses a relatively simple game mechanic that is easy to pick up on and fun to play. Best played with 4 players in order to maximize the trading/barter features and competition.
What can I say about Catan? It's Catan. Why in the hell would you even be looking at this list if you didn't know about Catan? Go play Catan.
Old standby for the family.  I say old, we only started playing it last year, but it has rapidly become a favourite for parents and grandparents.  Shame the base version only plays four.
For me still one of the great classics. It is both an extremely communicative and extremely strategic game.
J'avais peur de ce jeu car je voyais beaucoup de "non-initiés" jouer et en parler. Un peu comme Monopoly ou Risk. Je me disais que c'était un jeu pour grand publique. J'ai été agréablement surpris!

This was my gateway game. The first board game I'd played since my Monopoly and Battleship-based childhood that made me realise what I'd been missing out on. I had no idea there was any other way of making games other than roll to move. Subsequent German games I've tried don't even use Dice! Germans are so clever. :) Anyone that tries to deny the importance of Settlers to this hobby is either lying to themself or has just had unfortunate experiences playing this with bad groups. This game is a classic. I'm already completely sick of it, but I owe it so much.
Modern day classic. Great intro game to help convert the Monopoly types.
This game is so re-playable. We have all the extensions, but so far have only opened two.
A great game that you can always come back to.

Optimizing for the right mix of resources (e.g. getting brick and lumber to start), likely resources (likely hexes), and route planning (getting ports, blocking opponents) make for a great mix of strategic elements.  Simple to learn, but yet some strategic death.  The game is marred somewhat by "accumulated advantage", once you fall behind it's hopeless and that's usually obvious to everyone.  If players are paying attention they will cease trading with the leader, which helps to some degree.  Also marred somewhat by too much randomness in the consequences of dice throws and who gets the the resources.
Even the kids enjoy this one.
I like it. People seem to hate it. Simple and enjoyable :)

JUGADORES: 4 TIEMPO: 60-120  PARTIDAS GANADAS/PERDIDAS Navir 4/10 Oca 4/10 Tabli 3/1 Juanlu 2/3 Paloma 1/0 picassojac 0/1 XAXO12 0/1 Mª Angeles 0/1 Sergi 0/1 Patri 0/1 Angel (Patri) 0/1 Luisa 0/1 Loli 0/3 Jose 0/3 Pepon 0/3 Mariloli 0/5
Great game - want to play it more often.
down from 7 will play sporadically without Seafarers and/or Cities & Knights up from 6 rated as if played with Seafarers and Cities & Knights
A classic that I enjoy though I never win... Probably my brother's favourite game. The first designer game (alongside Carcassonne) that I bought.

In theory, I love this game.  Unfortunately I have a hard time finding other people to play it with me.  I play most games with my family, and this one doesn't get taken off the shelf as much as I'd like. Will adjust rating with more plays.  But I love the elegance of the design and gameplay, and hope to play much more of it in the near future.

LO MAS Como a muchos más les ha ocurrido, juego con el que empecé a interesarme en esta afición.   LO MENOS Que te pases media partida sin que los dados, te sean favorables. Que se ensañen contigo y el ladrón no haga más que robarte tus (a veces) escasos recursos.
Last time we played it, we ran out of development cards. Crazy.
The pinnacle of resource management board games. Sweet talking during resource trading will get you far in this game.

One of the all-time best. Surprises me that games like Puerto Rico rate higher. Plenty of interaction and plenty of reasons to pay attention to what your opponents are doing. So simple to learn, and never feels like the same game twice. Can get frustrating when the dice fail you, or when the robber seems to have your number. Still, I never hesitate to accept a game invite.
Classic for a reason. Rule complexity is just right, good player interaction.
One of the best gateway games, easy to learn, fun for the whole family. In 4 or 6 players tends to get crowded.

Great game, even with 2 players using the variant that each player rolls twice each turn (collecting double resources and no trading allowed.) No other rule changes needed.  Rule book is a mess, which is ridiculous considering they have had years and years to fix it.
This game is a staple.  Family favorite.

This is my gateway game. Not that it got me into gaming, but it introduced me to euro games, which have been a huge part of my hobby ever since. I burnt out on this for a while, having played this A LOT between 1995 and 2005, but have played some games in the last couple of years and am enjoying it again (adding in some expansions helped to give it a fresh feel). Also have started introducing it to my kids now. I think this had stood the test of time very well. It has held a solid place in my collection for 20 years now. I would say it’s great to start new gamers with this game, but I havn’t met anybody that hasn’t played Settlers in a long time (well, other than my kids, but they learned gaming before I taught them Settlers).
The gateway drug to euro gaming. Too bad the dice hate me. And everyone is out to get me in this game.

Great gateway to the world of boardgaming. I still love to play, especially with those friends who are "Game of thrones oriented", it brings a whole new light into the game. :D  People who think boardgaming is for kids, got hooked on this like ants on sugar. :)
Great Gateway.  Sheep/Wood jokes all day.  Enjoy the trading aspect.
One of the best games ever. Classic like monopoly, but this is a great game indeed. You never get tired playing it.
Good game.  Love the game-to-game variation in the map - one of my favorite designs going.
Classic game.  Great for introducing family and friends into the higher level games.  This is one the family always wants to play.

The game that really got me into the hobby.  Yes it can get frustrating toward the end when the robbers on your only source of ore, and no one will trade with you, but still a classic, and I'd argue still the best gateway game.

Classic casual game that is at its best with 4 players (or the 5-6 player expansion).  The strategy you will use is going to be different every time you play if you randomize the board as well as the numbers on the tiles.  Great trading mechanic will really challenge your negotiating skills with your group.  I have yet to meet someone who did not enjoy playing this game!
Classic game that does all of the things you want it to do.
Very good game to use as an intro to more mature board games! Way way better than Mono**** (you know what)!

My introduction into Euros, and I still won't pass on an opportunity to play. However, the pricing structure of this cash cow is a massive barrier to entry. Want an expansion? That'll be the same amount as the base game. Want to play 5 or 6 players? that'll be $20 per for the base game and an additional $20 for each expansion. If that's what the market will bear, then I'm not the target market.

This is the game that I learned about Euro Board Games on.  I found the cooperative nature of the game great but I could still be somewhat competitive if I so chose.  Even with a full compliment of players I found game play to go fairly quickly.  Great for a group of strangers to get to know each other and just as great for a group of friends.
I am also very interested in Seafarers+5-6 player expansion, Traders and Barbarians + 5-6 player expansion and Explorers and Pirates.

Although it doesn't look like it, Settlers is the modern day Monopoly in success and play.  The game has you roll two dice in order to grab resources and there's also a lot of negotiation in it too.  That being said, there can be a chance that a player gets hosed because of unfortunate set up and die rolls, which makes this game far from perfect.
The board game that got me into board gaming.
This classic should be in every gamers library

Love it - will still play at any time.  I love when a newbie to the hobby will gush about this "great new game called Settlers of Catan..."  Oh, let me open your eyes!  The gateway game.  If they don't like it, give it up and find a new friend, lol.
Great introductory board game for a group.
A classic Euro-game. I may be one of the only gamer-types that have played it less than 20 times, so I still enjoy the basics.
check to see if the boxes still smell like the fun had on The Farm. Also, FUCK THAT MFing ROBBER.  He's such an asshole.

This game will always have a place for me, being the game that got me properly into board games (i.e. beyond regular family board games).  I think it's a fantastic gateway board game that has a very fast learning curve.  It is let down a bit by lack of depth in tactics once everyone reaches a certain level of understanding of the game's mechanics.  Comment based on 60+ plays.
Excelent game to introduce people into euro games. It is a family game. Not soo much strategy involved in the game. Not so much tactics but a good game

People say that this game is a relic, but I still think the game holds up great. I love the diplomacy and trading involved in the game, which most people seem to complain about. I must admit that if you start in a bad spot, the game can be decided for you from the very start.
The modern classic for me, still played, many times.
Set up takes too long, hard to get on the table.

Es, sin dudas, uno de mis favoritos. En las pocas partidas que he jugado me ha dejado siempre con ganas de mucho más. Es uno de esos juegos que te produce un entusiasmo diferente durante las partidas. Eso sí, a veces y con un poco de viento en contra, puede llegar a construirse muy lentamente todo.  Cada vez que lo juego lo disfruto mucho más.

There is a lot of sentimental value in this game, and admittedly it is hugely based on luck (after your initial placement, of course). But if you play with the right people who are willing to make reasonable trades, this game is still very fun.
Even if it's a good game, I am not that fond of trading.
1995 Spiel des Jahres  1995 Deutscher Spiele Preis  1995 Essener Feder
Pretty fun game, easy to learn and play. Kids like it, around an hour to play.
Love it but won't play this game with 4 players without the expansion
Great games. Especially for new people to board games
play over night when i was young

I rarely win Catan, but I still have loads of fun. It is a strategist's game; someone who can loves looking at the board and predicting everyone's future moves and how to block them. It also has a decent amount of random luck, which, in my opinion, every game needs otherwise it would be like Chess. If I wanted to play chess, I would play chess. Settlers of Catan is a timeless game. One that I can bring out and have fun with without any of the expansions. Personally I don't think it needs expansions, the core gameplay elements would be ruined I think if you threw in some crazy ideas. Then again, I can't really talk since I haven't played a whole lot of them. Overall, Catan is a great game with great player interactions and great mechanics. Love it.
Can't say enough about this game; perfect gateway game.
Funny game with nice graphics and simple mechanics + some player interaction.
A good basic game. A gateway drug to board gaming so to speak. I found some people who would be interested in playing that don't own it, so I'm hoping to get it sometime in the near future.
Fantastic strategy game with a hint of luck added to it. Played regularly with friends and on my iPad.

Good game,a game to play with kids. A lot of platforms to play it, iPads, android. Solo scenarios electronically as well. It does cover expectations and, although too depending on luck, it does deserve the investment.
I love this game. Collect resources, expand territory, mess with opponents, and trade with others. All this in a quick to learn and fast to play game.
with Cities & Knights, Explorers and Pirates, Seafarers, and Traders & Barbarian Expansions.  All Expansions with 5-6 player extension.
I've retired from playing this game, but it's a great gateway game to strat douching people.
Classic.  Fun to play every once in a while, but the games just seem to be getting longer and loooonger.
En la caja de Ciudades y Caballeros

Vanilla Settlers is a good gateway game. I would recommend it with 3-4 people at most. Some people argue that luck plays too much a role, but I really think that it depends on the group of people you play with. A quiet non-negotiating group will play very differently than one where everyone is offering quick and clear trades. I've played the game for years, and I think that in many ways, although luck plays a role, the skill lies in assembling wins in spite of bad rolls or bad initial placement.  I think the game suffers more from the ability for a player to play kingmaker.  For gamers who desire something more complex, I would recommend playing with the Cities and Knights expansion, which adds more ways to win, while retaining the core mechanics.
My wife's favorite game.  However I am horrible at it and can never seem to win, no matter how many guides I read.  I like to play but it is at time dishearting since I know I won't win.
It seems as though everyone has time for a game of settlers!
The base game is ok, but to really enjoy this game, you need the Cities and Knights expansion.
Bought this at Target. I was not sure about it at first. But once we played it, got hooked. I like Star Trek Catan better. I am a Trekkie. :)
Always solid but rarely makes it to the table these days.
What can I say, I can see how this has replaced Monopoly in many homes and has been the first game for so many people. Very nice game with some minor (and major) flaws.
One of the first games to get me into board games.  An old standby.  Prefer Star Trek Catan to this, however still a good game to dust off now and again.
4th edition. Box is showing some wear but game is in good condition, all pieces, instructions, hexes etc. included.
Play with wife and kids and a semi-regular basis.  We all enjoy this game.
This depends on who you are playing with.

2016 ====  Catan is my family's favorite board game. As a gift to my oldest son a couple of years ago, Catan stands as possibly the best bang for our buck game purchase... well... ever. Whenever we have 2 hours to spare (rare these days) we break out this staple and rock and roll. Recently my family has taken to colluding against me (3 on 1) from the start. This doesn't bother me one bit as it adds a real edge to the game for me and presents quite a challenge to my wining prospects. I tend to not be a fan of explicit negotiation in games, but when it works it's exquisite.  [2014.03.01] I like its general appeal and the ability to get in a quality game with people who wouldn't otherwise play games.
This is the game for me that introduce me to modern board games. I still like playing it.
If there was one game I love to teach new players, it's this. I have probably sold 30 copies of this game with new people trying it out. Perfect entry level game.

A great game!  This is the game that initially brought me into the hobby, and continues to convert our non-gamer friends into gamers.  Fun, interactive, and strategic.  A must have for any game collection.
This game is interesting but I don't like to many luck involved in every turn.  23.6.2015. -> 8 23.6.2015. -> 7 10.10.2017. -> 8
THE game that got me in to table top gaming. Will never pass down a play.
Still the Daddy of strategy games
It's Settlers.. what's not to like.  Getting a bit long in the tooth these days, but still worth a spin!

Civilization, Negotiation - Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Modular Board, Route/Network Building, Trading 3-4p (4p), 10+, 90m Expansions: 5-6 player expansion Seafarers Seafarers 5-6 player expansion Die Siedler von Catan: Historische Szenarien

The first boardgame I owned and I still love it! Modular, so every game feels different.  Edit: owned the edition with plastic pieces. Found those minis very unclear (the wooden models gave a good overview of the board). Updated my collection with the Kosmos wooden edition.
Great game with a different board every game.
Fantastic game, I have never played a game so much, this is the game that got me into to gaming, although BBG play count only says a few, i would have played this close to 100 times if not more!
Yes, this was my gateway game as well.
I LOVE this game. I used to play it a lot with the wife and kids.
Love the amount of variety and replayability. Classic classic. Sold it on as it wasn't getting the plays it deserved, and my friends have copies too. So I'll be seeing it again on occasion.
Game that get me in the modern gaming, thanks the game!  Have played it for tousand times, and still love this game, especially with new people.
One of the best game ever for any kind of gamer (casual, expert, first time, etc). A must have.
Still a solid game after all these years. Not much story or backdrop compared to some, but still very good. Don't be a hater.
Video Seafareres Expansion The Dice Game
Probably one of the best family games.
A simple classic.  The whole family loves to play, so this one hits the table often.

Excellent game to introduce new players to board games, especially because they might win (it happened in my last two games), but also because the rules are simple and fast to learn. Although I like it, it's too luck driven. If the dice don't like you, you won't stand a chance.

This is the first *real* board game I ever played, so it will always hold a special place in my heart.  Haven't played it in forever, though.  I hear the expansions really add something, so I'd like to try those out.
Another classic. DOes not get played as much as before, because there are so many new games to my collection.
Also contains the 5-6 Player Expansion and The Fisherman of Catan Expansion.

The game that got me interested in board games.  I love the variability of the board and having to make the best of situations that aren't always within your control.  An element of randomness with the dice, but still rewards strategic thinking.  Feels great to place a settlement in the most awkward place for your opponents and watch the despair on their face when you do it!
Love this game a lot. Has an interesting depth of strategy and some very cool trade elements.

This game has been superceded now by hundreds of others which took its influence a lot further, but it's just such an important title...hell even I played this before I ever discovered the wonderful world of designer boardgames, and going back into it I still find it fun, even if a lot of the major strategies for the core game are well known by this point. Have to try some expansions but they're not cheap.

Really enjoy the trading aspect of this game. Keeps people involved and can add some tension without being the person who ruins the game with the trading options. Easy to teach and learn, long enough that you don't feel you wasted your time with setup.
This is the game that started it all for me.  I still go back to it but really only like it with the Cities and Knights expansion.

Don't believe the negative hype from many other BGGeeks!: this is a solid game, and it should replace all others as the introduction to modern designer board games. It's dirt-simple, and it's balanced like a dream. I rarely have games finish that aren't incredibly tight. Don't let the group get addicted to it; pull out Alien Frontiers or Small World to get them into something slightly more advanced. But think about the Milton Bradley games you may have grown up on... all the roll and moves and totally one-sided games of Monopoly. Then consider that you can buy Settlers at most major department stores. We live in a golden age, people.

This is the game that got me (and thousands of others) into this hobby. It gets worn out very quickly, but it will always have a spot on my table even if it's just for a nostalgia play through once in a blue moon.

this is the only version I have ever played. I know there are other versions, but no one wants to play when I do and now ... I am not that enthusiastic about Catan. Will Wheaton's show makes it look fun. perhaps I just need equally enthusiastic Catan players., yeah that's it.
I don't love playing it with real people, but love the app.  The set up is everything.  Get screwed in the initial set up and you are done.  I am also not a fan of playing it with more than 3 people.
a fun game, just dont let the others cut you off with their roads.

Classic board game choice. If you like board games in general its difficult not to like this one. The whole exchange - resourses between players - idea is a big plus. Better play it with four. It maximizes the pleasure of playing this game ;) I dont like dice much in board games but on this one i make an exception. Fine with me!!
I posted a full review on The Opinionated Gamers:  http://opinionatedgamers.com/2015/07/24/sdj-re-reviews-17-die-siedler-von-catan-a-k-a-the-settlers-of-catan/
Great fun. The dice bring a luck mechanic that helps to balance the game for new players.

I just picked this up after wanting it for years. Now that I've played it, I have to say that its rather simple, and yet still a challenge. Random setup helps avoid the problem of starting in the exact place each time. I think I still prefer Civilization, but as a simplified version that lasts about an hour (play multiple times for the best experience) it's perfect.

As with many other gamers, Catan introduced me to the world of designer board games. It was a huge hit with my friends, my roommates, my family, and even me. I say this because I rarely desire to play it.  I've become Cataned out, most likely because I've moved on to greener pastures (with other sheep). My tastes in games have become more clear and I've developed a palate that is more defined, making Catan slip in my regards. Add to that the fact that my brother always wants to play Catan and I've become a little burned out on it.  However, it's a classic, both in the history books and in my mind. I've played enough games to realize that Catan is still one of my favorites, despite my hesitance to play it sometimes. I'm more willing to try new things and introduce a friend or family member to a game that is perhaps a little more thrilling or deep or thematic. All that said, Catan is a splendid game.
Clásico. Aunque ya no lo juego, tiene el cariño que se merece el juego que te motiva entrar a este mundo.
I like this game so much. What I prefer is the commercial part.
A great game - still to this day. I admit it's not my favourite - but it's a great family and gateway game.
Classic. It all started with this one. Need I say more?

Very good resource gathering game. Easy to learn, still fun to play. Some great strategies to it, but anyone can still win with enough luck. Usually the dice seems to decide who wins by landing on the same few numbers over and over (and over and over and over....)

Forever a classic, and the game that got me into board games.  Perfect starter game for those who haven't made the leap from Monopoly to Agricola.  Pros: Simple to learn and enough luck for beginners to have fun Variable game board Rewarding expansion Trading  Cons: Too much luck(dice and card deck) for those who love strategy games 5-6 player expansion not included No 2 player game  Play it till your bored, then buy Cities and Knights.
Yes.  This was the game that got me into the hobby.  But man did i play this a ton!  Enough.

This game provides a very intense and enjoyable evening. After approximately 10 plays, we are still trying to find out a good strategy. Dice roll luck is the bane of my existence sometimes, but that comes with the territory.
This was my first foray into the Euro game world. Opened a door to so many other cool games that I had no idea existed. Don't get to play it as much as we used to.

A great game that I've played many times and have used to introduce others to the hobby; but it does get stale.  We crafted some houserules to make the game more interesting for the non-active players which really saved it for us.

Probably not much more can be said about this game, but it's historically probably one of the most played games in my collection with a variety of groups. Nowadays I play games mostly with family, and this is one of our standards. I probably would not choose it as often as we play it, but it has stood the test of time and is still an entertaining enough game that I don't mind playing it when other people make the request.   The variable game board and luck of the dice rolls make each game different enough to avoid to much same-ness from game to game. Good for just about everyone, but probably less enjoyed by those who dislike lucky swings in games as it relies heavily on the aforementioned dice rolls. There is some room for strategy in what spaces you choose at the start and where you decide to build, but really the success of those choices is relegated to the dice. That doesn't bother me as I like a little luck shakedown in my games (probably because pure strategy isn't my strong point!)
Super replacement for monopoly and all those Milton Bradley type standards for the non gamer. Best with 4 people.
A gateway for a reason.  Still holds up, fun all around.

Definitivamente lo tienes que tener!!! si boardgamer dices ser: " me salio en verso " jejejeje  Definitivamente es muy buen juego. Sea el juego base hasta para 4 jugadores o incluyendo la expansión que permite  1 ó 2 jugadores más. Clásico de todos los tiempos 9. 15/09/2014
It probably deserves a lower score, but it is a cornerstone of modern gaming.  I respect that!  It's a classic.
Plus several mini expansions that I can't remember anymore.
This game will also always be a favorite bc it was one of the first strategy games I picked up... Wish it played well 2-player without adjustments...

After playing this to death, my friends and I have been trying to play with expansions. Cities and Knights has some interesting variables. Seafarers is great as well. Can't wait to try out some others.

Love it. Never got around to buying the 5-6 players expansions and now it seems kind of pointless with so many other games -- not to mention the new plastic editions. Sad, really, as wood just feels so appropriate in this game.
Probably the most wildly known Euro game. Something good to play with anyone who enjoys a decent board game and chances are you can't go wrong with pulling this game out in any group.

Just enough randomness to keep the game interesting after many, many playthroughs.

I still enjoy it, this and TtR is how I got started, always will have a warm place in my heart.

Same old story: this one got me hooked in high school back in the early 2000s. Mistakes in reading the rules plus house rules evolved over the years have led to a unique variant that we play. Just recently learned of the variant where you get coins to spend on goods with prices varying based on your VPs at the moment; want to try it soon!
"So I hear you like board games. What games are your favorites?"  "I like Monopoly, Life, Scrabble, and this one game you've probably never heard of called Catan."

Dos primeiros jogos modernos que joguei. Tenho uma relação afetiva com ele.  Acho ele um jogo ótimo, adoro a negociação, a produção e a sorte no dados. Great fun, very well balanced.   Tactics are important, and the role of luck is minimised as in this game you make your own luck by being aware of probabilities. Great family game, sessions last 1 hour aprox. Always wanted to try it but until now I could meet someone that has it. I have played it a few times already, and I am still not bored with it.  I still have to try the expansions, but for now it suits our needs.

I'm sure I share this with many people, but this was the first board game outside of the Monopolies and Scrabbles that I played. It was my gateway game into a world of strategy and intrigue, dice rolls and meeple.

Played Settlers again, as part of a team with my husband against other people at the Ballard Library Board Game Night.  And we utterly demolished our competition.  So, some of the players were close, but we made the best trades and had the best strategy.  We won with the longest road (no surprise for me) and it was the first time my husband and won, so that was awesome.  All in all it was a good night!  Played this at the Library again, and without mercy, I stomped my opponents, dividing them with my longest wall, creating a wood monopoly, and making some very smart trades.  My husband was almost tied with me - it was an extremely competitive and very close game.  It was great!

A classic, perhaps one of the few euro-esk games I will ever really enjoy. Egyik játszópajtimnak van meg egy pár kiegészítővel együtt. Már rágtam a fülét egy ideje, hogy hozza már el egyszer! Aztán legutóbb nála játszottunk, úgyhogy nem volt kibúvó. Remek játék, baromira élveztem!! Rendkívül egyszerű szabályok (csak az alappal játszottunk), nincs min sokat gondolkodni, és bevon a játék minden másik játékos körébe is. Az üzletelgetést minden játékban élvezem, itt is jókat mulattunk rajta; ami talán kicsit zavaró lehet, az a kocka, bár ezt most nem éreztem (most szerencsém volt, és jól jött ki nekem). Igazából némi izgalmat hoz, hogy várjak e még, vagy cseréljek... Egy szó mint száz, nagyon klassz! Legközelebb bedobunk egy pár kiegészítőt is!

A classic.  Enough strategy combined with luck without being overly heavy.
