My first game. Really good introductory game for people beginning the hobby it just shows how games can be different. I still do like to go back to it now and then or when friends come that are not deep into the hobby.
In some ways, my real introduction to the land of modern board games. It holds a deep hidden place in my heart that will always be there.
Ranking based on the fact that I can get my easily bored sister to play with me. It's definitely not my favorite but I'm glad it allows for gaming with non gamers loved ones.
aggiungere una decina di partite pre bgg + espansione Mercanti e Barbari
A very good game. It's a shame that I'm not as good player as the game is ;)

When I am picking out games, rarely does this game hit my radar. But when I have a new gamer, this is one of the best to teach. There's also some solid negotiation in it.   Played this the other night with my kids, and enjoyed how their gaming has evolved since we first played this when they were 4. Something to be said for a game that such a range of gamers can enjoy.
The Afrikaans edition. Nice board, don't like the plastic towns, cities and roads though. Medium Light

The reason I want to explore board games more. Leaves space for table talk and fun trade banter, while giving you a solid game to play and think about. The best moment is the mindfulness-minute, when everyone maps out their opening placements after setup. Fills an important niche for my group, and will likely hold it's place for a long while.

It's Catan... nothing else to say that hasn't already been said! I got the iOS version I now play more often than the board version. Saves all the set-up and working out the rules (especially with C&Ks!)
Another great game to introduce people to. Wood for Sheep anyone?
Classic eurogame, always fun to play, but we've tired of the base gamew and prefer Cities and Knights or newer ones now.  Great for kids though.  Introduced by Teo in 1990s.

In boardgaming culture, the term 'Gateway Game' applies to any game that reintroduces players to the hobby. These games generally have more strategic depth and interesting decision making than 'classic' board games.  Catan was my gateway game. I played the hell out of Catan when I first got it. I kept it in my car for quick access, I played it so often. It is an excellent game, with many exciting opportunities for player interactions.  Now that I have more experience with the hobby, there are a few aspects of Catan that bug me. I'm not a big fan of the dice-rolling aspect, but the game does a good job of keeping the playing field level. In a lot of games, one player can end up far ahead of the other players, though this situation doesn't come up too often. These criticisms aren't very big, but they are worth mentioning nonetheless.  Overall, Catan is an excellent game, and I would happily play it at any time.  Sidenote: Never make a 3 for 1 trade.
Great game. Still love it. Strategy and planning meet abundant player interaction. Besides that Catan has great gateway qualities ("come sit and play, rookies!").
A great game to introduce someone to boardgames.
Despite what I've heard, there's nothing quite like Catan, at least not that I know about. Love it!
This has been a favorite of ours, sadly we need three people to play so this doesn't get out as often as it should.
This rating is only with the "Pirates and Explorers" expansion. I have no interest in just the base game by itself
The Game for everyone!   *signed by Klaus Teuber (Spiel18)
This is the game that kicked off my interest in board games beyond Monopoly and Risk. And who doesn't like having wood for sheep?
Very nice game, but I'll never play without Seafarers expansion.
Old school strategy, which I am bad most of the time :)
El juego con el que me inicié en el mundo jugón. Ideal para jugar con amigos no jugones. Siempre nos quedará Catan

A "modern" day classic.  Tons of player interaction.  Tons of hand management.  And tons of ways to block or stop a player from taking off with the victory.  Just make sure you get on numbers that get rolled.

The most popular euro by a longshot probably. It's pretty fun. I'm not huge into the chance-based resource acquirement, even if there are statistical weights to it. The expansions add a lot of much needed nuance and variety.

Quintessential gateway game, and arguably responsible for sparking euro-game trend in United States.  Most board gamers at this point reject Catan or are thoroughly sick of it, but I think it holds up remarkably well.  Still one of my go-to gateway games, and mix of strategy and luck is well-balanced.
Sitting unplayed for ages after this was given to me by a friend.  Thought it looked UTTERLY boring.  How wrong I was. Played it and I see what all the fuss is about
Really fun game, and with the expansion can play up to six people. Multiple strategies can be used and Cities and Knights adds even more. One of my favorites.

This game pulled me back to the board gaming world, after a pause of almost 20 years. Playing it for the first time in December 2013 and was fascinated by its simplicity yet elegant gameplay. It was definitely a 10 for me as a new gamer who just (re)entered this paper gaming world.  After so many plays during the past years, I started playing other games and was exposed to much more complex and eye-openning gameplay mechanisms. So, I (as an experienced casual gamer) updated The Settlers of Catan as an 8.   April 2015, Stuttgart
A game that serves as a great gateway-game into the vast world of tabletop gaming. See my full review here: http://www.ravenoak.net/archives/3133

As is the case for many, Catan was my first modern board game, and I loved it. I still do, even if playing it often leaves me a bit on the frustrated side. For the most part a very well designed game, the only complaint I have about Settlers is the pronounced role of luck, given that your ability to carry out any strategy is largely contingent on rolls of the dice. You can position yourself in theoretically the perfect position, but if you don't get the dice rolls, you don't get the goods. Within the scope of my experience, it is unusual for a game to seem to require so much strategy while having that strategy contingent on so very much good fortune.
Un gran juego, que interesa a todo el mundo (aunque es algo difícil de explicar a novatos). Algo largo en el tiempo.
Very well balanced game that rewards strategy with just enough luck in the mix.  The only downside to the game is that sometimes it feels like the winner is decided in the initial placement.

Fue el primer juego de mesa moderno que tuve, me lo trajo mi hermano de Brasil, lo hemos jugado tanto que ya las cartas están desgastadas. Se que mucha gente odia el Catan pero a mi me parece un juego muy bueno para jugadores nuevos.

Catan is a great gateway game. Sometimes folks don't trade and the robber isn't kind. But when it works, Catan is hugely fun. Always up for a game. My first play was a giant sized version at Gen Con with beautiful tile pieces. Ah memories.
Lots of interaction with fellow players and one of the great gateway games to teach newcomers.
A great game but too much is determined by starting positions.
Lost some luster, but only since I have played it a ton. It is still a great intro to board games game.

Pre-Catan, I used to like Board Games, but wouldn't have really been that into them. Post-Catan, I realised that what I knew of board games was very out-dated.   I'd say that my experience of playing Catan is similar to so many people. Our friends introduce us to Catan and it serves to bridge the gap in our appreciation for board games. We realise that Monopoly, Cluedo and Game of Life are not really "good" games at all. We realise that player elimination is a bad thing. We learn that the mechanics of the new wave of board games are so much more of an experience than what we had as kids. Most of all, we learn that board games are now really fun!  The mechanics of the game are very simple, but can bring out great strategy. Luck can be a factor, as in any game with dice, but dice go both ways in games. Of course, good strategy and luck with dice can be overcame by players scheming and grouping up against one player - so it's always unlikely that one player will always win!  While I don't get to play Catan as often anymore, I'm still usually happy to join a game when it's suggested. And for a new gamer, it is still part of my armory to try and get them hooked.   Catan will now and forever occupy a favorable place in my memories of gaming!
The game that got me into board games.  One of if not the best player interaction euros still to this day for me.

Reglas sencillas, posibilidad de meter mucho azar para que los comienzos no sean siempre iguales...  Quizás el punto débil sea el azar que hay durante la partida, las tiradas de dados y las cartas "sorpresa" pero con todo resulta muy entretenido, además el azar en cierto modo es "controlable", cada jugador puede plantear su estragtegia para que le sea a priori más favorable.
Who doesn't like Catan?  Doesn't get much play anymore but I've had a lot of fun Catan games.

Like so many others, for me Catan was the "gateway game" that brought me into the wider world of table tops past risk and monopoly.    It rates a solid 7 for   1) having an accessible shallow learning curve that's easy to pick up in less than 10 minutes 2) for being balanced enough to have multiple different paths to victory 3)for often forcing cooperating and trading between the players.  4) and of course, for having a ton of map and number variation so you're never playing the same game twice.  As a downside, the game falls on the side of a little too random in my book.  There will be some play sessions where you swear your numbers will never come up.  The person who wins probably had a good strategy, but also wins with a fair amount of luck.  Yes this makes the game more accessible for some novice players, but it also makes it the kind of game that I'm more reluctant to walk into.    I've found that the "Oh I just got screwed by bad rolls" mindset is mitigated when you:  A) make the map bigger with expansion sets B) increase the number of victory points required to win  However, this can greatly extend the length of the game depending on how efficient your opponents end their turn
I realy like the player interaction with trading and convincing them to help me so it helps them
Ran across this game on vacation back in 2011. The rental house has this game and it was an immediate success with the family. I contribute this game to taking the first step in this hobby.

Esta es la primera vez que hago un comentario en BGG y he creído oportuno hacerlo del primer juego que me metió en el vicio (hay otros anteriores, hasta creo que podría ser el Munchkin, pero le ha tocado a este). Tengo que contar que mi primer partida fue contra un campeón de Catan sin que yo lo supiera, asi que estuvo en modo Harcore jeje Pero después le he echado cientos de partidas y nunca me cansare de el. A well designed game. The idea were you roll your dice then collect resources is different than most games I've played. Not to mentioned that the goal is just ten points... Which is just enough time for you to get your fair share of fun from the game, but at the same time not to over kill the amount of glory the game deserves.  This game is also quite simple, meaning this game could be refered to as a gateway game. A gateway game is a game that leads people who pretty much only knows how to play checkers to play more games. Like "Power Grid", ""Ticket to Ride", "The Resistance", and many more. However I would not give this a ten because... Well, the game really doesn't give you that much options to do things, in other words you can only do what the game itself gives you.  So if you are a person who likes to kinda sit back and watch the show, or game so to speak (I know I do sometimes) then this is probably the game for you. I know I like to actually legit participate in a game when I play it and this game doesn't really allow it. But I find my own ways to strategise in this which is one of the reasons I gave it such a high rating. This game also deserves a high rating because it is a very, VERY good family game. So if you want to spend more time with your family, this would be a good game for you.

Once a family favorite, it has been a while since we played. My sisters-in-law, and a good friend of ours tend to dominate. My wife won the very first time she played. Somehow, I spend most of the game with the robber on my most lucrative spots and the when the pirates land I am a knight short. Sound familiar?

This is simply a classic.  No other game changed board gaming more than Catan.  Without this game most of us would never have gotten into modern board gaming.  This is also the most deceptively cut throat euro out there.  For a game with "no conflict", I have seen more arguments and hurt feelings during this game than any other I've played.  And it's awesome.  I may not be able to attack you directly, but when I cut you off with my roads and then refuse to trade you that wheat you need after I played the "Monopoly" card and took all of yours...classic.  This game gets a lot of hate, but there is a reason so many people have played it.  The most common criticism is that initial placement is the most important aspect and then it's all luck and dice rolls.  I disagree.  This is a negotiation game.  All other game mechanics revolve around the trade mechanic.  Victory or defeat is all based on how well you can trade and convince other players to give you the resources you need to win.  If you play thinking that you can ignore this and win through mechanics alone, you are playing wrong.
The game that brought me out of the realm of Parker Brothers, Catan is the first real board game I played and is now the standard by which I judge other games.
En versión app. Juego de recursos tranquilo y muy entretenido. Me gusta jugar las campañas de la app, muy recomendable para jugar solo.

I grew up with this game. Settlers replaced Skat(!) in our local pub as the game you could play every evening – there were always players coming to the pub wanting to play Settlers and the pub soon purchased a game so nobody had to bring his own. I was still a little kid accompanying my parents, later it was the favourite boardgame to play with friends for many years.  Two aspects of the game that stand out for me: random drawing of the whole island and the trading aspect. The trading is the core of the game – you roll the dice to earn resources that you can trade. And you can trade everything: three corn make one beer, three sheep to drive me home tonight. Again, this is meant to be a social/pub game as the players do not play just for themselves against each other. As for the random aspect, this game is so customizable. You could use the 6 player expansion or just a second base game to build a bigger map and/or play up to 15 or even 20 points. You can also make one or two resources very scarce or even non-existent. Endless variations.  One bad thing about the game is that it can be boring or frustrating if there are players of different levels as the random aspect is not as big as in, say, Monopoly. Settlers is quite easy to learn (as for the rules of the game) but better players play much faster and know what things to do in certain situations. Peacefully developing your stuff turns into hecticly buying basically everything you can get. So this may be one aspect Settlers share with Skat – you might play it with players at the same level as you are slowly getting better at it. In my opinion, this game is mainly made for three players. So again – sort of a Skat replacing board game... Just be sure to get the old edition with wooden parts and cleaner artwork or even the anniversary wooden box. The newer edition with plastic parts is just ugly.

This game is very fun, but I cannot imagine someone liking this and hating monopoly.  The trading, the dice, the building "houses and hotels", the cards giving you extra resources and similar goodies......it's all very familiar, but it is more fun with the right crowd, if you're willing to teach newcomers.  But everyone knows monopoly and it's basically the same game.

Excellent intro to Euro-style board games, with an easily graspable theme. For new players, Catan is a great way to introduce the concept of a game with a few different paths to victory, but the end-game becomes a little stale, as players get locked into chasing their only path to victory.

One and only downside to this game, IMO - the variable play times.  You've gotta have 2 hours or more (depending on how familiar all players are with the game) free or be willing to cut the game short without finishing.
It's a classic and after a year long break I was surprised how much I still enjoy it. Some people hate the element of chance, but this is part of the fun for me - it adds suspense.

A great strategy builder game and a classic. The game has some good balance that makes sure nearly every player achieves something in the game. That said, more experienced players are more easily able to see many paths to victory and that can intimidate people from playing. Moderate setup time.

Gets far too much hate. Catan is a solid game, especially to introduce people to the board gaming world.
Very good game, not as strategic as I would like though. Purchase what you can, when you can seems to be the best strategy, and because of that, its seems linear.
Very fun, easy to teach, lots of replayablity.
A classic. One of the best starter games.

+ ~250-300 plays.  Like many others, this game brought me into the hobby.  I played this game almost exclusively for 3 years, and it is good, but can really suffer when the dice rolls go crazy, or there is a clear runaway leader.
What else can you say? It is one of the best selling board games.

A modern classic that remains a great introduction to the hobby. I have found that in a 4 player game there can sometimes be one player who is not able to progress and as such is just waiting for someone else to win.

A classic, gateway game, which is simple enough to be played by non or new gamers. However, high envolvement of dice in the resource production which can be desliked by experienced gamers. Not a game i prefer to bring in the table anymore, but i feel like i have to keep it in my collection,  it will alway be a classic.  Was a  solid 9.5-10, 20 years ago, nowadays it s more like a 7 to me. I m rating an 8, due to the impact it had in gaming history!

This was the gateway into "hobbyist" games for me and many others. While the element of random chance can prove frustrating at times, it does keep things interesting, and trading, the heart and soul of the game, is fast-paced and often hilarious.
Variable board is cool. Lots of variety. Limited number of players in both directions.

To be clear, my 8 stars is trying to be objective... if I'm being honest, I'd love to never play this game and you'd need to brow-beat me to get me to at this point... But that because I've played it SO many times because it is just SO good. It's a genre-breaker and a classic for a reason, it's a brilliantly designed game fit for causals or hardcore tacticians, total nerds or family game night with grandparents and nieces; it's simple, quick, and bland enough to not intimidate anyone, while complex enough to please real gamers. It's only redundancy and the fact recent games have filled the niche better that have this collecting dust on the shelf at this point... it definitely covered it's price tag in the day. My one big piece of advice? Avoid the exapnsions. Like the plague. It's like how various "Battle chess" rules alterations to the namesake can't every live up to the original... the game is already in a good place tactically... Adding elements is supurfluous, and it makes it so you aren't getting better at Catan, you're getting better at screwy fake Catan. Being a grand-master chess player is impressive, nobody cares how you'd rank nationally in like Fantasy Chess or whatever... just get good at the game itself (or better yet, branch out to its successors... I suggest Machi Koro if you want something else outsider approachable, or Valeria Card Kingdoms if you want something deeper and nerdier.
Very good classic game. For me is a little easy but i really enjoy it.
The first game that introduced me to post-80s boardgaming way back in the day. I still own my ugly-as-balls original version and I will never, ever, get rid of it.
First board game, and would still enjoy playing. Solid game, but can bring out the worst in people.
Always worth a play. Loses some points due to the long setup time. Works better with the Seafarers expansion.
Have yet to play with *any* expansions.

I still love playing Catan! I know the game catches a lot of heat on here, and I can acknowledge that the game has its shortcomings, but my friends and I still have a great time whenever this makes it to the table.
My sisters made this game out of wood, very fun!
Personally I hate the bloody thing, but it's a must have for any board game enthusiast.  Known by me and mine as 'The saltiest game on Earth.'

We owe this game a lot for the number of people that it has brought to board gaming and has grown the industry by leaps and bounds.  All that aside, the game is still a really good time for me to break out with less experience gamers and it is always fun.

I am generally not a fan of eurogames, but Settler of Catan is a great game, and its rising popularity means most people have at least heard of it, even if they haven't played it. It's a good introduction to board games that don't suck, and is likely responsible for making some North Americans aware that adult board games don't have to last three hours.
great family game. This is also a good intermediate game. If you have some friends over that are not ready for Talisman or Axis and Allies start them on Catan.
Game has great replay value as the board is always changing.  There are variants out there to play if you look online to add another dimension.  Strategy changes with number of players.

A great game which involves a lot of interaction amongst the players. Trading makes up a big part in it which makes it so interesting as you sometimes have to sacrifice resources in order to trade them for another resource in smaller amounts which will eventually lead to a successful accomplishment of some sort. The only bummer is the luck factor which does consume a big part of the game. Hopefully an expansion can fix this. It is a really fun family game and I'd recommend it to anyone.
A classic - and this one has aged surprisingly well. I still enjoy it today.
a friend owns it, it's "easy" but very very nice!
The game that started it all! I still think it's a pretty good game, apart form the length. If you could get it played in an hour and a half or two hours it would be brilliant.
This simply deserves its classic status and will always go back to it and for people who aren't normally into board games is great ???????? intro

I keep it because it was my first euro game played, my gateway. Dislike: dice roll, trade phase, price of expansions (the same as base game!)  Instead of buying an expansion I'd buy different game and try something new. Like wooden elements from old version. New (plastic) version has good cards tray. Still I recommend it as it's a good piece of game!
Played this hundreds of times 18 years ago...can still play it and enjoy it. Timeless!!!
Weirdly, I think I liked it more when we just played the base game. With the expansions, the game goes on longer but very few times does the person in the lead fail to eventually win the game.
the classic trading-based, dice-dependent very entertaining good for mixed groups
The gateway game for me and many of my family and friends. Great concept, theme, and strategy. Player involvement on (almost) every turn is one of the best aspects of the game.

This is the original board game I played that drew me away from games like "Skip-bo", and "Monopoly".  I always loved board games, but these games drive my obsession.  The level of strategy offered is so much greater than games I grew up with, and this was the catalyst.  However, it's mechanics are a little weak compared to some of the others.  Mainly, you can still lose to the dice, rather than lose to the opponent.  And while I don't dare rate this game any lower than an 8, it really has fallen out to just a good game that I like to play.
C'est juste bon. Tout le temps.
Love this game.  There are some two player variant rules posted on BGG that seem to work quite well

ok true stories...the original creator came into a store I was at showing the game...he handed me the rules written in german, which I could read easily as in I took many german classes.  Anywise it was an easy game to play eventually I had multiple versions of the game...which was funny....as I proceed to start leaving copies at conventions all over...even gave some to friends who traveled to other conventions on the east coast with instructions to leave a copy in the game rooms....I really like this game.
Clásico entre los clásicos. El más jugado en mi grupo. Con este entré al mundo de los juegos de mesa.
Awesome game to get someone into TableTop games. The game itself is easy to understand.Problem is with all expansions that you get but as a core game it is awesome
The game does suffer from a similar problem as Dominion in that the starting board heavily determines who wins, but there is enough interaction after that to satisfy me.
An easy to learn and teach, classic game. Always a go to game when I just want to chill
A game that got me into boardgames along with Magic.  I've played countless times of it over the years.  It shows its age now and is not as fun as it has been.

Catan is a very good family game, but after several games it lacks of depth for me. I also bought expansion : Traders and barbarians and we almost never play without it now. But still if you get a bad position at a start , you sometimes already know who's gonna win at the end. But if you are new to board games or looking for a family game , i recommend Catan.
A classic board game. This is a must own.

Probably the best game to get people who are beginners in the world of tabletop games and those who enjoy more weighty games.  A great balance between strategy and luck so those not advanced can still get the upper hand and have a fighting chance.

Catan is the gateway game that it's touted to be because it cohesively has a little of everything: dice rolling as the bridge from the classic family games of old, Euro-style resources, route building, hand management, a modular board consisting of hex tiles, and even a social aspect via trading. And light enough to teach in just a few minutes and play in about an hour.

This game was my starting line for getting away from mainstream market games like Chess, Sorry, or Sequence.  IMO, this game sets the bar for table-top gaming, and every gamer must play at least once. If you play another game but it wasn't as fun as Catan, don't buy it. If you play another game and it was more fun than Catan, buy it.
I'm straight up savage at this game. Don't try me.
I've joined the club.  Love this game. Didn't think it would be as enjoyable and cut throat as it was!

Great game that got me loving board games. Amazing replayability. My biggest resistance against it nowadays is the snowball effect. Often one person ends up losing and they only get worse, while one person who is leading gets further and further ahead.

Total classic and still makes it to the table often. Great game for beginners who don't mind a lot of "luck" factor in a game. Not something I play when heavier gamers are available, but wife and some friends still love it and I always enjoy it.
Oldie goldie, we don't like the dice dependency, but we really enjoy the game
Such a good game to use to show Euro to new players

nice strategy game to play with some friends. could give some discussion between your friends. and if you have on of this kind of friends that does his strategy in the last moment it will take forever to play.
Cant go wrong with Catan. I take it out whenever someone asks, or I want to introduce new people to board games.
all time favorite game. good game for starters. After a while it is nice to play with expansions.
I stopped playing with my 12 year old! After two games he became an unbeatable tactical genius!

Everyone knows catan. I really enjoy the game, as do many of my friends. I have however seen that a few people get a little overwhelmed and don quite get the concept. Its not a game for everyone, but it rarely doesn't go down well.
Will only play co-op with the Dragon Phoenix Games variant.

This is probably one of my top 5 favorite games. Lots of strategy, and a really awesome set up. Super easy to play, and really gripping. Could play this game over and over again. Love building empires playing Catan!
A very simple boardgame, excellent as a first step into the boardgaming world (in my subjective opinion).
My gaming group loves it. Too reliant on dice favor but still fun.

I still enjoy playing Settlers, even after all these years. The trading in this game is really good. Sure, sometimes the randomness hurts you, but that's just an opportunity to trade more aggressively.
An ultimate classic, always enjoy it, just it is so classic that anything new and novel often beats it to the table.
Fun game, but if you place your pieces on unlucky spots at the beginning you probably want to end the game a.s.a.p and play again

Fun game, simple to learn, and possibly the perfect game for players of all ages and skill levels. Very easy to sink hours into the game, and it is usually fun throughout. The only negative things that I have to say about the game is that it seems to rely a bit more on luck than skill at times, and that the game can be arguably too simple.
It's fun. Great gateway game that doesn't get old, as long as you don't overplay it!
Good introductory game with enough built-in variables to keep it interesting! My wife and I fit one or two games in each week, and it's a great game for guests that are not hardcore boardgamers.
This game introduced me to modern board games and I still enjoy playing it.
A great way to lose some dead weight friends.
The Classic, Great game to get people to think outside the Monopoly Box
The most popular gateway game and for a good reason. It's the perfect mix of luck, strategy, and sheep.
It's simple. It's elegant. Most importantly it's fun. The classic Catan always makes for a good time.

This is the go-to game for our gaming group.  It is highly dependent on original placement and the luck of the dice, but even when you lose there is something to enjoy about it, probably down to the company you are playing with.  Doesn't get played at home, partly because we are normally only 2-players.

This has become my gateway drug into heavier board gaming for most people. I love the strategy, the manipulation, and the chance present in this game. They beautifully meld into a balanced game that almost anyone can enjoy. It's a perfect game for people looking to move beyond Clue and Monopoly.
The game that started it all for me
This game got my family closer together
Still a favorite of mine despite some luck factor and mechanics improvements in newer games.

Catan (or, the Settlers of Catan) was the game that really got me into the hobby, like many other people. While there are other mechanics I like more, and other games that are higher on my play list, the mix of strategy and necessary player interaction is a good mix. I like that the game is pretty easy for a non-gamer to get into, and some of the expansions are really good (Cities and Knights is my favorite). Catan is still a solid game, and I'm always happy to play it.

I enjoy this game a lot. It is an easy game to learn and even though it is intimidating to non gamers they often pick up on it quickly and enjoy it. Something about it has a nostalgic feel that reminds me of elementary school.
It looks like a perfect game for new people getting involved into the world of boardgaming, but for me being involved for many years I have learnt what games I like more.
Catan was one of the first board games that got me into the hobby of board gaming. Simple, fun, and easy to learn, Catan is a great way to introduce your friends and family.
Enjoy this game. It got me in to hobby gaming. Thanks catan!
Great game that introduced me to the world of tabletop games.  Fun to play with the family.
A rather simple empire building game, if one could really call it that. Yet, for newcomers its generally a great game and the options the game presents still hold up till this day.
One of the best known board games. Building your villages and roads on a random map, while collecting resources for further expansion. It is simply, yet fun and it has a relatively high replay value.
Always a fun time and good for introducing newer people or playing with people who don't get to play board games often.
Always fun to play. The game that started “game nights” for me.

Great family game. Plenty of room for a variety of strategies. My copy has a board which is made from heavy card, which does not lay flat, especially the six surrounding pieces. Some of the colours are not easy to distinguish, especially the red/orange pieces and the desert tile looks very similar to the grain tiles, although this is not an issue normally as this tile does not have a number on it.
Classic and very nice game with interaction between the players.
superb family game! We played this one until cards turned to dust xD  Over 400 games recorded :D
We probably play Catan more than any other game.  Great game to chill with friends and have an easygoing, fun game night. Cities and Knights is our favorite expansion.

This game rekindled my enthusiasm for board games. It might me my ignorance, but in has a revolutionary feel to it because it opened up a whole range of possibilities in board gaming. Definately a must have. Besides that I've played games 10+ years ago that I can still remember, lots of fun and good memories, and still engaging after all these years.
4th edition :-/ I seem to remember thicker and sturdier tiles in previous editions.
Wonderful game, fun to teach and fun to challenge Catan pros.
Good fun. Easy to learn. Great mid-way game.
Good game for starting gamers. Still enjoy playing from time to time.
Much better with Knights & cities expansion!

Love this game, but especially the more complex variations with Seafarers and Cities and Knights.  This is definitely a game best with four players, or with even more with the expansion.  There is a great deal of luck in this game, a little more than I would like; the dice rolls, the selection of the progress cards, etc. But still very enjoyable.
An awesome game. Simple but really fun!
This game is easy to learn and can be played in about two hours. Since I usually play with friends at night that's enough time to get some fun in before I get too tired.
Finally got this classic game with the 5-6 player expansion so we could play with our game group of 6. The only reason we did not have it is because it take 3 to play
Nice game for families, play it for a long time.

The Timeless Classic.  It's truely great in almost every way.  my only gripes:  replay value is good but not great, i would say most can enjoy it for life and never get bored but a tru Gamer will burn out after a 100 games  strategy is good but not great, the trading system is a bit rudimentary and the placement can be a bit obvious if you're familiar enough with the game

Not much can be said about this game that hasn't already been said. It is a great game starting game to get people into boardgames. It's a staple to have in a collection since it was one of the firsts to change how boardgames were. It is a game that I will always love to play even though that stupid robber always seems to get rolled. I love the way the game plays and the interactions between the players. It is a definite must buy for someone starting their collection out if you are like me and got started with monopoly.

Ah...Catan. Such a polarizing beast. At this point, I most enjoy playing it with my wife where we both control two players and we don't play with the robber. As our collection has grown, Catan has fallen to the wayside in favor of other games. Nevertheless, I can certainly see us playing it from time time in the future.

I enjoy it. It got me into more advanced games. I also played it a lot. Randomness is a small factor but the key is in trading and manipulating the game to your advantage. It's a game I just happen to get. Not perfect by any measure but I don't think it's bad either.

Wiem, że jest pojazd po tej grze, prawie jak po Talismanie i Monopoly, ale uważam że to naprawdę świetna gra familijna. Jest to moja pierwsza planszówka, do której mam spory sentyment i zawsze chętnie do niej wracam (ale w tym momencie już tylko z jakimś, choćby mini-dodatkiem). Za każdym razem mamy inne ułożenie planszy, a losowość wyrzuconych oczek na kościach (czasem zupełnie wbrew wszelkim zasadom prawdopodobieństwa) sprawia, że gra wygląda za każdym razem inaczej. Największe emocje są oczywiście przy grze w 4 osoby - dużo możliwości blokowania i rozbudowany handel. Ta gra opiera się na zawieraniu chwilowych sojuszy, za chwilę ich zrywaniu, dużo tu jest negatywnej interakcji, ale w takim pozytywnym tego słowa znaczeniu.

Catan was my first modern board game, and to this day, it's still one that I will still take out to play. While it's true that poor starting locations can lose you the game from the very beginning, Catan's negotiation system allows for an interesting experience granted that the rest of the group is willing the play along.
Great entry into Euro-style gaming.  Good replay and reasonable short time to finish each game.

I'm still in love with this classic and like to go back to it regularly.  I particularly like it when there's a squeeze on one particular resource and everyone is like "aaargh, no one has any brick! Arrrrgh" and then you just kind of have to grind through. I actually really like that.
Genial, una maravilla.  Te tiene que gustar negociar y llevar con alegría los reveses de la fortuna.
An all time classic, that reshaped the boardgame market.
I enjoy playing it with my friends from time to time. Its simpleness makes it a must-have it. Best played 4v4.
Codenames Forbidden Island / Desert Cosmic Encounter Mysterium Risk

Ahh... One of my favorite games to play, Catan. Catan doesn't take long to play so if your looking for a game that doesn't take much time out of your day but still has enough excitement this is your game. Takes the right amount of luck and strategy so it has a great balance.

Pros:   + Good and simple game to play + Good for board game beginners + Decent mechanics ( Ex. Robbers to keep hoarders/monopoly of a single resource in check) + Good for competitive people + Quality components and have some waterproof ability (spilled beer on it and cardboard only got a little wet on sides) + Decent Strategy as there are many ways to win + Fun to play with many people + Playing time is moderate, not too long and not too short.  Cons: - Luck of the dice roll - Only max four players.  need to get expansions for 5-6 players - Might get hurt in competitive game (slap on wrist when opponents know you are monopolizing a resource) :/ - Maybe too much downtime:  Ex. Wish there is a timer on your actions when a player has 32 card resources on their hand and trying to figure out how to use them best - Could cost a bit w/ 5-6 (maybe around 40-50 bucks).  Better strategy games out there for that kind of cost. - Wouldn't be great to play multiple times in the same day. - Many expansions.  Could cost a lot more for certain people.
This game is really good and takes only 20-25 minutes to figure out the rules. Would recommend for players 10 and older!
Is the reason I'm obsessed with board games
One of the gateway games back into gaming for me and I still love it. Easy to see why it is one of the most popular modern games out there
Goed instapspel voor de nieuwe generatie bordspellen

Excellent game easy for casual gamers. The balance of skill v luck is enjoyable and keeps more experienced players on their toes.  My only dislike, is the game is that it ends so suddenly and there is little opposing players can do to prevent someone from winning.
After a few plays I see why it's considered a classic
Catan is a lot of fun, but can be frustrating when your opponents thwart your plans because you get bad rolls.
This game is unquestionably perfect for what it is. Deservedly THE classic game. If every copy of monopoly was replaced by Catan the world would be a better place.
A classic. Make sure you are 4 players though!

[url=http://amzn.com/B00449APZS]Snapware Snap 'N Stack 6" x 9"[/url] (Holds Catan 5–6, C&K 5–6, and two sets of [url=https://the-official-settlers-of-catan-gaming-board.backerkit.com/hosted_preorders/project_updates]card holders[/url])

Purchased the Spanish version. The European manufacture is better than the American IMO. Even though the game's theme isn't everyone's cup of tea, it's still a great game with enough luck and strategy that it doesn't become boring or dull. The randomization of tiles is a pretty cool system. The only problem is when you pick up a place with less frequent numbers for your first settlements, since these will be the foundations of your entire game. It's crucial to understand dice statistics before playing, otherwise it can be very frustrating for some players. A very good and fun game, overall.
Tons of fun, and the customization is really helpful. My Parents bought it for the rest of the family after I taught them how to play

One of the OG gateway games. I understand why people are tired of Catan, but I rather admire it for what it is: an incredibly fun game that brings a plethora of people into the hobby. I recommend this game for everyone, even those who do not think they like board games. Truly a classic.
Wonderful game. Only draw back is the entire game is based off dice rolls.  Very little strategy involved.
Great game for casual gamers and family.
Very fun game, great for families.
The game that brought me deeper into the world of gaming, thank you Catan. I still enjoy playing you despite that pesky robber!
3-4 players with a difficulty of 2.35. Fun game, but definitely need the 3-4 players to make trading work well.
The game that brought me to board gaming. Will always love it for that reason.
Hours of competitive fun, burnt out on it after 100's of matches.
played once with a friend, it's a very fun game

Great game to play with the whole family.  Can be played with 3 players, but feel it is better with 4 players.  Many ways to win game so different players do different strategies.  Good mix of strategy and luck of the dice.  This is one of our go to games.  Usually takes about 60-90 minutes to play.
One classic game which still really cool to be played nowadays.
Haven’t played this one in a long time. However, it was a great introduction into the world of board gaming.
Played this one during our family game night and really liked it!  Will definitely make it to the table again soon.
NM.  5-6 player expansion incorporated into base.
A classic game that I don't play as much as I would like too.
A classic. Needs expansions and some house rules to shine, but after that, this game is always exiting. Even after 12+ years.
Very enjoyable game, however after some rounds its very easy and boring without the Cities and Knights expansion.
We really enjoy this game.  Skill and luck are both useful, and a little trading with other players, too.  The board itself isn't well made, struggles to stay together.
A classic for a reason.   Yes, most of the strategy takes place at the beginning of the game, but I still find this game worthwhile.
"The Settlers of Catan."  All wooden pieces, wooden dice, and excellent artwork on the tiles and cards.  I have wood for sheep!  Er...  Um.  Yeah...

Not much more I can add that likely has not already been said.  Great, elegant, simple game with a lot of replayability.  Perfect for newcomers to board games beyond the ones they played as children.  An introductory board game into the world beyond your childhood.
A good game for an introduction to the bigger world of board games. Move over Monopoly...
My second game. Wow, love it. I also have 5-6 player expansion and the Seafarers expansion.

Tremendous family strategy game (non-combat), with a different layout each game.  We have settled on Cities and Knights expansion, usually with seafarers islands, ships, etc.  I must say i'm tired of teaching beginners the basics - these games can drag on.  Why doesn't everyone know Catan?  Get out there and play, newbies!

It's nice, I can even play it with my 7 year old cousins and we all have a very good time. Overall it is the definition of a modern classic, it gets an 8 just because I find some other games provide me a much more active and challenging experience, but I absolutely respect the design for what it is and how adaptable it can be for any age range.
Conquer the clay mine and all your friends thief you every time.

Comments based on: 2 recent plays and dozens of plays pre-BGG logging; owned.  Things I like: • Trading mechanic keeps everyone engaged • Mix of chance (dice rolling) and strategy (decisions about how to allocate resources and what and where to build) • Long enough for players to implement a strategic plan but short enough that you have energy and time to play again • Lots of expansions are available, including a 5-6 player expansion • Easy to learn and explain (a great gateway game)  Things I dislike: • The modular board is relatively small, so a player's options can sometimes become very restricted early in the game • The core game doesn't support 5-6 players • Overplayed (who hasn't played Catan?)
Second German board game I've bought after Carcassonne. I can confirm that this kind of games are AMAZING: a few simple rules, many ways of winning, and close-to-infinite re-play.

This was my first game, which my parents bought for me, when i was a little kid. In the past it was a very good game and it is also today (for me) because the play system is quite easy to get ressources for points. It is a good family game.
Love playing with the family. Needs everyone's concentration and attention to be fun.
Great classic game! One of the first in the new style strategy games and still going strong with good reason. In my opinion this was probably the start of the resurge in strategy gaming

This is a great game when you are needing to start someone on modern board games. I love playing it, but I will say that I don't appreciate the randomness of the dice rolling in order to gain resources.
My first boardgame. Still enjoy it. Great family game i would suggest to anybody, eventhough i enjoy it more with expansions like cities and knights. Too simple now after many games played.
Let me play without the expansions and I am a happy gamer.
Very fun, easy to learn for non-gamers and has lots of different mechanics. Pretty much the perfect entry game.

Classic game. Been playing it for years, and it was the game the really introduced me to board gaming and strategy games. Would highly recommend it, especially with newer gamers. Easy to teach, but hard to get really good at. Highly recommended.

This game was my introduction to modern board gaming. I introduced this game to many non-gamers. I enjoy introducing people to basic probability when placing settlements. Trading is also very fun. After a while I only played Cities and Knights.  Cities certainly has more "take that" but also more strategy. The weakness often cited in this game is that the early rolls can largely determine the winner.

As was mentioned in someone else’s review this is a total gateway drug for board gaming. It’s what got me back into the hobby and is a great family game. Base game is a bit boring after a while especially after playing with several of the expansions but is great for introducing newcomers only familiar with games such as Monopoly and the like.
Fun game, it was my introduction to eurogames and newer board games in general.

Para mí, Catan es a los juegos de mesa, lo que los Beatles a la música popular. Claramente marcó un antes y un después desde su edicion. Me encanta y en mí entorno de amigos funciona perfecto. Siempre nos llaman para jugarlo. La edición "nueva" ilustrada por Michael Menzel ha logrado que los hexagonos tengan un nivel de detalle asombroso, haciéndolo visualmente hermoso.  Sinceramente no entiendo a aquellos enemigos fervientes que tiene el juego. Qué está superada la mecánica con propuestas más novedosas? Ok. Qué tiene mucho azar? Ok. Cuál es el inconveniente? Muchos de los que estamos en este mundillo, no estaríamos acá de no ser por Catán. No seamos ingratos con este clásico enorme.

Excelente juego para compartir con cualquier persona, muy buena transición para los aún no iniciados en los juegos de mesa modernos. El único inconveniente, es que luego de enseñarles a los demás, siempre quieren jugarlo... lo complicado es hacerles entender que hay más juegos y variados estilos... cooperativos, party, fillers, etc.

This is a great game for anyone who is just getting into board games.  While I enjoyed the original, I got bored of it after I played it a few times because once you establish a winning trajectory it is really hard for anyone to overtake you.  That being said, if you have never played Catan before I would recommend actually picking up Star Trek: Catan.  The Star Trek version has an extra game mechanic which mixes things up a bit and ups the replayability.  Still a classic though.
I like Catan a lot but unfortunately my family doesn't like it as much as I do so it doesn't get the playtime I would like

The first boardgame I ever bought!! It's not the best game, but it surely is a good one. Sure, something like Stone Age can replace it and be better, but Settlers is still an almost perfect gateway game. Nearly everyone should have a copy, and you can feel confident bringing it to the family holiday to teach and enjoy with both gamers non-gamers alike. Although nowadays I'd say Pandemic or Carcassonne take its place as the standard first-choices to share with non-gamers, you still can't go wrong with a family game of Catan. This will always be a classic. Most gamers might be tired of it, but that doesn't make it any less of a giant.

I have a warm spot in my heart for Catan because I've played too many times to count and it really got me into board gaming.  That said, it definitely has some frustrating elements.  Luck plays too big of a role, it's too easy for players to gang up against the leader and it snowballs pretty hard.  Still a classic with a solid amount of strategy required but one whose flaws have become more obvious over time.
I know what the haters say, but this is a fun game.
This game introduced me to the board game world. This is the first game I could play round after round and still enjoy after playing 3 times in a row.

The original Catan was a game-changer and I will always love playing it. The only reason I am not giving it a solid 10 is because the Cities & Knights expansion is such an improvement that it would be unfair to share the same rating :)
What got me into boardgames. I could go for quick game right now actually!
Classic. If you like the deal-making of Monopoly but literally nothing else about Monopoly, this is the game for you.

Easy to teach and very fun to play. My only gripe would be that luck has a little too much influence on the gameplay. Negotiations can offset the luck factor; but if there is too little of the resource you are needing in play, there is no getting around this. As long as you come to the table with that in mind and are able to keep a light-hearted approach, you will have a great time.
Classic. I like it very much and always have had good time, the only thing is that if you play it lately in the day it can become a little tedious.
Good replaying value to a limit. Optimal moves in common situations become predictable over time. Using the expansions for added complexity improve the replaying value.
Fast, funny, popular. A good way of entrance to the world of boardgames.
(Even though it shouldn't matter) The game is in Romanian, not English.

This was the gateway game for my family to trend towards more Euro/strategy games. very fun to play, not difficult to learn, multiple strategies to win and good replay value. Cons: a LOT of bickering if your family is like that. Similar to monopoly in that the competition is direct. Almost like a battle game. For some that is good. My family loves to argue with each other so it's not so bad. It can also get stale after enough plays, but by that time you have gotten your money's worth.
Great game, decent balance between strategy and luck. Good design to promote trading and communication between players as well.

When I started playing Catan it would have been a ten. But I've played sooooo many times. Feels like thousands of times. But in reality at least 80 times. So I've cooled on it. Still an amazing game, and I still call it Settlers of Catan. Anyone new to the hobby. Please try this game.
Build roads, get resources, but most of all get vexed when your friends block your path and stop you from building. Such a good time!

The classic. Hard not to look at with rose coloured glasses, but it still hits the table. Make sure to highlight to new players to the importance of starting positions and development cards.  For all its fun, it is a game where you can still get virtually knocked out. In our group that person often becomes king maker, shifting the balance of power significantly. It's not a real Catan game if at least one person isn't upset. = )
Played this game a ton. Great game with a dynamic changing board on every game, I find it pretty easy to win with my strategy.

Really enjoy the strategy and trading in Catan. Don't get too distracted building settlements and cities - the development cards are always a good strategy! Prefer to play with 3 players because 4 players can make the board crowded.
I know it's not all that fashionable nowadays but Catan remains a good entry level game.

This was my introduction to boardgames beyond the department store monopoly, clue, uno, risk, etc... that got me hooked on German style boardgames. This is my go to game for getting people hooked on boardgame nights.

I enjoy the player interaction aspect of this game.  The randomness associated with the dice rolls can be a little too much for me sometimes.  I like that there is more than one path to winning the game.  I find it to be a great introduction to getting folks interested in board games!
Easy game. Some of the expansions are interesting.

If you were to poll and number of "gamers" you'd probably find that most (if not all) were introduced via "Catan".  I have a soft spot for this game, warts and all.  152 Ultra-Pro sleeve size: Catan - Pink (82915, 50/pack) - (54 x 80mm)
One of my first games played, easy to start and to bringing new people to this beautiful game world!

an evergreen. gave to me and my flatmates a lot of fun evenings. Of course, morr you get to board games less you gonna want to play catan, but it is a perfect game to put on a table when you want to introduce your friends to gaming and you will still have great time !
Solitaire rating --- 0 Family rating ----- 95 Fantasy level ----- 0 Sci Fi level -------- 0  The classic. Not much to say that wasn't said before. It's good, is family friendly, is fun.
This was the first game I knew of that had expansions. I was familiar with content additions only from a few videogames and this concept blew my mind.

It's a classic for a reason... extremely balanced euro game with many different strategies for victory. Has quite a bit of luck, but you can definitely set yourself up for success by controlling space on the board. Best played with 3 players.
The classic game that started it all. Easy to learn, fun to play. It's Catan, plain and simple.
The game that got me into European styled games.
Love it so much I own a fully 3D printed set - even the resources!
Though it's not the best board-game I've ever played, it's definitely my favourite and is one I keep returning to again and again.
Very good game. I can see why it's a classic. However, I felt that some optionswere less viable than others and it still has the luck dependency. Once in a while it's a good game.
Nice and enjoyable game. Especially with some expantions. The only problem with it is the dice.
The trading and route building mechanics are simple concepts to grasp in Catan. This makes the game accessible to families. Catan is a superb game for this reason.
Classic, always a suitable game to play. 2-4 players.
Base game gets a bit boring but with expansions it's a favourite
Fun game to play as long as players are not asses and embargo you for the duration of the whole damn game. Only small temporary embargos are good.
Der Ur-Klassiker, der für mich nach wie vor ein paar tolle Mechanismen mit spannenden Entscheidungen und dem richtigen Maß an Interaktion verbindet. Zeitlos!
My favorite strategy game for 4 players
A good gateway game. Get's kind of repetitive and familiar after a few sessions. Good way to find new players.
Super fun the first many games but overtime, the strategies feel limited

Not much can be said about the game that hasn't been said already a thousand times - it's a classic! Very easy to get into and enjoy, and not hard to come up with strategies as well. I immensely enjoyed playing it in the first few months, when I hooked a lot of my friends and we played long hours, even while on holiday. The one single thing that ruins the game for me and the reason I stopped preferring it is the weight of the luck factor which is inevitable for a dice game, but in Catan you can really feel the dice's effect.
This was the gateway drug for me.  I'll always have fond memories of Catan.  I still enjoy playing it.
Build your empire. Cut off your opponents. Become the master of Catan
Mother's Day gift from the girls
Great game with lots of ways to win and a lot of replayability, this was one of the first games I picked up and it was fairly simple to get into and keeps me entertained over and over

Like most Americans, this is the game that introduced me to the world of Eurogames and strategy board gaming. I love it! We used to play this weekly for years, but then we found new strategy board games and started branching out. we still come back to Catan occasionally and really need to learn all the expansions!
An absolute classic. Nice material (the newer editions too), easy to understand rules, good mechanics and a lot of fun trading ressources with the others.
Of of the first games that took me from playing board games to being a tabletop gamer.
A classic. It's great. Maybe a bit too much king making. And a bit too much time wasted on trading, if people aren't paying attention.

Un jugazo incluso le he hecho unas mejoras añadiendo opciones con dinero y utilizando la ayuda de otros jugadores creo haber conseguido hacer que sea para dos jugadores y hasta 6 donde se pueda vender, comprar o hipotecar o mejor dicho financiar pues requieres tener algo de patrimonio para luego un pago por cuotas , todo esto del dinero no afecta en nada a las normas ya establecidas y añade otras para mantener las anteriores, lo he resumido todo en una hoja a dos caras pronto lo subiré aquí para que todos puedan disfrutar de esta variante
Nice game for ideally 4 players. Takes 1.5 hrs or less. May consider expansion after few more plays.

I first got into board games from some friends who introduced me to Settlers of Catan Cities and Knights, so the base game is fun, but I'd rather add the C&K expansion, hence the 8/10. Def a great game, still fun to play without the expansions, I just prefer the added depth of Cities and Knights
经典的「双卡一城」推新游戏之一。 虽然已经发售几十年了，目前看起来仍然是最佳推新桌游之一。 在卡坦岛中，所有的产出直观地摆在岛上，骰子对于产出的影响让每一次掷骰时都充满了希望与失望，运气与运营对于最终胜利的影响比重很微妙，让新人可以产生很大的参与感。 缺点么，策略深度比较浅，老手之间的对局胜负全在最后几轮的骰运，以及藏了几张胜利点数卡。
The only game my family will play with me!
A big name, but found frustrating when one player gets the monopoly of resource rolls.
Oldy but a goody.  A little long for some of our family members but we enjoy it on occasion.

Good game.  A bit burned out on it since it shows up so often but I admit its an exceptionally well balanced game.  If only some of those roads looked more like roads and those other bits were something other than wood.  Oh...but then it wouldn't be a Euro.  Hmm, would it be considered a 'Rebellion' since it is an Ameritrash departure from a stoic Euro?

Was introduced to Catan before I really got more into the hobby. I remember feeling a bit overwhelmed when the rules were first explained to me, but after a few turns got the hang of the game and enjoyed it! I like the free trade aspect to it as well as the modular board.

acheté sur kijiji à Rachel 22/01/19 + The Cities and Knights of Catan expansion + 2 extra programmes en français + extra cartes développement en français + Another english base game to play with Cities and Knights (recu de canucklehead du Canadian Math Trade - Summer 2015 Edition 16/08/15)
A friend of mine has a version with different expansions in it. Dont know how many. I like that game very much because at every turn everyone can get some so is a strategic with very few dead times
This is the game that got me back into board games. I'd love to find a good two-person variant as it's hard to find others to play it with.
Excellent game though you do need 3 players, it really doesn't work with two as the starting player always wins. Play this regularly and rarely gets old, also fairly easy to explain to new players.
Instant classic. Pleasing at the same time strategic player and more "casual gamer" with the huge part of dice luck.
Classic 'resource collecting' game —wood, grain, brick, sheep, or stone, in this case.  Mechanics are smooth and enjoyable - that's why it's a big selling classic!
This game replaces Monopoly for me
A classic for a good reason and one of the first more serious games I've ever played outside of the usual kids games. Worth owning and worth playing at least once in your life.

And love and hate this game, but mostly loving it. Maybe it's just because I don't have great administration skills and sometimes (just a few) my game sucks big time. Nevertheless, is highly recommended
Lots of potential, accessible game. Not enough plays to comment further.

It is the Harry Potter of the board game community.  Everyone should give credit to this game for revitalizing the board game community.   The game mechanics are interesting and simple, but my only complaint is that the placing of your beginning pieces can make or break your game which sucks.
Love this game. Great for three or four players. We took around 2 hours each game.
One of the games for start a journey with board game ... simple and not challenging, but gives a lot of fun for not very experienced and demanding players.
Love catan, will play it for a long time.
Classic for a reason. Easy to teach, fun to play.
My first game, will always enjoy and recommend to beginners.
Great game, but luck is a big part of the game.
Always enjoy a game of Catan but with so many other great board games we don't seem to have the opportunity as often as I would like to play this.
One of my all time favorites, wonderful in its simplicity.

Great overall game, good for group interaction.  Concept and strategy are very good with multiple and dynamic paths to victory.  Games are usually balanced but lopsided ones happen occasionally.  Dice rolling means a small luck factor, but it's strategic enough that a few bad rolls won't break you.  Highly replayable.  Trading aspect is interesting also and means very little downtime during other players' turns.  The fact that gamers and non-gamers alike enjoy it is a big plus also ("no, not another movie... how about a game of Settlers?").  The cost of expansions and the possibility of a player being blocked off early in the game keep this from a higher rating.  BGG users have suggested several good variations for this one.

B+   Very Good Game (like to play and never will turn it down).  One of the Best "Gateway Games" to get non-gamers to play games. Pretty much everyone who plays it loves it.  The simple elegance of these rules is superior to the more complicated mechanics of "Cities and Knights" and "Seafarers". The only improved versions are the "Trojan War" and "Wall of China" variants.
First game that got me into the euro games. I moderate an online site of it. Highly recommended.
Not as fun as it used to be. There sems like there's not enough different stuff to build (I think I'm probably spoiled from the card game). Maybe I'll like C&K better now...?

Found it to be fairly light game that goes over well with any crowd.  The communication aspect is the biggest draw for me as the table is never quiet.  People are forced to be involved in conversation just to play the game.
Own 2 copies: one for 3-4 players, one with the 5-6 expansion mixed in.

So, this really is a great game I must admit.  I've very seldom played it, and I don't know that I regret that.  "Take That" cards still annoy me to this day, but they're pretty downplayed in settlers.  I definitely should give this game a few more spins.  Apr 08: The elegance is finally getting to me.  My thoughts wander to the simple economy and the beauty of it all.  I will definitely be playing this more in the future.

Sold: a girlfriend introduced me to this game I introduced this game to family,  hopefulyl play at family gatherings again, was liked a little diffrent to explain the stragies you can have for a newbie but easy once grasped, bit slow if you dont trade.
Great game, totally diferent for what I was custom to... my first designer game
Not bad. It totally sucks when you're way behind and just have to wait until the games over.
El monopoly de los Board Games, imprescible para introducir a gente nueva en el mundillo, Mejor a 3 jugadores
Great game for non gamers, they love the dice

Permanece um clássico e ainda o melhor gateway que já joguei. Minha cópia com a expansão para 6 jogadores, mais a expansão Navegadores (Seafares), gentilmente cedida pela Grow Jogos para uma resenha em meu canal Alan Farias - Direto ao Ponto
Was always struggling to find players as my brother and I enjoyed this a lot. Own the Mayfair edition which doesn't look the best (as ugly as Mayfair's Tigris & Euphrates).

A new classic that everyone should own. Can be a bit harsh on any player that takes an early lead and the end game is a little stretched out but still better than the 3 hour, Death by Monopoly that this should replace in every family home!
I'm really not a huge fan of how much luck is involved but the game is a great gateway game.
My first game and still a solid game.

These days it feels too random, but considering I haven't played any game as much as this one, and still enjoy a game now and then, this needs to be rated high. It is an absolute classic. The dice rolls can make or break your game, but there is strategy involved to mitigate some of that.   This is a game that is extremely easy to teach someone and is a great way to nudge someone into the hobby.

It's hard for me to comprehend that this game is not rated higher. It's perhaps the reason for all of this that you see around you. For most Americans, this is the reason we don't associate board games with risk and monopoly.   That said, Catan is the high school girlfriend that you remember fondly but have moved on from. You might still make out with her when you're home for the holidays, but otherwise you'd rather mack on the classier college girls with their lower back tattoos and PBR.
Classic. One of my first; one of the best.
Minimum of 3 Players - Game Night Favorite
Classic Game. We should all have in our house
Only will play this with the Cities & Knights expansion.
Resource management and settlement construction on the mythical island of Catan. It's a classic of course and really deserves its status.
La componentistica è stupenda ed è il valore aggiunto per un gioco sempre uguale nelle varie versioni giocate.
good breezy game tho i find myself a year into playing it craving depth -- a bit luck-driven. esp good with non-gamers. i prefer with cities and knights expansion.

I only occasionally suggest to play this, but I will always say yes to an offer to play it and enjoy it. So definitely between a 7 and 8 on the scale, leaning towards the 8 end.  It's not a brain burner, but it does require both light strategy and light tactics.  Negotiation/wheedling skill can be a large factor, but I haven't ever seen the game totally thrown by one player being particularly good at cajoling others.  This luck factor in this game tends to be blown out of proportion rather frequently here at the BGG.  Yes there are dice rolls involved, but the game gives you plenty of opportunities to mitigate the effect on you, if you wind up far behind and out of the game once then it may have been die rolls.  Twice in a row, then it probably is a bad strategy not a 'luck' issue.
My first german game. Beautiful, colorful and very very funny.
RULES: ***** STRATEGY: *** TACTICS: *** LUCK: *** PLAYER INTERACTION: ***** REPLAYABILITY: *** THEME: **** BALANCE: **** DOWNTIME: **** ACCESSIBILITY: *****

I bought this in Oct 06.Played it a lot online (mainly cities & Knights) and enjoyed it a lot ... so decided to introduce it to the family.  We had played a lot of heavier games (eg Caylus) and so buying SoC may seem a retroactive step but it is undeniably good fun (except when the dice go against you!!)As usual I tend to lose
